Red paper lanterns everywhere, streamers, dragons, flowers, festive music, and bits of Chinese culture sprinkled throughout. It was a lovely experience. This place was super modern with bits of modern art baked into the walls. Nice restaurant space, great mood lighting.

The service:
As a whole the servywas nothing spectacular. The young man who severed us was polite, tentative, accurate, and space, so for that I appreciated him. However when ordering he made no suggestions, pairings, fan favorites, etc. Not bad service by any means, he just did not engage with anyone at the table. 

The menu:
The menu is pretty extensive and for someone who is slightly unfamiliar with traditional names and staple dishes in Thai cuisine, I found myself googling a few things. There were also two "secret menu specials" in celebration of CNY. And there were ladies walking around with trays of small treats - a fried wonton, and FRIED GRASSHOPPERS! 

The food:
We wet our whistles first with a glass of sparkling rose. We ordered the samosas to start - the one thing I forgot to snap a photo of. They were absolutely delightful. Crispy flaky pastry she'll filled with potatoes and heaven. And the spicy curry sauce that came with it was stellar. (Also worth noting, the samosas come with 3 pieces but we were able to up that to four pieces so we could each have one.) Between the four of us we ordered the Red Curry with crispy pork belly, Yellow Curry with chicken, the Tom Yum seafood noodle soup, and the Tom Kha coconut soup.  The seafood soup and the red curry were delicious. I would definitely recommend ordering ride to go with the curry as it doesn't come with it. But it was still quite tasty. The seafood soup was a little more tangy (think vinegar flavor...‍) than I expected it to be, but the noodles were cooked well, the seafood (shrimp, calamari, & scallop) seemed fresh and was tasty. ! I had never eaten grasshoppers before tonight...but it was an exciting adventure that I'm glad I did but don't ever need to do again ...it came with a few larvae along with 3 full grown grasshoppers. The grown ups were kinda tasty, salty, crispy, kinda like a kettle cooked potato chip. The larvae were tasty too, but the texture was kinda weird...not mushy - just dry and fibrous? 

The price:
Most of the apps are around 6-12$, salads around 15-19$, curries for 15-19$ and main entrees for 16-47$ (most of those being between 21-28$). A little rich for my blood considering the whole experience, but it wasn't the worst. Our bill was 172$ for 4 people, so roughly 45$ per person, for 1 appetizer, 4 glasses of wine, 2 beers, 2 curries and 2 soups.

All in all a good meal, good service, good restaurant. Would recommend.
author: Taylor D.

description:
SUPER FUN PLACE But very pricey for Thai food. 

It's easy to rack up a $70-100 bill for w2 people if you're not careful. You get swept away by the entertainingly colorful servers and by the beautiful dishes that you almost don't mind. 

I love how unabashedly fabulous this place is. And honestly if you aren't following them on Facebook, you are missing out on some weekly entertainment!
author: Joshua L.

description:
The restaurant's name tripped me up, but don't let it you. And don't let the kitschy decor, read flashing lights, gold sparkling figurines, and colorfully
clad servers, deter you, either. Seemingly authentic and tasty dishes at Farmhouse Kitchen. Add the fact that staff is attentive, service is timely, and venue is lively; and you got yourself a solid 4 star resto. Not a 5 star because there were a few missteps. 

I waltz in with two buddies, no reservations and yet we get seated in abt 15 minutes. They were definitely busy but the hostess let us know that if the four top reservation didn't arrive, we could snag the table. Yass! 

Menu is straight forward and most, if not all of my go-to fave Thai dishes were there. My dining companions and I ordered the following:
- Thai sausage appetizer was decent. Small sausage for three - sliced into several slices with thinly sliced cucumbers, shredded carrots and ginger and peanuts to accompany it - was tasty and left you wanting more. A tad overpriced tho.

- Yellow curry, Thai spicy had a good flavor and wasn't too hot. However, IMHO after a few bites all I could really taste was the chili oil. And it looked it too! Nice that the veggies remain crisp because nobody likes over cooked veggies in curry/soup. 

- Tom yum noodle soup, Thai spicy with mixed seafood was delectable. I only had a couple sips of the broth but man was it tasty!! A true seafood rich broth with good coconut flavor, as well. My dining companion gave the seafood two thumbs up for freshness and serving variety. However, there was too many noodles. And thin egg noodles? Meh.

- Pad ka pow was my main dish. It's what I order to measure how good the Thai resto is...and it could have been easily one of the best I've ever had (top 3 for sure!). Great minced pork to peppers ratio. Just the right amount of heat. Nice that there wasn't dry and "gravy" tasted great over rice.

-Rice was blue! Like smurf blue. Odd, but it was jasmine rice and didn't bother me. One of my dining companions, however, couldn't get past the color and left 3/4 of the serving untouched. 

- Kick boxing bowl was surprisingly good. Big bowl with extra long straws reminded me of rum concoctions I've ordered at tiki bars, but this was nothing of the sort. Sparkling, slightly fruity and sweet, it was easy to drink and appeared endless.

Definitely a pleasant dining experience. Fun vibe and apparently a good place to celebrate a birthday as there were four celebrated that evening with drums, cymbals, song and pretty fruity treats. I'd go  again if I have a hankering for Thai and I'm in the area.
author: Marie B.

description: Favorite thai place in SF because of the fried chicken. Everything else is pretty standard--they also have some nice desserts and other dishes, but the star of the show is the fried chicken. Super crispy, comes with generous portions of rice, curry, and roti... amazing. The interior is also quirky and fun, but really all I care about is food so yeah. The fried chicken.
author: Linda W.

description:
One of the best Thai spots in SF. Entertaining staff and lively environment. Highly recommend going for dinner as it's a vibrant crowd at night. Recommended dishes:

-Neua Num Tok Rolls (grilled wagyu flank steak wrapped w/ mint, cilantro & cucumber)

-Mieng Kum Kung (crusted tiger prawns with tamarind sauce)

-Pad Thai with Prawns or Chicken

-Hat Yai Fried Chicken (potato yellow curry, blue rice, roti bread and fried chicken breast)
author: Alex B.

description:
Long story short. Very poor service and poor food. 
1-Ordered Tom yum soup was too salty, the first time he brought it out was in small bowl for one person but I ordered the boiling pot for 2-3 people that's one mistake. 2-DO NOT try the Papaya salad! I can eat anything with spicy, but It was too spicy that made my tongue and lips NUMB. Asked the server he said it is only medium, but he didn't ask how spicy we wanted.  
3-ordered Thai fried rice with no taste at all. 
4-We waited for30 minutes before the main dishes were served. Less than 30 mins later, the servers kept reminding us that the people of the next reservation was waiting for our table. I couldn't enjoy the dinner at all with this rude service provided. 
I came here based off the reviews on yelp, but it is totally disappointing. This was the first time and the last time.
author: Andy K.

description: The best thing was the red curry vegetarian with purple rice(pretty hip). We also had the papaya salad, veg summer rolls and chicken pad Thai ( which was overly sweet and disappointing).
author: Prarthna A.

description: This place is super cute and we ordered several foods to try from the "Mieng Kim Kung" crispy tiger prawn, Samosa, Hat Yai chicken, Volcano noodle and some rice platter from their special menu. All the food is so yummy. Beware that the volcano noodle can be too spicy.
author: L D.

description: great place to relax and eat! one of the best Thai spots I have ever visited so far in my life! Will visit again to have a nice time and food
author: Linares C.

description:
BEST Thai food I have in San Francisco. Great ambience and dining experience! From the decor to serving plates, everything is traditional and sets a clear ton for this restaurant. Wait staff are also dressed to match the theme. 

Hat Yai Fried Chicken- Beautiful presentation, large enough to serve 2 people. Blue rice is visually stunning, yet does not taste too different from regular rice. The yellow curry is not over-powering, it is quite light but is perfect to bring out the flavor of the chicken. The chicken has a VERY thin crispy crust. The meat is SO juicy, lean and tender! I would describe this as a light and healthy version of fried chicken. There is no grease, no fat, and no guilt to eat it! 

Pad kee mao- such a simple dish, but mind blowing! The noodles are so soft yet not easy to break, and it is SO flavorful with different types of spices balancing with mild heat.  After trying this dish, I realized the many pad kee mao I had at other places cannot compare. Although this seems like a simple dish, I highly recommend it! The portion is on the small side though, do not expect this to keep you full. 

I have come here a few times and have tried many of their dishes. Farmhouse Thai cooks meat really well, you cannot go wrong with any choice of protein. Prepare to wait on weekends if you don't have a reservation, this place gets busy! Parking is reasonable, pretty easy to find parking within a few blocks. A little pricey as Thai food goes and portion is generally on the small side, but it is well worth it. Really excellent high quality food, will come back for sure!
author: Karen C.

description:
one of our favorite places to eat in San Francisco. the food is incredible, the dishes are unforgettable. 

must-try dishes: the vegan fresh rolls, Neua Num Tok Rolls and Hat Yai Fried Chicken !

the drinks are great as well, you can get a whole fresh coconut or my favorite wine is the delicious "Offering" 

Oh and if you're lucky they might be having a celebration! Sometimes they bring around fried crickets :)
author: Frida P.

description:
UNLIKE ANY Thai food you will have! Hidden gem of the Mission. Great food and fun dining experience! 

[FOOD]
- HAT YAI FRIED CHICKEN [5/5]: Flavorful and tender fried chicken, comes with blue rice, yellow curry, and roti bread. The combination is so lovely. It's a perfect balance of carbs, protein, and fat, and also savory and sweet. The curry goes with everything - rice, roti, or even the chicken! Not your typical fried chicken also - very thin, crispy skin. 100% recommend! 

- 24 HOUR BEEF NOODLE [4/5]: Large bowl of noodle with beef (rib?) that melts in your mouth. This is the perfect comfort food. The soup does not leave you feeling thirsty. 

- YELLOW CURRY [4.5/5]: Recommend if you like sweet curry! This curry is like of like the one from the Hat Yai Fried Chicken. It comes with potato pieces and roti bread. Recommend to order with pork belly! They add a nice chewy texture to the curry. 

- PAPAYA SALAD [3/5]: Flavorful but very spicy! You can tell that it's made fresh because of the nice crunch to the veggies. But the serving size is pretty small and 50% of the plate is cabbage. 

[SETTING/SERVICE]
I love the set-up of this place! Lots of open space and natural sunlight, and not too crammed. The long tables sort of give this place a "farmhouse" feel. Even during the busiest hours, our food was ready within 10 minutes. I have been here 3 times and the service have all been very nice and quick. 

[PRICE]
Recommend family style so you could try different dishes! Each entree ranged from $14-25. It is a little pricey for normal Thai food but it's worth the value. Expect to pay ~$20/person. 

[PARKING]
Pretty easy to find street parking around this area of the Mission!

This has become one of my favorite places to take my friends to when they are in SF. I have been here 3 times in the past 2 months, and I have not gotten tired of it. I'm looking forward to my next visit!
author: Wendy F.

description:
I enjoyed Farmhouse but beware parking is a beeeyotch. 

My partner had the fried chicken plate while I had the $26 Penang neua braised rib . The fried chicken was super flavorful, crunchy and the lightest batter I've had in awhile . It tastes like a puffy little cloud of chicken fat . The blue rice was standard and it also came with curry and roti. I feel like you could share between two people if you didn't eat much . The curry was flavorful but jus

My short rib was so tender and falling off the bone . It was a rich sauce that coats the tongue a bit sweet for my taste but i just added a side of fish sauce and peppers (make sure to ask for thier condiments)

I love that the restroom was clean and roomy , service was great I'll be back if i want to try some more Thai dishes with a higher price
author: K N.

description:
I had been hunting for a halfway decent Thai restaurant in San Francisco, only to be disappointed again and again. Finally, I tried Farmhouse, and it was incredible! It's not quite the traditional Thai restaurant experience you might expect, but it is tasty and fun all the same. 

I have only ever been for dinner, when the lights are club-like with lasers and it is so dark it's even difficult to read the menu. The ambience is rowdy, if it's your birthday they will do this little parade and sing you happy birthday. The servers I have interacted with are very fun and dressed festively. It's pretty loud inside, so not a good place for an important conversation, but it's a great place for a fun meal with friends. The wait can be excruciatingly long- but it's always gone by faster than they estimate. Last time they said 90 minutes, and we were seated within 45 minutes! It's definitely worth the wait if you do end up having to hang out for a while. 

Now for the food- I have tried the panang curry, yellow curry, fresh rolls, lotus cookie dessert, coconut latte, and the tom kha soup. Everything has been outstanding. The curries are extremely rich and flavorful, and they are served in deceptively small portion sizes. I would highly recommend getting a few things and sharing! The coconut latte is incredible but is pretty sweet so I would recommend it more as a dessert than anything else. I am obsessed and cannot wait for my next trip to Farmhouse Thai!
author: Ayushi A.

description: So fun and delicious.  The music was a bit loud, but the whole ambiance felt like an underground club that served excellent Thai street food.  We got the fried chicken / curry plate (very good) and the drunken noodles, which were among the best I've had -- and I've had an embarrassing quantity of drunken noodles.  Very recommend yes thx.
author: Sara H.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. Nice place, good location, the prices are ok.
Thai food is already one of my favorites, but this place makes me enjoy it even more. The staff wears traditional clothes and at night it is even more beautiful, wearing traditional clothing, music and drinks and dishes with beautiful decorations.
My favorite dish is the Pad Thai, but everything is very good. It is always full so I recommend book a table in advance. :)
author: Raquel I.

description: Such a fun and festive place, and really good food too! Definitely reminds me of my time in Thailand, so was so happy to find this place. We lucked out on Friday night and got seats at the bar. Yes, it's expensive here, but the fun atmosphere and authenticity makes it worth it. We got the 24 hour beef soup (delicious, super flavorful, meat falls off the bone- only thing was it was 4x as expensive as the same bowl I had in Thailand, but considerably bigger as well), the sausages (super yummy!) and the fried rice with pork belly (this was just ok). Overall, such a fun and kitschy place, totally encapsulates the cheesiness of Thailand along with the yummy authentic food, just a bit pricey. Would definitely return for a fun weekend night out with friends!
author: Vivian D.

description: When I tasty food one word came out from my mouth Woohoo! I am happy to eat these tasty food love you team
author: Bhramaram G.

description: Hands down my favorite Thai restaurant in SF. I've ordered the entire menu pretty much as I've been there over 50 times. Favorite dishes are the wagyu rolls, coconut crusted prawns, short ribs (love both the rice and noodle bowl versions), pad see ew, papaya salad, earth tea, and curry prawns. We did a triple birthday party here and had a blast. Really a perfect spot for a group dinner. It's insanely busy for dinner every night so make a reservation unless you wanna wait hours. It's super easy to eat there during lunch though, even on weekends.
author: Julie N.

description:
This has been one of my favourite restaurants overall in San Francisco, partly because the food is delicious but also because I really  liked the atmosphere. It's a very lively and colourful place though - definitely not quiet.   Hopefully while you're there it's someone's birthday.  

It's been a couple weeks so I don't remember exactly what dishes we had (though they were all delicious) except for the papaya salad which was really good and pretty spicy - spicier than what I'd normally be willing to eat but it was so good I ate it anyway.  We also got a noodle dish and a chicken curry that were both excellent. 

They also came around with little bowls of crickets which were actually pretty good and which I'd recommend trying.
author: Sanae R.

description:
MEHHHHH I have for sure experienced better!

Food: .........crickets....waiting for what makes this place special....

Price: RIP OFF! big time

Portions: wait what? where is the rest of my food?

Service: only good thing here.
author: Hank B.

description: Authentic Thai food. Ginger milk tea provides a warm welcome in the cold weather. Noodles are good. I especially like the dessert, which is a combination of durian and sticky rice. Love the dessert!
author: Yunzhu C.

description:
Absolutely loved the food. We had the Tom Kha soup, which was delicious and I ordered the Hat Yao Fried Chicken which came with really crispy chicken, hot, flavor-packed yellow curry, soft palathas and blue jasmin rice! A lot for 1 person but leaves you full and tummy happy. I need the recipe for that yellow curry!!
Will definitely be returning to try their desserts!
author: Diya M.

description:
Great food! Lively crowd! Definitely a local favorite! Very quick service! In and out if you are in a rush, otherwise sit back and enjoy their great food! Extensive menu with interesting selection of soups, noodles, rice and main entrées all with authentic THAI flare! 

We enjoyed Tom Kha Gai with chicken in coconut milk with curry and wonderful mushrooms, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, scallions, and at least a half of chicken cooked to perfection! Highly recommend  and plenty to share! We also enjoyed their THAI fried rice with Pork. Many dishes can be substituted with either pork, chicken, seafood or vegetables. The rice was cooked perfectly and the vegetables were extremely fresh with great Thai spices. 

Good selection of beers and wine! I recommend their delicious Thai Ice Tea! 

Location is a little difficult for parking so be prepared to search for an open spot or take mass transit or Lyft if you are already in the City. 

Great lunch! We'll definitely be back!
author: Barbara n.

description:
This restaurant is insanely picture perfect..an IG setting from the antique sewing machine as the host stand to the basket table blooms to the bathroom decor. Yes, it's that cool-not to mention a special guest list you can sign up for when in the potty room.

A lot of different menu options from your typical Thai to more culinary delights as a fusion. For instance their chicken dish came with rice, a soup/sopping bowl with roti and flavored crispy chicken with a can-I-dip-into-this-again sauce.

Pad see mow came out quite spicy-the dishes pack heat! Flavorful food, lovely ambiance and great for groups.

Warning: place is packed like a can of sardines at noon.

I cannot wait to try out the other dishes. I was hoping that there would be a roti and sauce appetizer but didn't see one.

Lots of beverage and tea options as well.
author: Summer S.

description:
4 stars
One of my favorite Thai spots in SF 

- Ordered: ahi scoops, chicken satay, fried chicken over rice, some curry noodles on the daily special menu, seafood Tom yum soup, beef rolls, mango sticky rice, special cocktail bowl 

- Food: My favorite dish to order each time I come here is the Fried Chicken with curry, roti, and blue rice. We got the chicken satay and the sauce for it was superrr spicy but good. Everything here is very tasty, but I could've skipped the Tom yum soup here. 

- Service: The food came out quick and the service was friendly 

- Additional comments: definitely make reservations because it gets packed all the time
author: Chelsea H.

description: Love love this place!!! The 24 hour beef noodle soup is so delicious! The broth is savory and has a little kick to it and the beef rib falls off the bone! Their prawn pad Thai is also tasty! They have these huge wish I could find the pic. The fried chicken with the curry and roti is also delicious!
author: Queenie L.

description:
This place was lively, fun, and very welcoming. 

Well decorated and even the staff was dressed up in traditional clothing. 

If you want to embarrass your friends on their bday, take them here!!! Hehe

Must get the Hat Yai fried chicken! Favorite dish of the night. 

The Ahi scoop was just as tasty!

The herb rice salad was decent. I think it taste better if there was no rice. 

Overall, great dinner with great company. I would definitely come back to this place. 

I hope you give this Thai restaurant a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description:
Hi, I do love this place but not the service. 
The food is ok~ the service is a bit terse. But overall, if you know your Thai food, you may be able to tolerate the service. As this was my first experience, I will remain neutral. But the food is nothing spectacular.
author: Giovani T.

description:
I went here with the Fiance' and her family recently and it was a nice sunny day in the city. The food was simply amazing and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The parking around here is kind of slim but you can find parking on the street and surrounding areas. 

You have to try the thai style fried chicken, it comes with roti, panang curry, and blue rice.. super good!!!
author: Miguel W.

description:
Coming from someone who is Thai, I can attest that Farmhouse is one of the most authentic Thai restaurants in SF. The atmosphere is both trendy and inviting. The open kitchen gives you a taste of the food making in action. 

We came for lunch on New Years Eve with two friends and ordered the Hat Yai Fried Chicken, Pad Ka Prow and Pad Thai. The portions are large, but not overwhelming. Those three dishes were the perfect amount of food for the three of us. 

The Hat Yai chicken was my absolute favorite. The chicken was extremely tender and delicious when paired with the curry and roti. The cucumber pickles were a little too sweet for my preference, but still great. 

The service was fast and friendly. I will definitely be eating there again.
author: Pierre G.

description: This place has a fun atmosphere and delicious menu. Came here on a Monday night around 7:30 and there was about a 30 min wait since we didn't have reservations. We ended up only waiting 15 because we took the first available seats at the bar. The most interesting thing was they were passing out grasshoppers for patrons to try. Not my thing but loves the option!
author: Julianne O.

description: Went here with a couple friends and sat at the bar (it was packed!). Service was good - we were greeted pretty immediately. The couple of friends I was with were vegan and there was a great selection for them. I ended up splitting the Pad Ped & rice with my friend & it was really good. Very strong lemongrass flavors. There were lots of inedible things (in my opinion) on the plate which were not great. I'm not sure what you call those pieces that look like a mini grape vine almost (we asked but had a hard time understanding the response), but I would say, don't eat them. The Thai tea w shaved ice was DELICIOUS. A little pricey for smaller portions, but we are in SF. Would definitely go again!
author: Alexa S.

description:
Dinner at Farmhouse Kitchen always turns out to be a wonderful experience. I've come here with large groups several times and it's definitely a crowd pleaser. The food is fantastic, the ambience is fun, and it's near some cool Mission bars to grab drinks at afterwards.

I've enjoyed everything I've tried so far and my favorites are:
- Crispy calamari 
- Hat Yai Fried Chicken (comes with blue rice, with a slight floral flavor)
- Grilled Prawns Pad Thai (great twist on a classic)
- Beef short rib (meet falls off the bone and melts in your mouth)

The food is plated on fun, orange and white dishes and is great for sharing family style. There's something for everyone, but it's hard not to want to hoard every dish to yourself. It's all so good!

It's easy to reserve on Yelp ahead of time, which makes it ideal for larger group parties or a date night. Head around the corner for drinks at Trick Dog or Southern Pacific Brewing following a fabulous meal.
author: Shira W.

description: Loved the chicken platter and the drunken noodles! Friendly staff and great ambience. The seating felt a little cramped but I feel the restaurant is loud enough for you to not be bothered with it.
author: Chinmayi K.

description:
I come here once every few months for dinner as it is right next door to my gym. There is usually a 30-60 min wait during peak dining times so I like to roll in maybe 30 minutes before closing after the crowds have passed. Reservations are recommended! The energy here is great for a fun night out with friends. I still have not gotten tired of their birthday song routine. I recommend any of the below items which are my go-to's. Apart from the regular menu, I really enjoy how they prepare special street food snacks and walk them around old school dim sum style to each table to offer to guests or sold up front for you to snack on while waiting to get seated. The plating is also beautiful and great for pictures :)

Ginger milk tea
Vegan rice rolls
Prawn pad thai
Yellow curry (also served with the fried chicken)
Slow cooked beef short rib
author: Alice H.

description:
Absolutely delicious. Thee best Thai food in San Francisco, also might have some of thee best cocktails. This place looks and feels like a neverending party. From the lights outside, well lit on the inside, kitschy posters on the wall, fun young staff, bar, and semi-open kitchen. 

A little pricey for what you get, both on the food and drinks side. Service is relatively fast and friendly. We've never made a reservation, have never waited for a seat, and this place is always packed. Since we live across the street, we also tend to go during the middle of the week, no clue what its like on the weekends. Unique flavors that I've had at no other Thai restaurant, we tend to skip the curries and order the Street Food. 

We love you Farmhouse kitchen!
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Arguably San Francisco's best Thai restaurant. We went during Thai New Year and got to experience a really joyous celebration.. think men in drag, a live band, gifts for patrons, and a special menu.

The food here is always so good. I recently returned from holiday in Thailand and not sure the food is completely authentic but almost everything is delicious. The curry with pork belly, papaya salad, larb and fried chicken are all outstanding dishes.

Tip: Definitely order dessert as they are all phenomenal. And reserve in advance to avoid long waits.
author: Arijit P.

description: Average food at above average prices. It's just average street Thai food. Get off your high horse. I can't for the life of me understand all the 5 star reviews.
author: J J.

description: Dishes are less sweet than other Thai places; very fresh prepared; hands down the best Thai in Mission. Make reservation ahead!
author: Souris L.

description: Exciting vibrant place with a lot of hype among young techies and affluent people. Beautiful ambience and intense south Asian flavors and exotic ingredients. There are even staff carrying baskets with food on banana leaves. Definitely rushed because it's so popular there may be a time limit on the table. Over all, good place to try. Pricey. The flavors are a bit like Kin Khao but more refreshing more intense. It is probably too salty and dim and rushed for me so i don't think it's worth the price. But a popular place for sure
author: Dilys S.

description:
Went there 5pm on Saturday and got seated right away.  Be there early. 
 Service was great.  Food was delicious !!   A bit pricey for Thai food ($30 for lamb).   Will love to try other special dishes.
author: Stanley L.

description:
The 1star is for their lack of customer service.  The guy who greets you at the door and the guy (same person?) who answers the phone needs basic customer service training.  I called to make reservations, but there was so much background noise that he couldn't hear me.  I spoke louder, then he accuses me of yelling at him and hangs up on me.  I call back, this time a lady answers.  I ask to make reservations, and can hear the same guy in the background saying something to the lady.  She then tells me all reservations are booked up...but we can walk in and "probably" get seated.  Oddly after hanging up, I am able to make reservations on Yelp.  
Customer service is a huge part of the dining experience, especially when you're paying over $40 per person.
Many other great Thai restaurants to choose from in the Bay Area than to have to deal with this.
author: L W.

description:
Came here with some close friends visiting from out of town and we left with our bellies and hearts full :) 

We started off with some Thai iced tea, which was the perfect amount of sweet and creamy. 

From the recommendation of our server, we ordered the yellow curry, fried chicken, and the Thai fried rice with house pork belly. The winner of the night was definitely the fried rice because our server had a really indepth knowledge of their chili sauces and she knew the right one that would go well with the pork belly. So spicy but so good!
author: Ashley L.

description: Sent in a Yelp pick up order a few days ago, but when we went to pick it up, we wished we had dined in!  The atmosphere and ambiance was great!  Tropical Thai party!  They had music going and the whole staff was dressed accordingly.  We agreed we definitely needed to come back to dine in! The food was great as well...the Pad Thai wasn't like any Pad Thai I've ever had before, but still delicious nonetheless.  We will definitely be back!
author: Lynne T.

description:
Upscale/trendy thai food! Very cute restaurant with very tasty food! 

The menu items are little bit on the pricey side and the portions are individual portions that aren't really meant for sharing.

Bathrooms are kind of weird in that it looks like it's roomy enough to be multi-stalled but there's only one exposed toilet and a bunch of sinks. Lock the door once you're in.

Parking is available on the street.
author: Erika L.

description: It ordered the Red Curry with Chicken and Blue Rice. It was beautifully delicious. Great vibe. The staff was amazing!
author: Leo N.

description:
Not sure why when I typed in best thai restaurant and this place popped up.

I had out of town guests and even they were disappointed from Alabama.

First off it's way to expensive for the quality and portion.

Second, the service is good, but only when you can catch them.

My noodle soup was lackluster. Think ramen broth meets store bought noodles and place some meat on that and charge $30 and you have my dish.

My friend's meat dish had blue (Smurf coloured rice) which she said was too salty, and my Thai tea was like a snow cone with all that ice.

The coconut ice cream was melting when we got it, and frankly wasn't all that good.

Overhyped, and not worth us driving to the Mission for, that's for sure.
author: Jack R.

description:
I am a huge fan of this place. It's a fun, casual, delicious Thai spot that has been given the crown title of "Best Thai food in the Bay Area" by my unqualified non-Thai friends.

Prices for each dish generally run between $10-$25 and it's a family-style spot. Or you can be "that guy/gal" who doesn't want to share. Your call.

I would highly, highly recommend reservations to this spot. Even though it's off the beaten path and very unassuming, this place gets CROWDED. 

Appetizers: Samosas, Thai sausage, ahi scoops, and beef rolls. Bite-sized portions of everything to share. Good enough to get all of them. and that coconut curry sauce that comes with the samosas is a winner.

Entrees: You have to get the fried chicken. It's not your standard fried chicken at a thai restaurant. Maybe it's the fancier organic chicken breast, but this is delicious. I've pretty much gotten every other entree  else on the menu (we came in a large group)

Noodles, noodle soups, fried rices are all worth getting. They serve some "street style" foods (e.g. crickets) which is probably worth trying to say you've tried it before but probably will regret once you tried it if you have a squeamish personality.

Summary: Fun spot. Can accommodate larger groups. Get reservations. Enjoy.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Food 4/5. Service 5/5. Ambiance 4/5. Bang for your buck 4/5. 

A little off the beaten path (literally, it's kinda hard to get too unless you Uber/Lyft), Farmhouse is a refreshing thai place that doesn't do typical thai dishes. In a way it's thai fusion spin that somehow keeps the flavor very authentic and rich. 

The atmosphere and service is great. The staff members are very attentive and always willing to help. One of the dishes was too spicy, and they were nice enough to take it back and remake it. For the price, the entrees are well proportion for a thai place in San Fransisco (almost too much food). 

The dish I got was the Hat Yai Chicken which consists of a fried chicken, yellow curry with potatoes, roti, and blue jasmine rice. It was delicious as the roti went delicious with the yellow curry. The blue jasmine rice was fragrant and went great with the yellow curry as well. The fried chicken was golden brown and delicious as well but I only wished that the chicken was a little bit crispier (not as crispy as I would hope). 

Overall, this restaurant is great and is well worth the trek, however, I always leave feeling something was missing from my thai experience (I have yet to figure out what it is, but It's pretty minor). 

Tips - Get the fried chicken! If you are feeling for some noodles get the boat noodles, you won't regret it. 

Pros - the portions are great with high quality food. 

Cons - Out of the way to get too!
author: Brian N.

description:
So easy to make reservations, good for groups, awesome location, and delicious Thai food enjoyed in a cool, relaxed yet trendy atmosphere.

They're Michelin recommended so that tells you a lot about the quality and taste of the food. 

I loved their Papaya Salad with multi-layers of green papaya, mango, green beans, shrimp, and delicious spices (I remember it to be quite spicy). The Turmeric-marinated BBQ Chicken served with black sticky rice is also very juicy. Soups and curries are also authentic and jam packed with multidimensional flavors.

The portions are generous, make sure you gather a group of 4-6 so you can you all can eat family style, share a larger range or variety. 

Sometimes the waiters carry around these baskets with bamboo sticks and inside are these little coconut sticky treats that are worth a try!
author: Janny S.

description: Everything on the menu is bomb. Keep in mind its family sized portions so great for sharing. Unless you want a whole big meal to yourself, I recommend getting a few things on the menu to share with your party.
author: Chris E.

description:
Came here on Mother's Day. It was a long wait to get seated but understandable. The service was excellent and the food was spectacular. My partner is from thailand and it's tough for me to find a Thai restaurant that can impress him. But farmhouse made it happen! Everything we ordered reminded him of northeast Thailand, Isan region. We also love the ambiance. The music was upbeat but not distracting. Also love the decor and the birthday songs with drums. Glad to find a Thai place that's unique and authentic for once.

What was also nice were the food carts that came by and offered us to try a quick street food style dish..... highly recommended and would definitely go back when we're in town.
author: jay n.

description: one of the best thai places in san francisco. you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. i love how they put condensed milk shaved ice in their thai tea. the servers are extremely attentive; my glass is never half full there. parking is really good for being sf. also a great place to celebrate your birthday!! they have one of the most engrossing birthday celebrations
author: Rinah A.

description: Came here around 6:45 and was told the wait would be around an hour, but only waited for about 20 mins for our group of 4. The restaurant does get packed quickly and service is a little slow. But that doesn't mean the service was bad. Not your typical thai restaurant where you go in and order a cheap plate of pad thai. This is a place where you go and enjoy your food. Although the music can be a little loud, but the place gives off a sense of good vibes. And the food definitely stand out from other thai restaurants. Yes, it is a little pricey for the amount you get. But it's all about the presentation and taste. You're paying for the environment, and to have a good time. Would definitely be coming back because I am already craving for the curry sauce that came with the hat yai fried chicken
author: Emily H.

description:
I love this place, though I think I like its sister restaurant Daughter Thai more! The food by itself from here wasn't very impressive, though that is most likely due to what I ordered. The thing about these restaurants is that everything comes out looking so amazing, but there are definitely some very average-tasting dishes. I wouldn't come here for takeout, but it's a nice place to meet up with a friend!

I ordered the Hat-Yai Fried Chicken because I am a fried chicken fiend, and everything about it looks so good on paper. I would say to skip on it though - it was moist and crisp and fine but there was just no Thai flavors - besides the yellow curry that came on the side, which also wasn't anything special. 

Next time I go to Farmhouse or Daughter Thai, I'm definitely trying the 24 hour beef noodle soup - I saw a bunch of tables have it and that beef rib looked incredible!
author: Allison Y.

description:
Came by for lunch the other day with a same morning reservation via Yelp to compare this joint with Lers Ros on Larkin. Farmhouse is located in a up and coming area of the Mission. Parking is strictly street only and there are numerous homeless on the sidewalk, lots of broken glass on the street along with rubbish scattered throughout the street...

The interior is upscale, modern, and surprisingly welcoming! This 2017 Michelin Recommended joint was worth the hype!

Started off with a few appetizers. The tuna with wonton chips were tasty and flavorful as the tuna had a nice kick to it. 

Moved on to the Thai sausage which was a smaller portion and very flavorful. Sausage wasn't too dry either.

Last appetizer was the Thai fish cake which had a phenomenal presentation, flavors that were on point, despite a smaller portion, compared with Lers Ros.

Thai Iced tea was pricier than most although it was strong and flavorful.

Highlight of the meal was the Hat Yai fried chicken which lived up to the hype. Portions were huge and perfect for sharing. Fried Mary's chicken breast was very juicy and flavorful. The roti and curry dipping sauce made this dish over the top!

Service was pleasant as well.

~$37/head after tax and gratuity for a hearty lunch.
author: Derek S.

description:
What an experience! LOVE this place!!! This is the type of place that I would book to impress my parents! Reservations are highly recommended because this place gets pretty busy. I would also want to come here for my birthday because they really have a party for you! They bring out instruments and the whole party for you! 

Why I was here // Decided to make reservations with my bf to treat ourselves to a nice dinner date. We made a wonderful choice! I also heard from some fellow SF friends that this place was pretty tasty, so it made me want to check it out even more! 

Service // Excellent service! We had reservations and we had to wait a bit while they set up our table, but they were all so friendly and helpful with explaining the menu and answering any questions we had. 
While we were eating at the restaurant, I thought it was pretty unique that they have a server coming around offering their signature specialities like grasshoppers and other seasonal insects. 

Food // 
-"Mieng Kum Kung" // 13.00 // Tiger prawns with coconut, tamarind sauce, with a leafy green. Definitely one of my FAVES! 
-Tom Zapp Beef // 15.00 // not extremely spicy, but this rich broth is excellent! The beef falls apart and melts in your mouth. 
-Panang Neua // 25.50 // Extremely tender slow braised short rib with flavorful curry. I also really enjoyed the blue rice. SOOO GOOD. 
-Ginger milk tea // 4.50 // REALLY LOVED this drink!!!! Probably on the top list for speciality drinks
-Coconut Cream Latte // 5.25 // Also, really good! But the ginger just has a stronger kick, the kind that warms your soul. 
-Dessert // forgot the name, but we got something that reminded me of a Hawaiian roll with coconut, butter, sugar and coconut ice cream topped with a cute umbrella. 

Overall // I am already looking forward to the next time I can make a dinner or lunch trip here! This would be the perfect place to take my parents! And honestly this is probably some of the best thai food in the city!
author: Emily T.

description:
Delicious! Expensive. But hip. I personally love this place but I love it better when I avoid ruminating on the slightly cringe-inducing prices on the check at the end of a meal. Also, I'm not a huge Thai fan but dig this place for its more creative dishes and judicious use of curry or sauce, which can often be overwhelming in typical Thai restaurants, IMO. It's great if you want a fun interior, free range chicken with your rice, or a slightly creative take on your Thai favorites.

Also, extra points for making fried crickets seem tasty. (Or at least worth trying.)
author: Dulma T.

description:
Be prepared to FEAST.

Came for dinner on a Saturday evening, and we were told the wait would be an 45-1 hour. Didn't make a reservation. Luckily, Farmhouse is close by to many good spots like a brewery and my favorite cocktail bar.

We dipped into Trick Dog a few feet away, had drinks then came back when they texted me. The best part is that the service at Farmhouse is friendly and so beautiful. Everyone there is so full of love and smiles. The music is super festive, and the decor and colors at Farmhouse give off such a party-all-day vibe. Great spot for groups, date, or family.

The food is the name of the game here. Their samosas are so good. Flaky and veggie-friendly--GET IT. Boo ordered the chicken legs which a guy walked around carrying, almost reminiscent of street vendor style ordering in those Southeast Asian countries. Chicken legs are 2 for $3, which he said was yummy but not really worth the price (better bang for your buck at dim sum spots). The prawn pad thai is delicious and the noodles are cooked to perfection, but a bit too sweet. Red curry is so flavorful, and well enjoyed with jasmine (looked blue/green!) or their sticky rice which comes in a bamboo cup. Portions are humungous. We definitely overate for 2 people...and even had to take our rice home to eat tomorrow. 

In all, the food is so delicious, and even sitting at the bar or at a communal table will be fun. There aren't purse hooks at their bar seating, but you do get full view of their drinks being made and extra pickled veggies if you ask nicely. Most of their cocktails run on the sweet side, but their flower spritzer is more refreshing with elderflower and bubbly. I had the Ya-Dong set, which is a set of 2 shots that come with a Singha back. The best way I can describe it as a Taiwanese kid is that one tastes like the herbal chicken soup my mom used to make me drink when I was on my period, and the other red one tastes like super old Chinese herbs that you imagine when you watch old Asian time period shows.

Prices are affordable for SF standards but on the $$$ side. We basically paid $40 per person for our feast--but we did order too much. It feels like such a party, and we weren't even celebrating anything! Music and the hustle and bustle makes you feel like you're enjoying street food in the comfort of a modern and clean restaurant. I would totally come back again, but expect to wait.
author: Jodi H.

description:
Do it for the culture they said. So I went and got to experience some of the Thai culture but since I've never been to Thailand, it was hard to know whether anything is authentic. But authenticity is tricky when it comes to food because in my opinion, good food is good food. Authenticity be damn because the "real" versions of any popular dish may be a real crapshoot. 

Farmhouse gets kudos from me though. Their wait staff seem to be Thai and the menu had some great dishes, both in presentation and taste.  We tried the steak roll appetizer and the meat was amazingly tender. It wrapped with cucumbers, mint and other flavorful things that I couldn't make out but it was delicious.  Pad Thai was okay and I wish it had more noodles. I think this was more presentation than anything else. They also only give you two prawns with it. Really? You're better than that Farmhouse! Lastly, we also tried the beef short rib that was tender off the bone. It had his curry like sauce that I used to mop up some of the blue rice. Highly recommend for meat lovers out there.

So if your thing is to bring Thailand over to America in the Mission District of San Francisco, you may be more critical than I am. However, if you're an amateur foodie like myself, then you'll like this place. Plus, you can drink right out of a whole young coconut.
author: Quoc N.

description:
Omg what! This place was AHHHMAZING! The atmosphere is lively, the interior design is colorful and the staff were so nice! I love the food here as well. I believe we came here before dinner (6PM) because it's usually packed. Would definitely try to reserve because it's not super big, but it is very popular!

The food portions are big! I had to share about three different types of food with one other person. Full to the brim and still had leftovers! I love Thai food and this seems like the place to get a real authentic meal ran by real Thai people who know their Thai.  

10/10 would recommend for a delicious meal!
author: Tianna N.

description: The food was kind of expensive but that was the only reason for the missing star. Other than that, this restaurant isn't an ordinary Thai restaurant. The staff including the waiters, bartenders, hosts really put together a charismatic theme with bright colorful wardrobe and random burst out of song especially bday songs. It was a cool surprise after a long day in SF. The food was excellent, I got the pad Thai and it was one of the best I've had. I paid around $17 for a plate tho :( anyways. I think I would still visit again just because I love the outfits and their best dressed queen is my screensaver and I love it haha
author: Lindsy H.

description: I love the fun ambiance and friendly service here. I think the food is good but for me a little overpriced.
author: Michael L.

description:
I've heard about this place for a while and I've been wanting to go to this place for months! I think it lives up to the hype but too bad the wait is always so bad here. We had to wait around 30 - 45 minutes and this was around 8 pm for three people.

All in all the food is pretty good. We had the green curry, the pad see ew (I think) and the ribeye special. They were a bit pricey, but it was pretty good so can't complain there. The appetizer was pickled vegetables and those I didn't really like, I'm not really into pickled things.

I'd highly recommend this place, but you should try and get reservations here! This place had a lively atmosphere, cute interior decoration and all the staff wore some traditional, tikki kind of looking outfits which was kind of cute as well. At least the food came out decently fast as well.
author: Christopher L.

description:
décor: hip, modern, eclectic restaurant - I was confused, and intrigued by the restaurant upon initial entry
parking: limited, but free, parking in the area
wait-time: during dinner hours, about an hour
service: friendly and attentive 
price: pricey; approx. $3-$5 more than the hole-in-the-wall average
food: legit thai spicy- the one thing that I didn't like about this place was the fact that the least amount of spicy available is "medium", which means that all their flavoring sauces are pre-made in mass amounts. The veggie spring rolls ($11) came with a nice peanut sauce, and the papaya salad ($14), even with medium spice on the side, invoked a heated sensation in my mouth. The green curry ($14 + $2 rice) was spicy surprisingly spicy as well, even though no "spicy icon" was noted next to the dish. The Tom Yum noodle soup ($16) was surprisingly not spicy, and had more of a lemongrass flavor; but this dish on the menu had a "spicy icon" next to it.

They have a spicy challenge here, to be completed in 15 minutes. The workers here come out in party hats, flashing lights, a mega microphone, and sparklers so you become the center of attention when completing the challenge.
author: Victoria X.

description:
I LOVE this place. It's a unique restaurant and you don't really want to come here by yourself or with a party of 2. Definitely come with 4+ people. This place is fun because of the atmosphere and the food is meant for sharing since the portions are huge. Since their menu is extensive you really want to try it all.

Also they do a huge splash if it's your birthday. Great place to celebrate.
author: Ellen C.

description:
This place is just awesome! Very eclectic with waiters in Muy Thai boxing shorts and all kinds of funky attire. The food has never disappointed. The birthday celebrations look unusual and fun. 
Definitely a must visit.
author: Vicky S.

description: So delicious! The food is a bit pricey but the food and service is exceptional and worth it.
author: Erica J.

description:
Hidden gem in the Outer Mission, for sure. Can't even remember how I first found this spot...but there's a ton of great spots around this one block radius (Trick Dog, etc)! Farmhouse Kitchen has got the vibes of an authentic bustling Thai street restaurant (minus the street feel) - you'll get it once you're there! 

Tip 1: make reservations if you're planning ahead. This place gets PACKED. Tried coming here once at 7:45pm on a Saturday and was told it'd be a 1.5hr+ wait. No, thanks. Made reservations for tonight's dinner...and by the time my group was leaving around 8:30pm, there were still at least 6+ groups waiting to be seated? On a Wednesday night! 

Tip 2: add some buffer time prior to arrival to find parking! Parking is really a hit or miss around this area. Now with all the apartments and restaurants and bars in the area, it's a bit tougher :/

Tip 3: share the dishes! They're HUGE. I can never finish my own entrees. And I always get apps on top of the entrees. This is by no means a cheap dinner spot, but they compensate that with their extra large dishes. They're honestly shareable sizes. 

Tonight I had the fried calamari and seared tuna for apps. For my main I had the green curry with seafood. Even though all my dishes sound pretty basic, Farmhouse's seasoning game is real strong! The fried calamari paired with the perfectly homemade(?) sweet and sour dipping sauce. And my green curry had just the right amount of kick, topped with fresh seafood and greens. I thought I was really hungry before dinner, but couldn't even get through half my curry! 

Our particular server could've been a bit more lively, but he got the job done without being rude. There's a lot going on, and definitely a fun environment overall.

All in all, Farmhouse is a great spot to come by once in a while! Am I going to spend $45 on dinner every night? No. But would I come back for a fun get together occasion? Yes. 4 stars!
author: Jennifer L.

description: Cute spot! Colorful and vibrant food as well as atmosphere. The occasional traditional live music adds a nice whimsical touch to your dining experience.
author: Yad L.

description:
Get their fried chicken in yellow curry and blue jasmin rice. It's what made keeps me coming back. The fried chicken has the quality of korean fried chicken, which is juicy and perfectly crispy - and pairs amazingly with the curry.


Lively atmosphere and great staff - this is a place you want to bring friends when they're visiting SF.

I'm taking off a star because although the food has been great and atmosphere amazing, I'm getting a sense that the consistency of the food might be slipping due to its increasing popularity - so sometimes the higher-than-average prices aren't justified compared to other Thai restaurants which might not be as lively and festive with similar great tasting food
author: Ka L.

description: I came here with some friends for dinner whilst visiting the city and absolutely loved it! The first surprise was the check-in man who was dressed like the Chiquita banana lady, for lack of a better comparison. I enjoyed a glass of cab and felt happy for my friends who got the elderflower spritzer cocktail, which was amazing! As for food, we ordered a few dishes to share. I was underwhelmed by the vegan spring rolls, but loved the yellow curry with purple rice, the pickles we were served on being seated, the broccolini (although it was a bit heavy on the garlic) and the ice cream dessert that we shared that cake with a cookie and whipped cream. If you have a birthday, definitely let them know for an added surprise.
author: Jana B.

description:
This place is kinda a corner spot in a more industrial area. It doesn't look like much from the outside but once you step in, it's grand, ginormous, very open, and very chic. It feels like you've just been transformed into another world. 

The presentation is really good and the service is friendly and attentive for the most part. The food is more fusion than anything else but it is hard to be heard as it gets pretty noisy. It's also on the pricer side of things but probably not really that much by SF standards. 

I think they only have one large unisex bathroom for such a large space because it's almost always occupied as I tried to wash my hands a few times.
author: Lana W.

description: Absolutely the best Thai food I've had, hands down. I've lived in San Francisco for nearly 16 years and there's lots of Thai food - good Thai food - all over the city. But this was above and beyond. The flavors were perfectly balanced and incredibly delicious. The textures were wonderful and even familiar dishes - like fresh vegan spring rolls - were several steps above what you'd find anywhere else in SF. On top of that the atmosphere and aesthetic was bright, colorful, welcoming and fun. And the service was exceptional. I can't recommend it enough and I can't wait to go back!
author: Chris O.

description: This place is amazing. Definitely top Thai restaurants to choose from. The crab fried rice was very tasty and they servers walk around with appetizers and you can try them on the spot. Highly recommend this place.
author: Vinayak P.

description:
AMAZING VIBRANT AMBIANCE & MAMA'S KITCHEN TYPE OF FOOD! must go!

I wouldn't remember what we ordered, given it was my birthday, but I know everything was tasty, great quality, and such a beautiful presentation! I mean I felt like I was on a mini island with a few of my best friends!

The night I went it seemed to be everyone else's birthday, (go May-babies) but the place was poppin wit fun greets, the traditional restaurant bday greet, and a fun hat to wear.

Like I said, order anything from the menu and you won't regret! soups- on point, meats, just go!
author: Ruth Awit S.

description:
Let me start off by saying that this is one of the best places I've eaten thus far in the city when it comes to Thai food. 

I came here for a birthday dinner. They definitely know how to celebrate birthdays lol

This place is meant for sharing, the portions they serve are very big. 

I had the hat yai fried chicken, it was savory, good, and did not disappoint. It came with blue rice, curry, and roti bread.

The chicken pad kee mao was delicious. The Tom kha was amazing. 

My friend had the Tom yum noodle soup and she loved it. My other friend had the crab fried rice, he said it was good but he wish there were more crabs considering it was a pricy dish. 

We ended the night with a birthday song and the Ruk Na platter from the dessert menu. It was delicious. Very pricey but you get what you paid for, you get about 6 items on that platter, let me tell you, it DID NOT disappoint. 


Overall, I highly recommend this place. It is good for groups. You should definitely make reservations. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. This place gets super busy so come here early if you want to do walk in check in. Parking is pretty bad, you'd have to circle a few times to find a spot.
author: Myly H.

description:
This place was great! I took my family here last week since they were in town and I wanted to take them to a place that was Asian and trendy. I couldn't be happier. My sister got the ribs, my husband got the salmon, my mom and I split the pad thai. It was so good! The ribs beautiful looking that I really wish I took pictures. The meat fell off the bone and I snagged a few delicious bites; it was so soft I could pull the pork off the bone with my fork. The pad thai was perfect. All the food tasted was really solid, but the presentation is what sold it; everything looked beautiful.

The atmosphere was super cool too. The lighting we good/bright so I could see my company and food. There were little disco balls/light that weren't particularly intrusive, just neat to look at. The seats were pretty comfortable. 

As for the staff, they were great. Our waiter was super friendly and helpful. Everyone was attentive. Their outfits were so cool. I don't know if it's a uniform or just what they decide to wear, but it's all cute, like gender non-conforming Thai garb with jewelry/neck pieces, it's hard to describe but everyone looked fabulous and I was very impressed. 

I also had the Thai tea which was unique in presentation. The tea was in a shallow glass with a shaved ice ball on top, soaking it in like a snow cone. It was a very fun way to drink a traditional beverage; I felt like a kid I was so happy.

The bathroom was clean, private and large. With an awesome rainbow painted on the wall (ceiling to floor). Even though there was only one toilet, there were two sinks, which earned this place some points for just being corky. 

All in all, I'd recommend this place if you want to show someone around a unique and fun experience with good food. It made my day and I'm glad my mother and sister got to enjoy a very San Fransisco restaurant while in town.
author: Ealon H.

description:
Farmhouse Thai is probably one of my favorite Thai restaurants. Although not exactly authentic, Farmhouse makes up for it with its unique take on Thai cuisine and its energetic vibe. The food is superb and of high quality; what sets it apart from other restaurants the ornate decoration, most of the dishes are jazzed up! I come here at least once a month.

Service is authentic, actual Thai people, and they are lively and amiable. Despite having a pretty large venue, with respect to being in the Mission, they fill up quite fast during prime dining times, but you can reserve ahead of time.

I've ordered (* favorite):
* Hat Yai fried chicken - comes with paratha, blue rice, curry + potatoes, syrup, pickled veges, and fried chicken. The chicken is juicy, the macro nutrients are balanced, and it's a large portion!
* Ginger milk tea - super foamy
* Thai iced tea
* 24-hour beef noodle soup - large portion, huge tender rib, tasty broth
fish cake
samosa
crab fried rice
papaya salad

Most items are on the more expensive side, between 11-30$.
author: Sean W.

description:
Food taste is great, and presentation is solid. Overall I like the food, but I do have some issues here. 

First, the place is always busy, and extremely loud, so be prepared for that. Also, the ordering to-go is part of the same process as waiting for a table, so it gets very crowded at the front of the house. 

I ordered the Chicken Wings appetizer, and for $11 I received 4 small wings. Nothing special here, just majorly overpriced wings. Should I have received more than 4? 

I also ordered the Grilled River Prawns Pad Thai. This was delicious, but again at $23, overpriced. I guess this is the new norm for SF, since their pricing in general is VERY expensive for what you get. 

Overall these dishes are/could be great, but Thai food in general is not meant to be expensive. At most these dishes are worth $13-$17. But given the atmosphere there, and new money, I'm not surprised. I used to go here a lot, then stopped, but sadly I won't be going back.

*UPDATE* The comment from the Resturant missed my point about pricing. I received 4 dry wings in a plastic to-go container for $11. That's completely unacceptable. Don't patronize me based on selecting "more affordable" food options from the menu. The Pad Thai tasted great, but $23? The only reason it's $23 is because you're rent is most likely overpriced, and you pander to the elite crowd who's more than happy spending that kind of money on Thai food.
author: Steve P.

description:
Came here with a group of ten last week and was super pleased with the experience and food! This place is definitely Michelin rated for a reason! We put our name down around 7:30 and waited 30-45 minutes to be seated (not bad given our group size). They're nice enough to call you when your table is ready, so you can roam around the area (Trick Dog hello!) while you wait. 

To start we all shared the Tom Kha soup with chicken. It came in a flame pot to keep it constantly warm and it was dynamite! The chicken was shredded and cooked well and the soup itself had very rich flavor - on the sweeter side as far as Tom Kha soups go, with good balance established with the cilantro. Pretty sizeable portion given 10 of us all had a bowl with some to spare.

For mains I had the Papaya Salad and the Red Curry. Okay so the Papaya Salad was easily the BEST Papaya Salad I've ever had, and I pretty much thrive on Thai food. Fair warning - this dish is spicy! But in the best way possible if you can handle it. It had a great crunch from the peanuts and chewy dried shrimp. Just an explosion of flavors and textures in your mouth. Would highly recommend for those not afraid of spice.

The Red Curry was equally fantastic. It had a rich flavor just like the soup with lots of basil and actually came in a great portion size. We ordered the blue rice to accompany it. To me it didn't taste special but hey, it's blue and that's perty cool. 

Ambiance is very comforting and warm! The decor is awesome - you'll be sure to notice the faucets on the wall. 

Farmhouse is just a fantastic place to come for a satisfying meal in a warm environment. :)
author: Sabina S.

description: I went to this place for the first time and I loved it! Not super traditional Thai food but the flavors and the spices has me craving for more. Try the volcano ramen noodle dish. Yum! If you like spicy food you'll be fine, I'd go for mild next time even mild was spicy and I love spicy food.
author: Biby B.

description:
I've found my new favorite Thai Restaurant!  

We came here on a Saturday night with a group of 5.  We were worried that the wait would be long, so we came here early (around 5:30 pm) and surprisingly didn't have to wait at all.

Ambiance and decor are very tastefully done and modern.  They had beautiful peonies all over the restaurant, as well as vintage collectables.  So cute!

The food was extremely impressive (the hype is REAL).  I will flag that the papaya salad is extremely spicy (they give you a heads up when you order).  We ordered it "medium", and I could barely finish my small portion.  The samosas were also really good, and came with an amazing curry dipping sauce.  Our whole party enjoyed the crab fried rice (very generous portion of crab) and the pad see ew, as well.

The real star of the show was the Hat Yai Fried Chicken.  I'm typically not a fan of fried chicken, but this is not your typical fried drumstick.  The dish came with a large filet of crispy, flavorful chicken breast, with a very generous bowl of curry sauce and another sweet/honey sauce.  The curry sauce is delicious and I wanted to pour it over everything!!!  The dish is also paired with crisp roti and blue rice.  My mouth is watering just thinking about it.  Our friends who recommended the dish made us get 2 orders of this dish because they knew we would have been fighting over it.

This place is AMAZING and I can't wait to return.
author: Michelle M.

description:
This is the BEST Thai restaurant in San Francisco. Seriously. 

When my friends ask for recommendations on where to take their tourist friends, or coworkers, or parents, or significant other -- I tell them the magical words "Farmhouse Kitchen." These two words eventually have them messaging me a profession of love (caused by the post-meal food coma bliss).

Semi-traditional, happy, hip atmosphere. Farmhouse Kitchen somehow gets across the fun San Francisco vibe without being annoyingly industrial. The staff is also incredibly friendly and helpful! 

Food-wise:
- Hat Yai Fried Chicken is the best dish and always my go-to. It comes with the most tender and juicy chicken, and a variety of other awesome tastes that keep you shoveling food into your mouth. I'm a HUGE fan of the roti bread dipped in yellow curry. And you'd think fried shallots would play a small role, but it really rounds out the texture and flavor of the whole dish! 
- Mok Salmon and 24 Hour Beef Noodle Soup are runner-ups. The meat in both of these dishes is melt-in-your-mouth tender. I've also gotten the Pad Thai (when I'm on a budget) and while it doesn't hold a candle to the other dishes, it's tasty enough. 

Tip #1: Splurge on the fried chicken. It's worth it. 
Tip #2: Set a reservation on Yelp or OpenTable. There's always a line outside this place at peak hours.

The only negative aspect of this place is the price. But for the food and atmosphere, I'm willing to take the dent in my wallet every once in a while.
author: Christine L.

description: Delicious place. We went with a group of 20-30 (there were so many of us it was overwhelming). The majority of the dishes we ordered were family style which made it easy to pass down the table to share. Everyone basically ordered whatever they wanted and a few appetizers. EVERYTHING we had was tasty. Will definitely return. Service was great, timing arrival of dish s and drinks was spot on. It is a cozy place with a small bar.
author: Michelle F.

description: Farmhouse Kitchen is incredible. The food, the staff, and the atmosphere is amazing. I highly recommend it for both casual dinners, as well as special occasions. The best dishes are the soups and the crispy chicken!
author: Ernesto P.

description:
I'd say that here is the best Sai-uua (Northern Thai's sausage) in the bay! Plus if u have w/ sticky rice OMG, hella yummm(the main reason why i rate them 5 stars). Also Meang-kum w/ fried shrimps, even it was not Thai traditional style but its taste still remind me about The dish.

They offered us some fried grasshopper as well, so weird but i taste nothing.

Coconut ice cream which they called yim yim something was not worth they should add more sticky rice, corn , beans or something that represent more Thai fresh coconut ice cream style, quite disappointed but  btw its taste was good. 

Mok Salmon was a little bit over-cooked but over all was good. It came wt a huge piece of salmon.

I do like their creativity and the way they present Thai culture via their dishes and the decoration. I'm so delightful to see my root-culture in the way they represent.
author: Tiratiwan L.

description:
Surpassing expectations.  Tasty food.  Had the northern Thai sausage, herb rice salad, roast pork, and pork belly curry.  A bit pricey -$120 for two people, but SF prices stopped phasing me a while ago.

But most annoying part of the dinner is when they bring out ice cream for birthdays and their loud banging gongs and trying to make the birthday person wear a ridiculous "Thai" hat.  I wonder if that's just a ploy to amuse the westerners.
author: Bailey N.

description:
I love their papaya salad. By far the best I've tasted in the Bay Area.  It is Thai style papaya, so it was juicy and limey. I would say it is a bit pricey for the papaya salad. 

We also had the Pad See You, which was pretty good as well. The quantity was smaller than expected. The fried rice was okay - tasted like typical Thai fried rice.

I thought the Thai tea was pretty creative! Never seen anything like it, however, it tasted okay. Definitely would come back for the papaya tho!
author: Kimberly D.

description:
Yummy yummy food! 

This place is very popular and gets super packed. We tried calling on Friday at 6 pm to place an order, but no one picked up. Luckily we were nearby and were able to walk in to place our order to-go. The wait was 20-30 minutes, so we left and came back to pick up our food. 

The Pad Thai, Pad See Ew, and curries are all amazing. A little on the pricey side, but totally worth it. Love the food here and will be back!
author: Jaching H.

description:
Their fried chicken is a must here! The batter is so light and crispy! This place can be a bit noisy, so trying to talk to your friends about how their engagement went was a bit difficult to hear without shouting "WHAT?" several times. The atmosphere here is very lively and makes you feel like you are in Thailand. I thought it was pretty cool how they had a lady walking around with a bucket of freshly fried calamari. Of course we had to get a plate!

Food:
Hat Yai Fried chicken - AWESOME! So crunchy and juicy at the same time! It wasn't too greasy where it left you feeling heavy at the end of the meal, which was great. The blue rice, roti bread and yellow curry added a nice touch to the dish.

Tom Yum Gai- Lots of flavor and really good! Usually some places make it too sweet, but this place made it justttt right. 

Green Curry - WARNING! It is quite SPICY for those who can't take spice. I love spicy foods and even then it was a bit spicy for me, but I loved it nonetheless. Great flavor and spices!

Overall, everything was excellent. Service was great, food was awesome, atmosphere was fun and lively. A bit loud, but still enjoyable. Definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves to escape to an exotic country for the night!
author: Lisa H.

description:
My wonderful friend took me here to Farmhouse Kitchen to experience some amazing Thai fusion cuisine. Super super busy but luckily Yelp Reservations made it easy for three of us to dine without worrying about having to wait for a table. 

I was intrigued by the concept of this restaurant, and in particular one dish that was described as a must try: the Hat Yai fried chicken. I have to say this dish was pretty interesting. On one hand you have this delicious curry which is complemented by some blue rice. On the other side you have this amazingly crispy fried chicken with this delicious sauce. The chicken is really well done though - when you bite into it is moist and soft but the outside is nice and crisp. Top it off with some naan bread on the side and you got a full meal. 

For $19.50, this meal can seem like it costs a lot, but I can assure you that its worth every cent. Because the portion is pretty big, I'm not sure that most people actually can finish it. I must be an exception to the rule however because this meal was so delicious I couldn't let it go to waste. Overall, a great restaurant in Mission District, this one will definitely be on my radar whenever I'm in the neighbourhood.
author: Justin K.

description: Celebrated my birthday here with a group of 10 people, and it was awesome!  Great food, fantastic service, and entertaining.
author: Dustin S.

description:
The food is good.  Maybe I need to try more authentic dishes......wait!  I ate fried grasshoppers!  

Truly this restaurant is an event. You eat in circus colors (the rice is blue!) and the decor is similar. The costumes are gorgeous and colorful, and the service is good.  It's loud.

It's just way too much fun eating here.  I recommend it for small birthday parties and other celebrations.
author: Thelma Lee G.

description:
Love this place.  I eat there every other month or so.
It's a little kitschy, in a charming way.  The food is excellent and within normal SF prices.   The staff is friendly and seems to be enjoying themselves.    
If you want a giant cocktail, you can get it.
I've always ordered 'family style' - a few large items to share with friends.  I'm not sure if 1 or 2 people could find much variety without overeating, but I see couples having a good time there, frequently, so ....  must work.

Sometimes there is a wait to get a table.  
Parking nearby is usually better than average for SF.
author: Steve B.

description:
4.5/5. Some of the best Thai food I've ever had and such a fun atmosphere/decor! Definitely a very authentic Thai experience, with a very enthusiastic host to add to the vibe. I would recommend making a reservation as most of the 6:30-8pm restaurant times get taken. I did arrive on time for my reservation, but still had to wait about 15 minutes before I got seated. However, the servers were so kind as to give me a free desert for the wait, even though I really didn't wait that long! It really shows that Farmhouse appreciates their patrons and want us to have the best experience. 

[Dinner]
I ordered the 24 hour beef noodle soup. The give you A LOT of meat and the soup was extremely flavorful. It seems that this is a highlight for the restaurant and I would definitely come back for this dish! My friend ordered the yellow curry. It was alright, I wasn't super impressed with the curry or the hyped up purple rice (even though it was really pretty to take pictures of). 

[Drinks]
Highly recommend the fresh coconut. I really like coconut water, and they top off the whole nut to the brim and bring it out with a spoon so you can scoop the meat out after. I want to come back and try the beautiful cocktails.

[Decor]
I think 50% of the reason to dine here is definitely to see the work of art that is the inside.

Overall, definitely a must-try if you enjoy authentic experiences. I'll definitely be back for the 24 hours beef noodle soup!
author: Alice Z.

description: When I'm at work and drop off at sf general I'll do a take out order from here. It's not cheap but the food quality is always good.
author: Hide M.

description:
SOOO GOOD and spicy like I LIKE IT. It's very rare that I say this but THIS PLACE IS SOOOOO WORTH THE WAIT. 

Swung by on a Sunday after doing an event with my company nearby on Mission. It was kind of early for dinner (around 5), but this place was paaaacked. The wait was 40 minutes, but even though we were hangry we decided to just go with it and grab drinks while we waited. We ended up getting to the bar and being confused, but finally ordering a COCO-LADA, a drink with coconut cream and a bunch of other goodness. Refreshing and a good way to calm the hangry nerves.

After finally getting sat at about 50 minutes, we were famished. The server came by quickly and grabbed our drinks. We started with a large TOM YUM soup which came out slowly, but was suuuper tasty. BE WARNED, this soup is Thai spicy, not commonplace spicy. About 10 or so minutes after the soup came out the entrees were sent. We got the EPIC FRIED CHICKEN and the special they had that night called the LARB MOO. The chicken was easily some of the best fried chicken I've had in the city with a great crispy outside and tender inside. It was juicy and just had an overall great taste. The Larb was actually just a salad kind of dish with a side of sticky rice. It also was good, but again the spice level here is on the high side. I might pass on this one next time, but loved how it came as an assortment of goods. 

Loved the professional attitude and overall positive vibes here. Def coming back!
author: Daniel O.

description:
Awesome food!! You know an asian restaurant is authentic when they don't water down the flavors of the food. We ordered the papaya salad with fermented fish sauce and it was good! (The stinker, the better) They even have a fermented crab sauce option. Came in for my bestie's grad. dinner on Monday night & the place was quite busy (maybe it was graduation night too?). Aside from the papaya salad, we also ordered the sausage, beef salad, & roasted pork belly. The beef salad was so tasty as the sauce had a savory, vinegary flavor and the beef was tender. I'm usually not a fan of roasted pork belly but this dish was an exception - they seasoned it with a chilly powder along with roasted rice powder. 

The ambiance of the place was casual. At first, it didn't look like a thai restaurant until you walk in where the employees are dressed in traditional clothing along with the decor. Service was friendly with food coming out accordingly and servers were always on top of water refills. Based on other yelp reviews, parking can be a hassle as there are limited parking in the busy streets, so we've decided to uber here. Overall food was delicious & service was awesome - will come back when in SF.
author: Shirley C.

description:
I came here for a friend's birthday with a party of 7. We loved most of the food and the desserts we ordered. I especially liked the Num Tok beef rolls which were delicious. 

The ginger milk tea won the day. It was by far the best ginger milk tea I've had. I would definitely to back to have it again. 

The only draw back is that they wouldn't sit us till most of the party was there even though we had a reservation,  they had just opened the restaurant and it wasn't packed at all. On the bright side,I got to try the ginger milk tea while waiting at the bar :-)
author: Adaeze E.

description: AMAZING THAI FOOD! Not only is super tasty and comes with good size portions, but it is uniquely and beautifully presented to you. The service was quick and super friendly.
