Kin Khao may be one of the most renowned Thai joint in town, but Farmhouse is by far the wildest!
author: Suany W.

description:
I love this place. I am recently gluten free and this place is perfect for the gf peeps who crave Thai food. Before my gluten sensitivity, I would get the chicken and blue rice. The chicken is cooked perfectly where the outside is crispy and the inside is juicy. It also comes with a side of roti and curry dipping sauce which is tasty as well. The consistency of the sauce is a bit watery but I didn't mind. The last 2 times I've been there, I ordered from the gluten free menu and got the crispy pork belly fried rice. Yes, both times (within a week) because it is that good! The fried rice was flavored nicely and more importantly NOT oily. The crispy pork belly has a lot of fat but I thought it paired nicely with the rest of the dish. The servers are friendly, attentive, and great with making suggestions. For dessert, I tried a bite of the bread pudding and it was okay..nothing special about it. I wasn't fond of the texture but mixed with the ice cream it wasn't bad! 

The only thing about eating here is that it's gets super loud so if you're trying to engage in a deep conversation, you may want to sit super close or save it for after dinner. 

I am coming back for you crispy pork belly fried rice !! Get in ma bellay!
author: Brigitte M.

description:
Amazing food, extremely loud so you can barely talk with people within your table. Music is too loud so it's annoying. 
Even do you have reservation you use to wait for at least 20 minutes.
author: Catalina S.

description: I've been here 4 or 5 times and I have to say this spot is perfect. This place deserves Kin Khao's Michelin star. All dishes I've had are incredible, authentic and of high quality. Favorites include the northern Thai sausage and curry noodles. This restaurant has a really strong atmosphere so come ready to drink fruity cocktails and party.
author: Narek A.

description:
5 stars for the food! But had to knock one off because it was a little on the pricier side. (We also waited about 2 hours, but that was to be expected coming on a Saturday night.)

My friends and I did family style. We got the 24-hour beef noodle soup, the chef's special, the panang curry, the samosas, and the pad thai. Everything was so delicious!!

The beef from the noodle soup was heaven--it was so soft and smooth. The pork belly from the chef's special was also amazing. And the sauce that came with the samosas...yum...

The food aside, I loved the interior of the restaurant and just the general atmosphere of the place.

YES! I will definitely be back.
author: Elaine L.

description: Crappy food at a high end price. This joint would fit perfectly in Palo Alto (save Mademoiselle Collette).  Just go to the Mitchellin Star Thai joint if you want quality upscale Thai food.
author: Dan M.

description: This place is tucked away in a more industrial area. The decor is fun, and the staff was friendly. Reservations are recommended. The food is spicy in gwbea
author: Cody H.

description: I just can't give a place 5 stars when the food is expensive and the portions are tiny I got the Pad Thai, the plate it came on was so little I thought I was a joke. I think our server was annoyed we weren't ordering drinks even though it was a weekday, he gave the vibe he had better table to serve. I love thai food, but I won't be back to this place, I'm sure I can find better and cheaper. However I must mention the others in my party enjoyed the food and didn't complain on the portion size but did wonder why mine was so small- o well
author: Alison J.

description: This Thai food is one of my favorites! Their jasmine rice and panang curry is very delicious. Their drinks are very good as well. I look forward to eating here and every time the food is consistently well cooked.
author: Mon B.

description:
My boyfriend and I made a reservation here for a Sunday night and for my 21st birthday celebration. When we arrived, we were seated almost instantly and we ordered the vegan spring roll starter, yat Thai chicken, and the pad kee mow (?). We also ordered the classic Thai tea and an elderflower spritzer. The food came out very quickly and was DELICIOUS! Some of the best Thai food I've had. Highly recommend the yat Thai chicken and if you're looking for a light starter, the spring rolls are perfect. Another great thing about this restaurant was the service. My boyfriend mentioned to our server that it was my birthday, which resulted in a fun hat, Polaroid, complementary dessert, and birthday song. We left without picking up our Polaroid and the server ran after us to hand us the unexpected gift! 
All in all, I will definitely be returning here when I visit SF again. Hands down one of my favorite restaurants with great food, service and accommodations-- I highly recommend it. Thanks for making my 21st so fun!
author: Jj S.

description: Really yummy comfort food served creatively in a nice setting. The fried chicken and sauce was delish!! Will be back!
author: Stephanie L.

description: We had a couple of dishes delivered and the food was just OK. salad was too spicy to eat, even for someone who likes spicy foods. Penang curry with tofu was decent.
author: K C.

description: Really fun atmosphere and amazing gluten free options. The food was delicious and flavorful.
author: Rachel M.

description: This place was fantastic! We tried some new things & some tried & true standbys and everything was wonderful! If we're back in San Francisco, we'd definitely go back!
author: Sarah E.

description:
I loved the modern atmosphere and interesting Thai dishes here. Service was exceptionally friendly and attentive. 

We walked in without a reservation on a weekend for a group of 4 and there was only one spot available at a small table. I'd definitely recommend getting a reservation beforehand. The table was a little too small and we could barely fit all the dishes we ordered on there.

We got the street fair baby shrimp fritters ($9) as an appetizer. I thought this was just okay and probably would try something else on the menu next time. Highlight of the meal for the entire table was the 24 hours beef noodle soup ($18). The beef was extremely tender and the veal broth was so flavorful. It is the perfect dish for cold San Francisco weather. The panang neua ($22) was tasty but if you're going to get beef short rib I would go with the beef noodle soup. The pad thai ($14) was good but didn't stand out to me. Really enjoyed the spicy eggplant side dish ($9). There were great garlic and basil flavors!

Overall excellent choice for Thai food especially if you're looking for a nice dining experience.
author: Linda X.

description: This place is amazing...food and owners!! The avocado curry and spring rolls are my favorite so far.
author: Gypsy C.

description: Quaint and charming setting, delicious food, kind and friendly staff... what more could one want? Will be back!
author: Kat L.

description:
The wait was long but worth it. Came here with a small group and we ordered the Pad See Ew, Pad Thai and Green Curry. Everyone was really happy with each dish.

The restaurant has a fun atmosphere. Looks like it'd be a fun place for a birthday dinner.
author: Iva M.

description: I love this place- delicious thai, friendly servers, cute place, and beautiful food. Plus, they take reservations so it's easy to get in. PLUS PLUS they deliver. For free. Sold!
author: Hannah S.

description: It's very disappointing to walk into a place that's has a last seating policy 30 minutes before closing. Why not just adjust your hours to reflect when you can actually show up to an establishment and enjoy yourself. I've had the food, and I'd probably rate this place as a 4 Star based on that and the attentiveness of service. But hunger is a very basic need and telling me I can only order it to go is not what I was seeking. I'll be back, but feeling burned won't make me as regular as I might have been living a couple blocks away.
author: Zachary T.

description: Pricy wine list and meal but a delishous restaurant. I sat at the bar so my food was served relatively quickly. Need to make a reservation or wait 20-30 minutes otherwise since this place is busy during peak hours
author: Paven S.

description: We drive up from LA just to eat here. It's wonderful. The food is sooooooo good, the atmosphere is so much fun and the staff is stellar. Never disappoints, just gets better.
author: Nicole J.

description:
Got 2x food orgasm the last time I was here.
The first from the main meal and the second from the desert.
It's expensive here though so beware.
author: Hung Q.

description:
Really, really delicious new Thai place in the Mission. But be warned, you're probably going to spend around $30 if you order food and drinks. (Worth it, at least every now and then.)

One thing to immediately notice is the decor, which is kind of modern and hipster. There's one wall that is pretty distinct which is entirely covered with sprinkler heads (no idea where they got them). Definitely not your typical Thai place decor. They also have really huge single bathrooms, which are kind of overkill. (In the words of my coworker, "I think the reason why we have a housing problem in SF is these gigantic bathrooms.")

In any case, the food is fantastic. I've ordered the Mok Salmon and the Panang Neua (braised short rib), both of which feature incredibly juicy and tender meats that are served with flavorful sauces and soft blue rice. I'm a big fan of the blue rice, but willing to admit that it may just be the blueness tricking me into thinking that it's special... I've also stolen bites of several other dishes from my fellow diners (friends, not random people), which have also tasted amazing, so I think it's fair to say that you can't go wrong with the menu here (especially the "Specials" section).

There's also a wide drink selection, of which the whole young coconut is my favorite - cool, refreshing, and naturally sweet. Plus you can scrape out the juicy fruit insides when you're done! It's super tempting and I usually end up caving and ordering a coconut even though I think is a bit too pricey at $6.50.

Finally, they accept reservations online via Yelp, which is always a plus. Definitely will be back for some amazing Thai food (and to gawk at the huge bathrooms)!
author: Brittany C.

description:
Such an awesome spot! I would say hands down some of my favorite Thai food that I have eaten outside of Thailand. We started the meal with young coconuts which I thought was neat. We all certainly got our fill of tasty coconut water. The appetizer selection was impressive, I would have eaten almost everything on it! The beef rolls were so, so, good. The beef melted in your mouth and the sauce they put on it was fantastic.

For my main dinner I went with the fried chicken. The presentation of the dish alone was really impressive. The dish was great and the curry dipping sauce that came with it really complimented the fried chicken well. The dish was huge and could have easily been shared by two people. The blue rice was tasty, just your standard rice.

Now on to the piece de resistance, the dessert tray. It was my birthday and they put a candle in it which I always appreciate. The desserts were soooo good. I am a sucker for mango sticky rice so that was great. I also loved the coconut ice cream that had sticky rice hidden underneath. 

The staff was so friendly and accommodated our large party without one snafu. Highly recommend Farmhouse Kitchen Thai.
author: Holly K.

description:
How come I've never been here before?! What a fun Thai restaurant. 

I went for the first time this evening with two friends and really enjoyed not only the food but also the ambiance! I noticed that the back wall was decorated with what seemed like at least 50 sink faucets!! The staff were all dressed in Hawaiian shirts, some even with fun eye makeup and hair-- definitely a quirky crew. For a Wednesday evening, it was well packed. 

We ordered the popular Hat Yai Fried Chicken, Thai Street Green Curry Noodles, Chicken Noodle Soup, Pad Cabbage, and Taro and Black Sticky Rice. (Note that the portions are on the generous side. For three petite girls, three main dishes meant lots of leftovers!) 

I ordered the Fried Chicken dish, and it was absolutely delicious! Super juicy and the batter was very nicely done --  a thin, crispy layer that tasted freshly fried! It came with roti bread on top, blue rice (not sure if this is authentic, but definitely trendy), and a bowl of yellow curry. Wow, was that satisfying. The cabbage was decent, nothing super special. Though I didn't try the Green Curry Noodles or the Chicken Noodle Soup, both of my friends thoroughly enjoyed their dishes. From what I heard, the soup was definitely on the spicy side...and if you're adventurous, try the blood jelly in the Green Curry Noodles (which didn't have a super distinct flavor but gave me goosebumps thinking about what I was eating). Our waiter brought out a huge apron for my friend who ordered the Green Curry Noodles, apparently everyone who orders that dish has to wear the special apron, lol. The Taro Sticky Rice was a pleasant finish, which came with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and coconut flakes. The sticky rice had a surprising, smoky flavor to it. It was wrapped in banana leaves and perhaps heated over a grill/charcoal. 

After we finished our meal, we noticed a waiter walking around with a large basket...of grilled insects! Yes, grasshopper and some type of silver worm. Appetizer/dessert anyone?

Haha, I definitely will be telling my friends about this place. Hope to be back soon.
author: Christine T.

description:
This place has great decor and that pretty much it. 
The food was pretty good. I would definitely recommend chicken wings, fried chicken and the crab fried rice. The fried chicken was very crispy and juicy. This is not like your normal KFC fried chicken. We also got the kickboxing bowl and it was delicious. It was lychee flavored with actual lychee pieces at the bottom which was a nice surprise.
author: Steven N.

description:
My experience at Farmhouse was great. I came in with a few colleagues for dinner, we made a reservation but the restaurant was pretty quiet on a Tuesday night. 

We started the meal with a few appetizers. The oysters were fresh and yummy, the deep fried shrimp was also good. 
As a main I ordered a pad Thai - I know, kinda boring, but it's my favorite. I just came home from a trip to Thailand and this Pad Thai was pretty authentic, portion was pretty big and after having the appetizers sharing this dish between two people was ideal. 
One of my colleagues ordered the green curry, when I tried I was a bit food jealous it's very yummy. 

They have beers from Southeast Asia and a few cocktails. I would gladly come back for some more.
author: Fernanda S.

description:
Holy schlamoly! This place was amazing. Not only is the staff super friendly, super accomodating, and generally super awesome, but the food matched their level of awesomeness and then some.

Farmhouse Kitchen provides upscale Thai food with a twist... as well as all of the classic Thai dishes that you know and love. Want pork belly or tiger prawns in your pad thai? You've come to the right place!

We all started off our meal with some fresh young coconuts cracked open to reveal the sweet, refreshing coconut water and tender, delicious meat inside. What a way to begin! We also got some appetizers for the table -- the grilled beef and the spring rolls were both insanely good.

I shared entrees with Mike B, and together we got the 24-hour beef noodle soup (the beef was literally fall-off-the-bone tender, as it should be) and the pad kee mao (drunken noodles) with pork belly and prawns. Yup, you read that correctly. It was phenomenal, the spice level was just right (I asked for medium), the new meats were a fun addition, and everything just tasted SO good.

And as if all that wasn't enough, for dessert (and because it was our dear friend and coworker's birthday), they brought out these insane dessert platters filled with all sorts of Thai-inspired dessert delicacies. Mango sticky rice, coconut ice cream, some kind of amazing and magical monkey bread... oh man, my mouth is watering just thinking about it. 

Next time I'm back in SF, you can bet your sweet bippy that I'll be making a return trip to Farmhouse Kitchen Thai!
author: Gretchen F.

description: Maybe it's just me? I wasn't super impressed by this place at all. I had a reso for 6 of us and they tried to squish us onto a 4 top next to the bathroom :( I asked for one of their larger tables in the middle of the restaurant and was told they could only do that if we left within an hour. I said we could do that as long as the food didn't take forever so the clock started! After that, service was great and food did come out quickly. It wasn't anything special when it came to Thai food in the city. +1 for reasonable parking in the city.
author: Leina K.

description:
Hidden on a dark corner, Farmhouse Thai perhaps had held too high of expectations for me. At 8 pm with lines out the door and a packed house with a trendy interior and hip looking waiters, we eagerly waited for our table. We had a reservation for 8:15, but had friends who were late, so they wouldn't seat us until everyone was there. Our friends arrived at 8:45 and then we waited sadly and hangrily as many other groups got seated before us and as the waiters arranged and rearranged and then re-rearranged other tables.  We finally got seated around 9 and ordered immediately. The papaya salad came first, and was so spicy that we left half of the dish unfinished.  The fried chicken was yummy, but everything else we ordered (minus the blue/green tinted rice) was remnant of traditional Thai fare.  Maybe I was hangry, but I was unimpressed by the food for the price.

This place seems like it would be good for party groups who want to share scorpion bowls.  Maybe just don't be hangry like me and eat earlier.
author: Jenny C.

description: Two words- Penang curry.  Best Thai food in the Bay Area by far.  Also really enjoyed the Hat Yao Chicken.  Definitely will be back multiple times.
author: A J.

description:
Make sure you make reservations because this place can get packed even on a rainy weeknight. My friends and I tried out several dishes that were all delicious, plated nicely, though a bit pricier than Thai restaurants in the TL that are just as tasty. Seems like many people come here for birthday celebrations where they'd sing and beat drums while bringing the special individual a dessert on the house. It's very lively here and even at one point one of the servers was carrying snacks off the menu, such as taro roots and fried grasshoppers, in baskets from table to table for order like a street vendor. Dishes we tried were:

Ahi scoops - tasty and a little bit spicy
Thai fish cakes - these were average
Mieng Kum Kung - Yum! Wish there were more than 3 prawns though
Tom Kha soup - good
Crab fried rice - good though I'm used to more crab
Grilled river prawns pad thai - highly recommend it! Flavorful noodles and the grilled prawns really balances out the flavor
author: Diana C.

description: This is the spot. Delicious Thai food. Good vibes. Tons of flavour. Hit it up if you're in area.
author: Timur Z.

description:
So, I've thought pretty hard about this. Overall I'd say 3.5 stars.

The first time I ordered from here I got the Neua Num Tok Rolls and a large Tom Yum soup. The rolls were decent, and the beef was juicy and quite tender. I think an herb would have tied the flavors together better. I was so blown away by the intense and delicious flavors of the soup, couldn't get enough. I was also sick, and this totally hit the spot. I thought, "I can't wait to order from here again!"

Second time around, had a friend in town and we were craving spicy food, so I suggested Farmhouse. I can't say my second experience was even close to the first. I ordered the Hat Yai Fried Chicken and friend ordered Phad Thai. The Phad thai didn't have much flavor and the fried chicken was extremely greasy and didn't hold the breading. I did however, admire the pretty blue rice. The curry it came with was delicious, and was a little sad at the inconsistency of flavors across dishes. 

Well, at least I know what to order next time! 

Both my experiences here have been with delivery and both times the driver called and asked me to come downstairs instead of bringing it up and no forks, knives, or napkins were included. If you order from here, make sure you have cutlery!

A friend mentioned their restaurant experience is worth trying, so next time I'll probably go in person.
author: Shereen A.

description:
If you tested my Blood Thai Food Content at any given point in time, it would be way more than the legal limit. I eat so much Thai that my delivery dude high fives my husband and people randomly 'wai' to me on the street. It's actually pretty insane.

Basically what I'm saying is I -know- Thai food, 80% of me is comprised of it. 

When I walked in, my senses were immediately treated to an awesome spicket wall, beautifully crafted palm leaf centerpieces, and a giant, fresh coconut. I was immediately impressed, but a part of me was a bit wary since experience has told me that fancy Asian restaurants usually has sub-par food.

I am happy to report that, this is not the case at here at all. In fact Farmhouse Kitchen Thai fits the restaurant trifecta that is often so hard to meet in this day and age:

+ Insane Presentation: My barbequed chicken was served spatcocked on bamboo sticks, very much like how I was served in the jungles of Thailand. Their dessert sampler pretty  broke the Internet with all the likes it got. 

+ Authentically Delicious Food - Complete with traditional Thai condiments and all 

+ Big Portions - I could have shared my food with at least two other people and still have been satisfied 

Service was quick and efficient and my water glass was never left wanting for more.

I am a believer!
author: Kimberly S.

description:
Had a great meal here with some pals and really enjoyed myself.

The first thing that was awesome? We made a reservation on fairly short notice. After 3 or 4 visits to restaurants that were packed this was a welcome find. It was so nice to just walk in and get seated right away instead of the "it's an hour wait" greeting we'd been getting.

Which was surprising because Farmhouse is pretty great and would warrant a long wait, for sure. But I won't complain about that!

So yes, we were seated right away and brought over menus. Something of note--it's beer and wine only. I had thought longingly of a delightful tropical cocktail of sorts but alas, there were none except a couple of beer cocktails. Not the end of the world, I just ordered a young coconut (to fulfill my need for something tropical and delightful) and some wine instead. That was just fine and dandy.

The coconut in particular was awesome. That fresh, refreshing coconut water and that delicious coconut flesh was fantastic to snack on.

Speaking of snacking on, we also ordered a couple of appetizers--the vegan spring rolls with peanut sauce and the par dip fresh tuna. Both were awesome.

For my entree I went with the Kai Yang, Som Tum which was half a BBQ chicken marinated in turmeric and coconut milk served with papaya salad, sweet plum sauce and black sweet sticky rice. The chicken was phenomenal. Really really good. I loved every bite of it. The salad actually had a bit of a kick to it and as someone who is a little bit (okay, more than a little bit) of a wimp with heat I had to pace myself. The black sticky rice was interesting. I thought it tasted good but the texture was a bit chewy and dry. It didn't really TASTE dry, so I didn't dislike it, but it wasn't exactly what I was expecting. But I would absolutely get that dish again, if only for the chicken. 

The presentation on all items was also really cool. My entree in particular came out with the rice in a bamboo container, chicken on cool roasting skewers, etc. I was overwhelmed in a good way when it was brought out the table. Very impressive. The whole coconut was also an awesome photo opp!

I would most definitely return again, and in fact, I look forward to it!
author: Annette J.

description: We come here since the opening and I am still in love with Farmhouse's food. Never had one bad dish! The place got quite popular and lately I feel rushed. The music and vibe is really fun, though it can get too noisy.
author: Claudia S.

description:
A solid 4 stars. A group of five of us came for dinner mid week and the place was packed from the time we entered to the time we left. The atmosphere is a cool mix of hawker, regular restaurant, wall full of faucets. Thai music plays  while the waiters run around wearing traditional thai long shorts/ short pants. 

Menu isn't crazy big but it is filled with a lot of interesting things with elaborate names. The problem with this is that you have to kinda translate it and edit the dish down to what is really is. Like just to describe say basically "beef" it says "Grilled Snake River Farm Wagyu Flank Steak" so you get kinda like "wait what i'm getting snake from a river farm grilled?" for half a second. I hate it when things use too many words to describe things. That drives me nuts. So after translating the menu, we decided to order the following: 

Mieng Kum Kung - which is fried prawns on top of some delicious crunchy things on top of a leaf. Gorgeous and delicious dish. 
Thai Sausage - good but a little boring - just sliced up sausages on top of some cucumber slices. 
Tom Yum Soup - super spicy and flavorful. Very delicious but nothing unusual. 
Beef Salad
Pork Belly Salad - Both were amazing and we were all sweating with smiles on our faces while eating it. It was so spicy but so crazy flavorful. It was served with slices of plain cabbage which made a perfect compliment to the fatty meats in savory spicy sauce. 
Hat Yai Fried Chicken - Fried chicken was good - no bones, comes with a curry on the side and special blue rice - not sure what makes it blue or why it's  blue but it's got a different taste than regular rice and it was delicious. 
Thai Street Green Curry Noodles - Kinda boring and disappointing. It sounded a lot better than what actually showed up which was a bland green curry, and some noodles on the side. It also had a bunch of raw vegetables on the side. 

After having the super flavorful beef salad and pork belly salad and soup- the two entrees seemed really bland and overall didn't taste like much. 

A surprise element was kinda like dim sum service where a waitress came around and asked us if we wanted small dishes. Of course we wanted off the menu daily dishes and they were a fantastic choice. The first surprise dish was a spicy sausage salad, just some small sausage slices with lettuce and chilis and onions. So good that we ended up ordering more at the end of our meal to end on a spicy note. The second dish that came around was grasshoppers. I'd highly recommend them. They are a great source of protein and they're just tasty crunchy snack. It's a little weird to see their heads but whatever. 

For dessert we had the Thai Vacation - half a coconut filled with a black sticky rice, vanilla ice cream, and topped with coconut cream. Not only beautiful presentation but delicious. They also had a dessert option for 2-4 people. Looked like a chef's choice of desserts that they said was very instagram worthy - so I applaud them for their sale description because they know what's important to the people (IG worthy or not). 

The overall experience was fantastic from start to finish.
author: Veronica L.

description: I needed a place to take an out of town friend before hitting up a play at Z Space and this place was perfect. The drinks (ginger milk tea? and spritzers), friend chicken and dessert.... IT WAS SO GOOD. I didn't expect much because I basically looked up a place and got reservations for early evening. They kinda push you out the door as some people said, being really on top of getting what you need, this isn't really a place to linger, which was great for our evening plans. The place is also super funky.
author: Amber H.

description: Never had a bad meal. This place is worth the 40 minute wait. Order everything on the menu! Ok, bit esp order the 24 hour beef noodle, friend chicken and pad see ew! Also, DO NOT skip dessert!
author: Anisa M.

description:
This place is soooooooo quirky - LOVE IT

Ambiance: Hawaii meets Party City meets Thailand (Casual and homey)

Staff: Super nice and accommodating, although I didn't understand what ours was saying half the time he was really nice, and when I asked what made the rice blue, he demonstrated by coming over with the blue flowers they use to dye the rice!  So cool!  

Food: DELICIOUS - I had the salmon, it was a very generous portion and came with blue rice and some asparagus.  It was amazing. I tried some of the chicken curry which was great as well.  The shrimp dish was also quite good. Everything was good. 

I will definitely be back!  

P.S. There is a surprise when you order the chicken curry.  ORDER IT! (Unless you're a vegan then good for you honey.)
author: Christina L.

description:
Fresh young coconuts, blue rice and a dessert platter that looks like a booked vacation. (Don't worry - the fresh, young coconuts are actually of legal age.)

This restaurant is light and airy with beautiful botanic accents, subtle flair and consistently delicious dishes.  

Since the location seems to be a bit out of the way from the hustle and bustle, you might actually get to score seats for a large party to enjoy a quality meal pretty easily, depending on the night and the growing popularity.

For me, I'm a sucker for novelty. Even authentic novelty. 

So when we started off our meal with fresh, young coconuts I immediately began my mental retreat. And honestly, that's kind of important in terms of making an impression. If you're immediately seated, cared for and then offered something associated with special memories, your guard is let down and I believe you can more easily be open to your company and the experience to follow. 

And that was me.

Luckily, I was also dining with Miriam W who is extraordinary at ordering for a mixed table. I didn't even know what she ordered, but I knew I would enjoy it. 

And I did!
author: Tara L.

description:
Great food here! Nice, fun, young crowd. It's a lively place with a lot of color and laughter!

For apps we had the samosas and the flank steak rolls. Both were great.  

I had the pad kee mow as my main and my bf had the hat yai fried chicken. I got mine medium spicy and was very happy with the spice and flavor. Yum!His dish was good too, but here's the thing to know when you go. When you order the samosas, they come with a delicious curry sauce to dunk them in. The curry sauce that is served with the Hat Yai fried chicken is either the same or very similar to what is served with the samosas. I could have eaten my bf's dish in a heartbeat, but he was expecting a different flavor in the dish.

That doesn't take away from how great the food is or the dish- its just good to know before you order.

Will be back- and oh! Drinks are awesome!!
author: Christina S.

description: This place had the best service ever. Got seated right away, order and our food came right away. This place isn't a sit and talk kinda place. We were In and out of there within 30mins. Food was amazing.
author: Nart T.

description:
This was my first time having Thai food and it was cocoNUTS.

I'm kinda sorta adventurous when it comes to what I put in my mouth. I don't ever really crave Asian food and when I do eat it, it's the very basic Americanized (greasy) shrimp fried rice, egg rolls, spring rolls, lo mein... you get the point. On the East Coast we get the Asian food rejects. We're more about our Italian, soul food and seafood. You could say that I'm easily impressed by good Asian food since I'm used to the sucky kind. 

I was greeted with a coconut filled to the brim with coconut water, topped with an umbrella. Ah, yes. I can get used to that. I actually hate coconut. But that's neither here nor there. It's still cool. I gotta admit, your girl was intimidated by the menu. I had to get my coworkers to interpret what the heck I was reading. I ended up with Thai Fried Rice with seafood added. Yes, it was delicious. No, it was not greasy. It was perfect, actually. Perfectly cooked. Big, fat, juicy scallops and shrimp made this dish shine.
author: Lauri W.

description:
The food here is good. The reason for the low rating are the incredibly long wait times.

Have made reservations here in the past only to have to still wait an extra 30 minutes. 

Got delivery today. It took an hour and a half.

I appreciate good food but that kind of delay is just silly.
author: Tony P.

description: Can't remember the last time I've had Thai fried chicken. Well, this places serves it and it's quite good.
author: Chad B.

description: Good food, great presentation, nice ambiance, very good service. Not crowded at lunchtime...when we went. We will return!
author: Rick R.

description: Fun atmosphere, good food. Everything on the menu is spicy, so be prepared. Service is so - so. We had to wait 30 min to be seated, and another 20 minutes to have someone take our order.
author: Bob L.

description:
Amazing, amazing thai restaurant in SF. I came here with a group of 4 on a Thursday and we were able to get same day reservations for dinner. When we got here it was packed though! The place isn't big so definitely make a reservation. Make sure your whole party is there though, we weren't able to get seated until everyone arrived. Once you are seated service is fast and attentive. Our water was constantly refilled and food came fast as well!

The food here is some of the best in SF in my opinion. Prices are high, but they have specials that are a bit different from traditional thai dishes. Also, portion sizes are huge. Two girls can definitely share an entree and an appetizer. My friend ordered a thai-chelada which she really enjoined. For food, I ordered the Hat Yai Fried Chicken. If you like fried food you need to get this. The chicken is fried in a tempura-like way and super crispy and flavorful. The curry that comes with it is just as good. It's not too sweet, but there is also a side of honey as a dipping sauce for the chicken. The flavors and textures paired together surprisingly well. The Thai Street Green Curry Noodles were also raved about and my friend loved it. 

This place is cute too. Extra points for the little succulent that they put on our table.
author: Ellen M.

description: This was a very authentic Thai food place. We ordered the crab rice and grilled prawns pad Thai, it was delicious, it wasn't like any other Thai food I've tried. The atmosphere was great, the servers were friendly and we didn't wait long for our food. Definitely a place to check out it you like Thai food.
author: Christine P.

description:
Very good, and a lot of fun too!  We took the kids here for dinner, and we talked to them about the crickets we might be eating!  Well, we got them, and ate them, and loved them!  The kids just sort of popped them like crisps..and that started the fun dinner experience.  We just went with suggestions from the waiter, and we had fried chicken with a curry sauce, and the beef Pud See Yew - both were outstanding.  Very good and balance flavors.  
The restaurant is hopping with fun, loud and very friendly people.  Three guys sat down next to us and started grossing out about the grasshoppers.  My daughter said "Hey, there pretty good, just try them..."
It was just an overall, fun, pleasant and good meal in a happy, friendly environment.  We will definitely be coming back here!
author: M. R.

description: Great thai food. Very fresh, great spices and flavors, the jasmine rice is a special part of the special menu!
author: Jerry M.

description:
You may want to order several appetizers in place of an entre.
.
As a group of five, our server adjusted every appetizer to five pieces so each of us could enjoy it.  The service and the presentation of every dish were remarkable. 
.
We enjoyed the lightly seasoned fried larvae and Grasshoppers.
.
The $11.50 Mieng Kum Kung/Crispy Tiger Prawns were lightly crunchy and moist. The $14.00 Neua Num Tok Rolls/Grilled Steak were succulent. And, the $9.50 Vegan Rolls were refreshing.
.
The $19.00Hat Yai Chicken/Southern Thai Style pounded fried chicken with a potato yellow curry and blue rice was great. Their $12.00 Crispy Calamari was delicate.
.
$12.00 Ahi Scoops pan-seared on cucumber and seaweed salad was the BEST and the $17.00 Thai Sweet Green Curry Noodles with Chicken will not disappoint.
author: Caesar A.

description: Omg, a true authentic Thai restaurant. Everything we had here was delicious! I don't think I'll go to any other Thai restaurant after eating here. I had their green curry with nooodles... holy moly, it was bomb. I'm salivating right now just thinking about it. My friends and I also had their Samosa and mango salad as appetizers. Samosas were good with yummy curry sauce, the mango salad was like a papaya salad but with mangoes! It was delicious. Just to warn yall, the mango salad is very spicy, which is how we southeast Asians love it. It was so spicy I had firecracker ass the next morning, but it was well worth it. My friend had the pad Thai and that was damn good too. You guys know I am def coming back here!
author: C O.

description:
I arrived as a walk-in at 9PM on a Friday. It was incredibly, incredibly busy, with a long line of guests waiting. At first I considered and started searching for a different place to eat after being quoted 30 minutes till a table opened up. We waited just 5 or 7 minutes and soon, we were sat at a table in the back. Not sure how it is in the daytime, but the ambiance was a very young, hip, techie crowd with high energy and loud music. 
Despite the restaurant being full, the food came out very quickly. We had very attentive waitstaff and I appreciated never needing to flag anyone for refills, napkins, the check, etc. The food tasted great but nothing too spectacular. They also have some delicious coconut ice cream!

 I had a very good experience here and hope to come back soon!
author: Sam E.

description:
Worst system to seat customers ever. We called ahead and they simply stated that they didn't take reservations only walk-ins. 

We got to the restaurant at 715 pm. They told us that it would be 30-35 minutes. Apparently they do take reservations but stopped taking reservations for that day.   This was not mentioned to us on the phone. 

So they kept seating customers after customers before our party and an hour and 20 minutes later, we were still waiting.  

A table of 6 left and they told us that they could not seat us there because they would separate those 3 tables to accommodate 3 groups of 2 instead. 

Infuriating situation to the max and I had to leave the restaurant.  Screw the food.  I don't care how good the food is because they just did not care about customers. 

They should have said hey you don't have reservations and you would have to wait for more than an hour. Don't lie and say 30-35 minutes and then give away tables left and right.  90 minutes to wait for Thai food. What a joke.

Yeah food was mediocre.  This place is for people that don't know what real Thai food tastes like. I should have known with so many non asian people at this joint.  And they also charge outrageous prices for Thai food.  17 dollars for noodle dishes, get outta here.
author: Alex N.

description: It was a night when I wanted to try the top Thai restaurant in San Francisco. Yelp helped me find Farmhouse Kitchen Thai. I went alone and sat at the counter. The service was friendly, I ordered the yellow curry and the food came out quickly. It was delicious and I ate every drop. The atmosphere was fun and exciting, if a bit too loud. I was jealous of the large tables of friends enjoying their meals. I can't wait to go back and this time take my own crew.
author: Todd R.

description:
After receiving a hot tip at work about newly opened Farmhouse Kitchen, I quickly made a dinner reservation for four this past Tuesday night. When my colleagues and I arrived, we were smitten with the space right away. It's bright and airy with plenty of wood (tables, floor) and I particularly loved the antique sewing machine that doubles as the hostess stand. 

Farmhouse Kitchen is the third restaurant from the folks who started Kitchen Story and Blackwood. Definitely start your meal off with a whole young coconut to drink. As soon as you take a sip you'll feel like you're on vacation at the edge of the Mission! I took the lead in ordering a wide selection of the menu for us four ladies to feast upon. From samosas and satay to Penang curry and papaya salad, we sampled a lot. 

The stand out for me was the Hat Yai. This Thai-style fried chicken was mega crispy and juicy and I loved the blue rice, potato curry and roti that accompanied it. 

At the conclusion of our main dishes, I couldn't resist ordering the dessert platter. My dining companions groaned, but who doesn't want a bite of every dessert on the menu? If you can only order one, make it the mango and sticky rice. The mangoes are impossibly ripe and pair perfectly with the sweet and salty sticky rice!

I noticed when I paid the bill that all of our dishes had been marked "mild". This may be the default but I wish we'd been asked when ordering what spice level we preferred. I know I definitely could've handled a little more heat.

Farmhouse Kitchen definitely has all the Thai staples you're used to, but I like their unique takes on less familiar dishes. This is definitely a restaurant I'd return to, and when I do I want to try the 24 hour beef noodle soup!
author: Miriam W.

description:
Brought my friend here after seeing the dessert platter on yelp. We ended not getting the dessert platter because it was $22 and was served for four people. Next time! 

FOOD: Love the presentation! It gives off a farm vibe with rice in a weaved basket and grilled chicken between sticks and salad in a bowl. This was for the Tum Som Chicken Chef Special $18. Rice was a little too clumpy and hard for my taste. But chicken was pretty good - the thigh was nice and moist whereas the breast was on the drier side. Neither of us were fans of the sauce and the salad was a tad too spicy for me (I don't take spicy too well). 
Panang Curry $10 - we got this with crispy slices of bread instead of rice. Decent portion, but the spice for the basil was too overpowering for my taste. It took away from the panang side of the dish a little. But if you love powerful spice, you would like this! They also have complimentary sweet potato chips! 

SERVICE: Pretty tentative & friendly service 

AMBIANCE: The building reminds me of a farm x warehouse kinda vibe with hipster x traditional thai decorations. They have a bar on the side and the kitchen is visible through glass windows. Seat are a tad tight, but not enough to be a bother. Really cute place for a date night too!
author: Samantha F.

description:
tl;dr: this place is fantastic, and worth the wait.

Have eaten here a handful of times; always excellent.  Get the fried chicken (comes with their yellow curry, which is the best I've ever had).

My better half (one-third if we go by weight) is pretty picky, and usually gets their chicken with green beans or garlc/basil, and has been very happy as well.
author: Cj L.

description:
Food :
This place is super good! Served hot. I had the pad ke maw and

Price: this place is expensive. The most costly thing is 30$. 

I ordered a Pad Ke Maw and that was 15.50 not including tip

Super clean. super cool. had random decoration and i totally dig it.
author: Fatima S.

description:
3.5 stars rounded up 

Farmhouse Kitchen Thai Cuisine encapsulates what is essential to today's dining experience: instagrammable shots of colorfully-plated food & quirky, artistic decor. That's not to say their cuisine doesn't pay homage to tradition, but there's an undeniable American modernity taking place within these walls & on these plates. 

We ordered: 
-- whole young coconut for him; passionfruit iced tea for me, which was flavorful without being sweetened 
-- tom kha: a salty, sweet, creamy, & substantial soup. Mushrooms aplenty! 4 stars. 
-- hat yai friend chicken: seemed like two separate dishes in one; roti & curry dipping sauce doesn't go with fried chicken breast cutlets, IMO, but I was happy to try a bit of everything. Blue rice looked funky, but tasted like regular white rice. 3 stars. 
-- yeua yang steak: didn't try the wagyu flank steak (as it was too fatty/bloody for me), but I ate more than the lion's share of the spicy garlic long beans -- 4 stars for those. 
-- pad thai with huge grilled shrimp: thankfully not too sour, as other pad thai tend to be. 3.5 stars 

Large portions; bright, lively atmosphere; would bring someone here who needs a break from dark, grungy hole-in-the-wall type places for the sheer novelty, but I'm not convinced they'd be converted.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Authentic Thai food awaits you. I can't believe I didn't know about this place. The staff are dressed in amazing cultural outfits and the food is prepared with spices that are super fresh. When the servers come around asking if you want to try a special item, I highly recommend it! They offered me fried grasshopper! Definitely bring your family and friend's here.

Recommended dish: pad thai with pork belly
author: Matthew C.

description: Eat the chefs specials that is offered if you have no food allergies to anything. Service was nice. Decor and environment is very casual. Food was delicious. Would return if with friends who are visiting the Bay Area.
author: Lilian L.

description: Fun atmosphere, and cute decor. Warining: the papaya salad is one of the spiciest things I have every eaten in my entire life! But the food was solid Thai food. Would recommend going back! Not too much Asian food this good in the mission!
author: Ross S.

description:
The most glorious Thai restaurant!!

The menu offers much more variety than the typical dishes you see over and over again at various Thai places. This place has some very unique offerings.
Great flavor and texture combinations! And the spicy is spicy, and it is great!!

The venue is fun, a little funky even, and colorful in a good natured, amiable way. And everything is super clean.
Service is good.
Food is fun and unique- from the flavors to the plating.
Fun, happy atmosphere.
Betcha never had Thai food like this!

And don't skip dessert!!!
You're welcome.
author: Katherine C.

description: Waaay overpriced!! I'm always willing to pay more for clean healthy organic food, however it's not here! AND plz update ur heath score! That makes me nervous! Seriously 85/100‍common people we live in SF is there any "Thai" place that can deliver an all organic, healthy meal
author: Soph C.

description:
Thai rockabilly / surf / 50s music = so dope. Like I'm in a vintage Thai James Bond Street Fighter movie filmed on the beach with motorboat chases, moped crashes, and unbearable Engrrish subtitles.

(^_^) Kaeng Kaew Warn Kai #eatthebones #twss
(^_^) Crispy Calamari #greensauce
(^_^) Whole Young Coconut #pyt
(-_-) Neua Num Tok #toughmeat #twss
(v_v) 24hr Cold Brew Coffee #watery #twss

Quaint, warm, clean decor, just like I'd want on my own farm. Check the faucet wall and house-grown garnish plants. Can't get enough of this music. Will be back to the beachhouse for more tunes & food. Kap koon ka!
author: Dan B.

description: Amazing cocktails, friendly service and great Pad Thai (sp)
author: David B.

description:
This place is really adorable and comfortable. Every dish was presented beautifully and was full of color. We came here with a party of 2 on a Tuesday night and the place was filled but we didn't need a reservation and was sat right away. We ordered a total of 3 dishes and 2 drinks and the total bill was $70. Overall would most definitely come here again!

Payaya Salad- Everytime I go to a new Thai restuarant I always have to order the Payaya Salad, It the way I judge any and every Thai place and this place got a pass would defientely order again
Waygu Beef with Green Beans and Ginger Rice- This dish was overall cooked really well, When we got this dish they lit the beef on fire! Which is always fun lol
Tom Yum Noodle Soup- This Noodle Dish came with A LOT of seafood! Literally felt like it was never ending, it had shrimp, fried salmon, scallops, squid. If you love seafood I recommend this dish.
Thai Cooler
WinerFrost Tea
author: Eileen H.

description:
Started off with Fresh vegan rolls. 
Then we got the Veggie noodle soup and Pad kee mao.
I should say that all the items had great flavor to it. I really liked it. 

The ambiance for casual and the interior had some interesting outdated electronics all over the place. BUT, the music was so bad. it almost gave us a headache. 

Overall, a must try if you are a Thai lover.
author: Prashanth V.

description:
most authentic thai food in SF. i would recommend getting the following:
-chicken wings
-ahi scoops
-thai street green curry noodes: very spicy!
-hat yai fried chicken
-panang neua
-tom yum
-herbal rice salad
-all the currys
author: Jackie W.

description: Sadly, their website crashes so it is difficult to view the menu. When it finally loaded it was for the Portland, OR restaurant even though I had started in Yelp for San Francisco. Given that both Yelp and the restaurant stated that they accept reservations, when I called they did not, they only have walk-in (their words) so this was a non-starter given that we are going to a show at The Chapel. Way too much trouble, we will avoid in future.
author: Erin R.

description: This place is amazing. The papaya salad is authentic and tastes homemade. The wagyu beef rolls were absolutely delicious - so flavorful. The green curry with crispy pork belly was delicious. The roasted chicken was delicious. Their ginger milk tea was lovely. My only issue with this place is that the price a tad high, if they took down the prices between 2-3 dollars -it'd be more reasonable. The food is great and so was the service but I still don't think it warrants some of the prices on the menu. Make reservations well in advance -this place gets busy and packed regularly. I'd definitely come back here again and recommend it.
author: Kay I.

description: The food here is delicious, but they aren't careful about gluten-free. I ordered off their designated gluten-free menu and was glutened. I know it wasn't food poisoning as the effects are different, and it wasn't anything else I ate that day. It's really wonderful that restaurants offer gluten-free menus, but that means they need to follow through. I was assured the dishes were gluten-free by the staff and ended up being very sick. I'm so disappointed because I thought I'd finally found a fantastic Thai restaurant that I could really trust. I emailed the staff about my experience and never heard back. I hate writing bad reviews, but I don't want another person who is gluten-free (by necessity, not choice) to eat here and get sick.
author: Alice R.

description:
Beautiful space. Lovely menu. 

But not good for vegans. Or people who want the same story each time about what's in the food. Went twice and had the yellow curry and then, on the third time, I was told it wasn't vegan after all (#fishsauce). :/  Their veg alternatives were slim. 

Also, they forgot our samosas.
author: Emily H.

description:
My boyfriend took me here for dinner on my birthday. I've always love Thai food and it's been a while since I've eaten any. From the greeting to receiving the check, the entire experience had been wonderful. Definitely the most authentic Thai restaurant I've ever been to. 

For appetizers, we ordered the Ahi Scoops and Neua Num Tok rolls. The Ahi Scoops have sriacha on top so it has a spicy kick to it. My favorite part (outer layer) of the Neau Num Tok rolls is the meat. It's very tender, so it made it easy to eat. The rolls are pretty big! For entrees, we ordered the Hat Yao Fried Chicken and Mom Salmon. The salmon and chicken were delish and not dry. The curry in the Hat Yao dish was . The fact I have to use emojis to describe how I feel says something lol. Sorry there are no photos. We were really hungry and didn't want to bother taking an instagram worthy shot of our plates lol. Besides there are A LOT of photos on their yelp page anyway.
author: Joanna S.

description:
A trendy Thai restaurant in the Mission district of SF.  Interesting atmosphere, decent modern Thai food and higher prices. Large portions, so come with several people and eat family style.  I like Ler Ros a bit better.

 Picks:
Panang  Neua ($23.50) Slow braised bone in Short Rib in a Panang curry, grilled broccolini, bell pepper, onion,and fried basil. Blue rice.  Very meaty and a large portion. Lots of veggies, which was nice.

Hat Yai Fried Chicken ($18) Thai Southern style, Mary's organic chicken breast, turmeric & herbs, fried shallots roti bread,potato yellow curry for dipping and rice was one of the top dishes.  Large portion of fried that was cut up. No egg batter.  Fun purple rice.

Thai Vacation ($9.50) is a nice coconut dessert with vanilla ice cream. Save room.

Just OK:
24 Hours Beef Noodle Soup ($18.50) Slow cooked bone-in Beef Short Rib, Egg noodles, veal broth, broccolini, basil, bean sprouts, cilantro, green onion and pork rind garlic oil was just ok.  Nothing special or robust flavors.  Just like a typical Chinese noodle dish.

Thai Ice Tea ($4.75) was very sweet and filled with ice.

Would not reorder:
None

Overall - Very Good
Food - Very Good
Decor - Very Good
Service - Good
Value - Good

Would we come back - Maybe
author: Ellen H.

description: Great food at reasonable prices.  Authentic Thai food that you probably aren't going to get at your traditional Thai restaurant in America. Reminds me of good home cooking.
author: Chris C.

description:
Meh. Overpriced for what it actually serves. It's ok. Not a must stop.

The atmosphere was hopping. Our server seemed disinterested. The food was just ok.
author: Scott M.

description:
The specials at Farmhouse are extraordinary.  If you like real Thai cuisine, the friendliest service and a warm open restaurant that invites you to bring your family, friends or a date this place is for you.

Farmhouse is a flavor adventure that will keep you coming back with everyone you know likes great food.
author: Kai W.

description:
My BF and my fav Thai restaurant in SF.
Minus one star for the recent price increase by $2-3 on most dishes.  This place used to be more affordable, which we liked. 
This is a happening hipster restaurant where all staff wear colorful tropical Thai costumes with a modern twist.
Some signature dishes you must have at least once in your life before you die.
1. Tom yum noodle soup - comes with a good portion of seafood in a spicy broth; generous portion - I can usually make two meals out of it.
2. Hat Yai fries chicken - deep fried battered chicken breast, served w rice and roti, and a delicious Malay style curry dipping sauce 
3. Mok Salmon - The spicy cilantro lime dipping sauce is out of this world (at least for me)
4. Par dip fresh tuna - this spicy tuna appetizer bites your tongue with an unforgettable longing for more!! Comes with only four bite size pieces ;(
5. Kobe beef jerky - this will most likely be the most amazing beef jerky you'll ever have.
6. Desert - if you have room in your belly after eating the above deliciousness, try the farmhouse croissant bread pudding.  It's not your typical pudding, something totally different. The pastry, caramel sauce and vanilla ice cream blends perfectly together to form desert heaven in your mouth!
**BF ALWAYS gets the red curry - it's a typical Thai curry, the flavor profile is not too different from most Thai restaurants; I don't get it!
author: Priscilla P.

description:
I absolutely loved this place! I went here on a Sunday night for dinner with 4 other friends around 7pm. We were told the wait would be around 50mins. We had no reservations, so it was understandable. To our surprise, we were seated a lot sooner than expected. 

Our waitress was super polite and answered our questions without any hesitation. I ordered the Hat Yai Fried Chicken and it was perfection! I highly recommend ordering it! I vacationed in Thailand last year and I still think the curry that the Hat Yai Chicken comes with is one of the best I have tasted! It come with roti for dipping in the curry but I ended up dipping the chicken in the curry as well. One thing I noticed is that they pay a lot of attention to their guests and throughout our whole dinner, our water glasses were constantly filled every minute. No water glass reminded half empty. 

Overall, I would definitely come back for more. The ambience was perfect. Slightly intimate but not overly loud/hectic. Farmhouse has definitely become one of my favorite restaurants.
author: Brandolph T.

description:
An outstanding Thai restaurant -- which is not something you hear about often. My go-to dish is the Hat Yai Fried Chicken, the crispy chicken satisfies my craving every single time. Recently ordered the 24 hour beef noodle which was too savory and too salty for my liking -- that I would not get again. 

Come here if you're looking for an alternative Thai experience with the option of selecting from a wide menu, including the regular Thai street dishes (Pad Thai, Pad See Ew, etc.). The drinks are excellent too, especially the ginger milk tea.
author: Liz C.

description:
I love Thai food and I wouldn't have found this place if I hadn't been hanging with the foodies friends. We had a midweek dinner reservation and they were prepared to seat me though I arrived a bit early - I opted for the bar and ordered a thai milk tea which wans't overly sweet thank goodness.

Favourite dishes that dinner:
Steak rolls
Braised short rib in Panang curry with blue rice
Pad kee mow
Thai vacation dessert - served in a coconut, coconut cream , sticky rice

Each dish tasted excellent and I would love to visit again.
author: Feren Y.

description:
I came to Farmhouse Kitchen with a colleague after work on weeknight. We wanted to go somewhere fun, but not too formal as we were on our way to a show. We did not make a reservation, but were still seated quickly and left within an hour. The service was extremely friendly, attentive, and fun. It would be the perfect place to  bring family or a group of friends for a special or celebratory dinner of some sort. 

Too be honest, I didn't get to explore the menu as much as I normally like to because my colleague was treating me (normally I will ball out and try everything if I'm paying). We both had the flower spritzer cocktail which was a nice way to start off the meal. It looks like it'll be really sweet because of its bright pink color, but it's actually really refreshing and balanced. We weren't going to get any starters just for the sake of time, but while we were waiting for our food a server came around with street style food. He was carrying baskets of assorted fried vegetables and asked if we wanted some. I mean.... DUH! I'm not going to turn away a basketful of fried crunchy treats. I also got the green curry with beef and blue rice. It was so delicious. Green curry is already my favorite, but this was excellent. The vegetables were warm and tender, but still had a crispiness to them. The curry was thinner than I had normally had it, but not watery. I didn't notice a huge difference in flavor, but the blue rice was really gorgeous. 

The atmosphere as a whole was so fun. It was trendy and modern, but had authentic and traditional decor as well. The bathroom was large and very clean. I am looking forward to my next meal here!
author: Isabella G.

description:
yes it is loud. yes it is busy. yes it is pricier than you'd normally expect for thai food. 

i can get over those things though. they come with the territory. you know that it will be this way. 

all of the food is high quality organic and la dee da. the flavors are on point! spicy! delicious! prepared nicely!

lots of date night peeps here. and birthdays, my goodness. 

drinks are fun, pretty good beer selection.

i pass on the dessert, but mostly that is cause i want ice cream.
author: Vanessa S.

description: Ate here for the first time last weekend after searching on yelp for good Thai food in the area. Based on the reviews we decided it was a must try. We were not let down. We ordered the fried chicken, crab fried rice, and samosas. Everything was delicious and plated beautifully. Service was also very quick and the staff was attentive. We will be going back very very soon.
author: Lisa M.

description:
The minute you walk in you are welcomed by an open restaurant with a strong rustic feel. You get the farmhouse vibe right away. I've been here once for dinner and another time for lunch. 

My dinner of Hat Yai fried chicken was super delish. Anything fried is yummy anyway. 

I was not very happy with my Kai Yang, Som Tum for lunch. The menu says the chicken is marinated in turmeric and coconut milk, and I barely tasted it. I had to ask for more dipping sauce (think more tangy vinegary, but sweet sauce) for flavor. The papaya salad is also spicy so I recommend asking for a substitution. Black sticky rice was black sticky rice. 

Service is nice, and waters regularly refilled. Would I make this a regular spot to visit? Probably not since Kitchen Story is closer for me. (Yes, they're related!)
author: Thomas L.

description: Ate late lunch here. Very tasty Thai entrees. Decor of old Thai relics. Tables, chairs, floor looked clean and neat. Street parking is tough and hard to find. Bring your small car and maybe you get lucky. One giant room unisex toilet. I think they should split restroom and put two toilets in the space.
author: Clifford W.

description:
So far my fav spot in San Francisco! But I'm a sucker for Thai food. Love the eclectic/traditional decor, which set the mood for dinner. I came around 6:30 and there was already a 30 min wait for 2. Ended up sitting at the bar, which ended up to be a better experience (in my opinion). The bartender was super accommodating, along with all of the servers who kept on refilling our drinks or taking away plates. 
I had the Hat Yai Fried Chicken and it was BOMB. The chicken was so on point, I can't! It had a super crispy and light taste, and with that sweet and sour sauce they served on the side, you have no choice but to shove your face. The potato curry was delicious too but a tad too sweet for my liking. Still, it made for a great sauce for the blue rice. 
My boyfriend had the curry chicken and noodle bowl and he said it was amazing. I liked it too. There was just the right amount of heat, and the chicken was tender. 
Overall, amazing experience. By the time we were finished dinner, the place was packed. Parking is sort of hard to find, but this is San Fran, so expect that?! Luckily the street parking opened up at 6 so we literally grabbed the last spot close by. 
If I'm ever in San Fran again, I'll definitely be back!
author: Heather L.

description: My favorite Thai restaurant I've found so far in SF. The food is consistently good. I've eaten in the restaurant, as well as ordered takeout several times and it's always delicious. Recommend the pad thai or any of the curries!
author: Claire M.

description: Not a terrible spot to eat at. Food was pretty decent but it could have been better. It was something for the meanwhile but it was OK nothing soectacular.
author: Khalid H.

description:
Curry breaded calamari - 3/5
Kai yang (bbq chicken with papaya salad) - 3/5
Hat yai  (fried chicken with curry) - 2/5
Panang neua (curry braised short rib) - 4/5

Overall, "I'm a fan" of the short rib.
author: Mark O.

description: The food there is nice.The experience here is awesome and impressive. Their service is also great.
author: Jessie H.

description: Came here on a date two months ago and really enjoyed it. I ended up getting the Thai green curry with a Thai iced tea. Loved the Thai ice tea but the green curry wasn't anything special. My date got the chicken plate with the yellow curry and it was beyond amazing. We got lucky and didn't have to wait in line but it's because we went early at 5.30pm.
author: Mira B.

description: After craving Thai food all week, my friend and I were incredibly disappointed by the food at this place. I don't know if it's because we ordered to-go, but our pad Thai and Tom Yum dishes were totally sub par on flavor profiles and quality. The place looks super cool inside, but the food quality is not worth the price point.
author: Olya S.

description:
This place has become one of my favorite places for Thai food, seriously can't get enough of it! It's definitely on the pricier side ($18-20+ per entree), but the portions are generous and I always leave stuffed.

Recommendations:

1. Hat Yai Fried Chicken...this dish kills me every time. 
2. 24 hr Beef (bone in) soup
3. Panang Curry w/ crispy pork belly (add on)

Place is usually crowded, so even with reservations you can end up waiting an additional 10-20 min or more if its a peak hour on Fri/Sat...but all in all, this place is awesome!
author: Mario P.

description: The BEST Thai food ... every dish is so delicious. We couldn't decide what to ordered  so we ordered as many dishes as the table can hold ..
author: Jay S.

description:
I have only sampled Farmhouse's takeout - but it was absolutely delicious and I wouldn't hesitate to order from here again.

The calamari and crab fried rice from Farmhouse - even in their take-out form - were both well presented and they were both erupting with flavor. The calamari was outstanding and consisted of battered curry Monterrey squid, paired with a remarkable cilantro lime sauce. The Dungeness crab in the crab fried rice - was abundant and the moist rice was seasoned superbly and came neatly wrapped up in a lotus leaf beside free-range chicken broth.

Farmhouse Kitchen excels at manifesting quality innovative dishes with quality and local ingredients. Their prices aren't cheap - but I'm willing to pay more for well sourced dishes made with love.

Trust
author: Jessica T.

description:
Huge fan of this place! It's quality from top to bottom. Every dish I've had has been excellent. The food also seems to come fast. Both of the bread pudding desserts are also delicious.
They also come around with various bug based snacks, which is interesting.

The largest negative of this place is that there are always birthday dinners, and they are very loud when bringing out birthday dessert.
author: Lars Z.

description:
Great food and friendly service!

Papaya salad - mad spicy but amazing range of flavors

Panang Curry - great flavor enhanced with tumeric 

Pad see ew - well flavored noodles with basil

Kickboxing punch - really unique taste with rice wine
author: Nishant D.

description: Came with my teenage daughters and their friend for dinner. We loved it. This place is truly a gem. I can't wait to go back to SF just to eat here.
author: Israel I.

description:
I was reminded of that Seinfeld episode with Jerry trying to fulfill his car reservation: https://youtu.be/4T2GmGSNvaM. It goes like this:

Agent: Sorry we have no mid-size available at the moment
Jerry: I don't understand, I made a reservation, do you have my reservation?
Agent: Yes, we do, unfortunately we ran out of cars
Jerry: But the reservation keeps the car here! That's why you have the reservation!
Agent: I know why we have reservations
Jerry: I don't think you do. If you did, I'd have a car. See, you know how to take the reservation, you just don't know how to HOLD the reservation and that's really the most important part of the reservation, the holding. Anybody can just take them!

That's kinda what happened to us on a Friday night here. Made an 8:15 reservation, we get there and there's no host and a bunch of people waiting around Wait 10 mins until we finally get attention from someone, and we're asked to wait another 10-15 minutes. Wait? What? This where I go "I don't understand, I made a reservation, do you have my reservation?" and they say something like: "Yes, we do, unfortunately we ran out of tables."

I mean what's the point of treating reservations like a wait list. Reservations are part of delivering someone a good experience because let's face it, waiting sucks. I made a reservation because I don't wanna wait almost half hour for a table.

Anyway, after that whole ordeal the service was fine from there although it seemed like a lot of other people were also waiting around to get there reservations fulfilled so I'm inclined to believe this happens a lot.

What I love about this place though is the ambiance. The decor really sets the mood. It's a bit loud but that's kinda the point.  They also have people coming around serving various exotic Thai snacks. This is when I tried fried grasshoppers for the first (and last!) time.

Plating was pretty nice and made everything feel authentic. The food was generally good but I can't say it's much better than your typical goto Thai joint that's probably half the price of this. I got the Fried Chicken with curry dipping sauce. Curry great, chicken mediocre.

Would like to give this place another shot and try more of their dishes but it's hard to justify the wait (even with a reservation) for, like I said, food that isn't much better than nearby cheaper options.
author: Andrew D.

description:
What a treat.  We ordered food for lunch for a co-workers babyshower.  I didn't know what to get because everything looked amazing on the website.

My choice was delicious -I ordered the spicy eggplant with jasmine rice.  Yum!  Everyone else's food looked just as amazing as it did on the website.  

Ton's of food, good value, bummer that I had to order through Caviar (they were great though!!!).  Next time, I'd like eat there.
author: Missy C.

description: The food was either really good or just "good enough." I wish the quality was consistent.
author: Lucy C.

description: This is my favorite thai spot in the bay area. Soo good. Available via eat24 as well!
author: Dennis H.

description: I have been here 4 times now. The food is absolutely fantastic. This is without a doubt one of the best restaurants in the city. The first time I had their Fried Chicken lunch is in the top 5 meals of my life. My mouth is salivating as I am typing this. Damn, I need to eat here again soon!
author: Ankit A.

description:
By far the best Thai food in SF

The food, the ambience, the food what else can I say. Went here for a normal dinner. Good thing we booked, the queue was very long. We ordered the Hat Yai Fried Chicken, the rice salad of some sort, the special of the day (Northern noodles). All very good. But the best is the fried chicken. Very crispy just like how do it in Thailand. It comes with a nice mild yellow curry and blue rice. The blue rice is like meh.... I've had better. But the combination is divine. 

The noodles in curry was really nice too. It came with yellow noodles and fried noodles on top (nice variation in texture), and chicken. I would have prefer this dish with shrimp or tofu.

The serving is big. I would suggest to order 1 appetizer and 1 main course for 2 person. 

This maybe a bit pricey that what most people in this country pay for Thai food. But it is worth it. 

I am giving only 4 stars cos the place is very noisy like a real farm house full of chicken.
author: Herb D.

description:
I think I'm in trouble because this amazing dinner spot in just four blocks away from my house. So glad the reviews pointed me in this direction because I never walk down Florida--I only found this bc ya'll pointed it out this this gem!

Definitely made reservations for two on date night, and were seated 5 minutes after arrival. I was hesitant looking around and seeing mostly non-Asian diners, but have no fear, this place is bomb af with the flavors.

We ordered the special of noodles with a peanut curry, and the hat yai fried chicken with yellow potato curry. Both dishes knocked it out of the park! A little on the sweet side but that's how I like it! The chicken was soft on the inside and so crispy and flavorful on the outside, and it was such a delight having roti and the blue rice to eat with the yellow curry.

Service was fast and efficient, and packed our food swiftly to take in more patrons! I'll be back to try the rest of the menu. Make sure to only come if you made a reservation because the place is packed!
author: Michelle N.

description: Great atmosphere, good service, and most of all, very tasty food. They had a taro root appetizer special when we were there. If they have it, get it. Also highly recommend the Neua Num Tok Rolls and the Hat Yai Chicken. Will definitely be back.
author: Luke H.

description:
Flavor, Flavor, Flavor! 

This is not your run of the mill Thai food. They still have your favorite dishes but have some outstanding specials. On my last visit I ordered the 24 Hour Beef Noodle Soup. The broth was rich and flavorful, the beef so tender and soft..dang my mouth is watering just thinking about it.

Be adventurous and order only of the specials, you won't regret it.
author: Kara S.

description: Their food was mediocre, I only liked their shrimp pad thai which is basic. The Thai iced tea was tasteless. Also, the servers were not that friendly plus service is slow. They did not even recognized my special request under my reservation. We were waiting for them to greet my friend as we celebrate, as we see how they greet other tables. I pretty much think this place is too overrated maybe because of how they present their food (for the gram) but pretty much taste just average. I am not going back to this place. Servers did not even say thank you to us.
author: Em Q.

description: I love this place. Have been coming regularly for the last two years. Nothing beats the fun ambiance and the extremely kind and attentive waitstaff. I especially love their yellow curry and the vegan spring rolls. If you have a party over 2 people, I would recommend placing a reservation a couple of days in advance. Expensive, but so worth it in my opinion!
author: Lina L.

description: Happy Thai New Year at Farmhouse. My new years resolution is to come back here soon. It was a special night with singing and a thai dance performance. Did I mention the cotton candy? Yup, you heard me. COTTON CANDY. Talk about festive! I'll have to see what its like on a normal night. The food was as lovely as the environs. The vegan fresh dinner rolls were dee-lish starters. The crispy calamari was done well. Not too much batter so you could actually taste the calamari. The only disappointment was the Mok Salmon cooked in banana leaf. It was bland and a bit spongy. Would not order that again. And the Farmhouse failed my decibel test. If I have to scream across the table to be heard then it's no fun for me.  Especially hard when the birthday singers come around to the celebrants table. Then it gets REALLY loud. But with all that being said, I'd go back in a heartbeat. I always keep my new years resolution.
author: stan s.

description: Hidden Gem! I love their food and their atmosphere! We did a family style and ordered almost everything on the menu, it was just delicious. We had reservations but still had to wait for 15 minutes because how popular this place is. Definitely a great place to try especially on your birthday! They do sing for you.
author: Irem G.

description:
Every dish was presented beautifully! The service was fast enough. This was the first time I tired this restaurant. It was Wow! Sooooo good!!!! Every dish was so flavorful! Did the family style order 5 people. 
-BBQ chicken with black rice/papaya salad (best highly recommended) 
-crab fries rice (interesting combination still taste good); 
-pad Thai (classic dish that represents how good the restaurant is and it was one of the best I had)
-green curry with beef (a bit spicy but kicks in! The rice was blue! Super tropical looking:) love it!)
 
Belly was full and couldn't even move! I stuffed my face with these delicious food!!! Will definitely come back!
author: Li T.

description: Maybe it was a miss for me but this place was ok. I've had better Thai food elsewhere. Their appetizers were good. Still enjoyed the ambiance with my family and their customer service.
author: Stephanie J.

description:
Great first impression! As soon as you walk in, they do a great job setting the family friendly fun vibe. We ordered the Pad Char Shrimp and the Crab Fried Rice. Both were average tasting for Thai food so I'd order them again if I were craving it, but it's not anything I'd recommend.
My annoyance was that I ordered a fresh coconut as my drink that never came, they didn't charge us for it, but c'mon. Esp because they came back to tell us our original order wasn't available since they were out of some ingredient or another. Isn't that something you should tell the table when you take their order? Not 10 min later?
The coconut dessert we got was delicious so the beginning and end of our visit were positive. The middle? Eh.
author: Kimberly C.

description: Hit or miss every time! Stick with the currys those never fail. The chicken was iight, not the best. Drunken noodles are mostly veggies, rice pretty blah . The traditional Thai flavors you look for are in the dishes, but the execution varies. The food comes out in like 5 minutes. So I don't believe it is cooked to order which explains why sometimes it's really good and sometimes it's disappointing.
author: Iyore O.

description: I made a reservation a week in advance for a party of 11 at 7pm and they called me an hour and a half before my reservation and said that they will not be able to seat my party because there's a lot of reservations. They could have told me when I made the reservation that they won't have space but they didn't. They need to update their system or something because it's completely unprofessional to call an hour and a half before someone's reservation to tell them that they can't be seated. Never coming back.
author: V K.

description:
came here with a group of 8 friends so got to try a bunch of the items.  The dishes ranged from decent to pretty good and a couple standout items.  I would say it's 3.5 stars but rounding up to 4.  Here is a breakdown of what we tried:
- beef rolls (appetizer) flavorful and very moist.  Not super special but very good

- mango salad with prawns - great robust flavors  and fresh!

- crispy pork belly salad - pretty good, the pork had a good ratio of fat and was very crispy

- chicken and rice - my favorite dish of the night - I have had better in SF (check out Amphawa) but this was still great.  The chicken was moist and tender and the rice was fragrant.  The dipping sauces were delicious too.  

- beef noodle soup - it was ok.  Noodles were soggy, broth had too much cloves(?) but the beef rib was rich flavored and tender

- yellow curry with pork - decent but not super special

- fried chicken - once of the weakest dishes tonight - so dry!  Came with delicious roti and curry sauce though
