After I told him that I tried the Pad see ew first, then the green curry, and those were crazy spicy, he told me I was wrong. 
He wouldn't admit that they made the dishes wrong, and was a complete jerk over the phone. 
I love spicy food. I use tons of siracha on my meals. This was the spiciest food I've ever tasted. 
Forget these guys. They are assholes. Next time
I'll order from Kitchen Story -- they always get the spicy levels right. Medium is medium -- not Thai spicy.
author: Janel A.

description: this is such a random place for a thai restaurant.  i walked by a long time ago and thought it was weird, and i finally got to try it over the weekend.  we had a group of 9 and shared a bunch of stuff, and all of it was good.  we had the vegan rolls and samosas to start, and they were both super tasty.  i also tried the pad thai, crab fried rice, the beef shank egg noodles, green papaya salad, chili cabbage and xo broccolini.  i LOVED the cabbage, but the portion was ridiculously small.  i liked the fried rice a lot, especially w/ the accompanying hot sauces.  i also liked all the chilis that they brought to our table to try, which were all so flavorful.  too bad we didn't get them until we were pretty much done w/ our meal.  we also tried 2 desserts which were refreshing w/ coconut and made me feel like i was on a beach somewhere.  i would definitely come back.
author: Helen T.

description: I love this place!! Always has great food and service.  They have entertainment sometimes which is cool. The spicy basil is very hot when ordered spicy and very delicious. The iced coffee is fantastic. The only negative is it's quite expensive compared to most Thai restaurants. I keep coming back so must be worth it.
author: Brayden S.

description:
Excellent service, ambiance and food. A little pricey, but worth it for the amount of food one gets for one serving. I took half of it home and made another meal. 

I got the lunch special, which came with crispy pork belly, sausage and marinated pork. Good flavors and somehow refreshing despite all the meat in the serving. 

Location is a little out of the way, but worth a visit!
author: Alexandra L.

description:
I really really enjoyed dine in at this Restaurant. For me the food was really good but some was average but the way they decorate the restaurant, service, presentation and ambiance was the winner. We ordered BBQ chicken along with papaya salad, it was amazing good, Thai sausage was great too but the noodles with simmered beef was average for my taste but it wasn't bad. 
If you were in the city , come to check them out. I am Thai and highly recommend this place.
author: Andy P.

description: Terrible terrible service. Completely forgot our order and after a service person came by we told them our food was 20 mins late. They still hadn't started our order when we went inside to check on them. After asking for the check they still tried to charge us for food we didn't receive. Never sit outside at this place, they manage it terribly.
author: Ato G.

description: A gem! I've been lucky enough to dine a lot in Norther, Central, and Southern Thailand, and Farmhouse's food is really special. It tasted like the street food I miss so much. Moreso, the ambiance makes it a truly special experience.
author: Natalie J.

description: What a great find... really enjoyed all of the dishes in this trendy Thai place. The food was delicious with appropriate amount of Thai-level of spiciness. I loved everything we had and the portions were generous. Wish they had more options in their noodle soup section! Will definitely be coming back for more
author: O K.

description:
Fell upon this place as I was Yelping over the weekend for new eats in the city. A block from my old office building. How I miss working in the Mission... :/ The plating alone intrigued me but the reviews were all superb so I was hooked on coming in Monday after work. 

Ordered the Hat Yai Fried Chicken. Comes with roti, potato yellow curry and blue rice. This could easily feed two people but I didn't eat lunch so I was able to devour every bite and soak up every bit of the sauce. Couldn't let it go to waste now. :p Every bite of this dish was full of flavor and spice. The fried chicken especially with the sweet dipping sauce and perfectly crisp skin.... Pure deliciousness. Most authentic Thai I have had in SF. 

The staff was also super friendly. I also asked the waitress if there was any significance of the 99 faucets on the wall. She explained #9 is good luck within the culture. The faucets resemble the flow of water/rain hence more good luck is brought to you. 
Highly recommend and Look forward to trying more dishes.
author: Erica M.

description: Dinner with a coworker spur of the moment. The Devore is great and the waitstaff all wear very fun Hawaiian shirt with traditional Thai pants. We were seated promptly as they had just opened for the day. I ordered a Thai tea which is always one of my favorites. It arrived with a large scoop of crushed ice which was great. The prices are a little steep with the average tab being $15-24. Condiments are a bit pricey I've never pd $4 for peanut sauce although they give you a nice portion. Before our meal we were served pickled veggies which were nice. My coworker ordered the Thai rice with seafood but instead received the a noddle dish. The waiter quickly corrected the order. I ordered the Hat Yai chicken which was a large chicken breast deep fried, yellow curry with potato, roti and blue jasmine rice. It was a large portion and very delicious. I would suggest ordering this dish and sharing. Overall great place a little outta the way of my usual places but worth it.
author: Rosa V.

description: First time here with my boyfriend. Got the fried chicken with blue rice and curry, beef jerky and another meat dish. Had a good experience there! I would go back for the beef jerky!
author: Potatoe Q.

description: Great red curry! There are lots of vegan options and the staff was helpful with the menu. The atmosphere was a bit chaotic, but overall very nice.
author: Kaisa H.

description:
Amazing Thai food!! I'm obsessed! A bit on the pricier end but worth it! 

Green curry noodle 
Ahi scoops 
Pad ke Mao 
Crab fried rice 

Cute atmosphere, funky Thai music, adorable decorations!
author: Michelle L.

description: SO. GOOD. They have a portal to Thailand in there somewhere. Love the shrimp and the fried chicken. I also got to try fried grasshopper there one time (protein of the future!) and that was also pretty awesome.
author: Rashmi J.

description: Tuna dip app was nice with a little heat on it but a little short on wanton chips and the day's special was great.
author: Ben J.

description:
Here is your first official petition to open a location in the Maryland Suburbs of DC.  

Below I will list the terms and reason for this petition: 

1. Your service is impeccable, and people around here really care about service and customer experience. 
2. I LOVE the atmosphere of your restaurant.  It's so airy and breezy.  The Thai flower decor is insanely instagrammable, and we love to use Instagram here in Maryland. #FreeAdvertisingForYou
3. That appetizer with the Waygu flank steak rolled around cucumber and mint in the green curry... well, I was trying to figure out what's been missing in my life for some time now... and it's that. 
4. Those spring rolls with the glass noodles.  I doubted ya there for a second. I was like... that's carbs stacked on carbs.  But you knew what you were doing.  You knew better than me. 
5. When I ordered the 24 hour beef braised soup, I didn't realize that for the next 24 hours I would be thinking about the soup. I'm assuming it's also it's cooking time. Clever... very clever *wink
6. The spices that you put on the table were not kidding. They were not playing anyone. No chain of fools here. They were serious. Appreciated. 
7. Ok... I know it's weird, but I love how you serve almost everything on enamel. I love the blue and white enamel plates, I love the red and vanilla colored enamel plates.  I love enamel- sue me. 
8. Everything was so fresh and clean tasting.  I mean... no heavy oily dishes, the produce was super fresh. The kitchen was clean as a hospital operating room. 
9. And the quickness in which you got out 10+ entree dishes was just... impressive. 
10. I know  A LOT of Yelpers in this area, and I know that we would frequent your establishment. I mean, I'd essentially live there. 

As concludes my petition to have you open up a second location in the Maryland Suburbs of Washington.

Bethesda, MD would be great, thank you.
author: Mike B.

description: Pleasurable dining experience that combines great cuisine with a welcoming and joyful staff. Loved the crab fried rice and bitter melon soup grew on me!
author: Reginald P.

description: We stumbled upon this place by accident...and I am so glad we did.  When we walked in, the place was not that busy since it was after lunch and before dinner.  The wait staff was super colorful and friendly.  It was a tad expensive, but the food was flavorful and had large portions with amazing presentation.
author: Jennifer T.

description: We have ordered from this restaurant several times. The food is consistently good, but the curries come in plastic containers that are half- melted by the time they get to me because the curry is so hot. I am pretty freaked out by ingesting melted plastics for health reasons. I hope Farmhouse will look into a more eco- friendly compostable containers for takeout. No matter how healthy the food is, it's cancer- causing to eat melted plastic!
author: Nora Q.

description: I waited a year after my first disappointment and unfortunately nothing changed. The food was mediocre at best. The service was good.
author: Mark H.

description:
Celebrating my daughter birthday here with family and good friends. They serve good foods and good service as well. Love the ambiance of the room. The price is a kind of pricey for that kind of taste of foods. 
We spend about $410 for 11 of us including 1 kid (they added an automatic 20 percents of gratuities) I was shocked but dont want to ruined my daughter's day. I forgot to ask for the breakdown price of the foods at the end.. still calculating how come we spend that much ..
I wont be back... but Thanks for unforgetable memories for the birthday Suprise Celebration but We still have to pay for the dessert.
author: Christy S.

description:
Probably one of the most fun Thai place I've been to. 

I'd like to thank the hostess for not canceling our reservation and actually giving us a call to check if we were still coming. We were running a few minutes late, and they were definitely packed. 

Tom Kha was way way too sweet. So sweet that I didn't even want more than just a spoonful.  Tom Kha is one of my favorite thai dishes, so that says a lot. 

Pad See Ew was just average. Once again, very sweet. 

Ahi Scoops appetizer was fantastic.

Tom Yum Noodle Soup was great. Although they say its spicy, it was more of a mild spice. Personally, I could have used a little more kick. But all the other flavors were great, The soup was creamy and sour and sweet, super fragrant and aromatic.
author: Lana S.

description:
Tasty food with speedy service. 

Is this the best Thai food ever? I don't know, to be quite honest.  But it's pretty darn tasty and the menu is large and varied enough that I believe there's probably something for everyone. 

The restaurant is large by San Francisco standards and it takes reservations, which is a big plus.  The restaurant has a nice balance between open and clean with rustic charm.  The nice bar side seating and view od the kitchen gives it a good "modern" spin. Parking nearby is also not terrible as they are actual parking not just curbside spots where you hope you fit and aren't sticking into someone's driveway. 

The food is tasty as I mentioned before.  The appetizer that is basically a coconut shrimp lettuce wrap is really good and comes three to an order.  Although papaya salad is a standard dish, give the rice salad a try.  The short rib masaman curry is less curry and more of a curry rub fyi, not bad just slightly misleading by the description. 

All in all I love this spot.  It's a good place to take people with varying tastes and the service is always fast.
author: Jenny W.

description:
Sigh. What do you get when you mix poor service with poor food? Farmhouse... I hate complaining about service but this was pitiful. Add the fact the oysters were served at room temp and dry, the street food chicken dish was effectively pre cooked and warmed up under a heat lamp. The chicken wings where tasty but it's hard to dislike sugar and spice 

Dozens of better Thai in the city
author: David B.

description: The first time I visited this place I thought the food was outta this world. This second time around I felt like what I ordered didn't seem to be the same. Perhaps the food was too spicy for my liking that it numbed my taste buds. Service was decent and walk-ins were welcome. The food is definitely as other diners stated a little pricy for what you pay compared to other thai restaurants. Nonetheless, it's an experience.
author: W A.

description: Best authentic thai food in the Bay Area. I loved this place. We sat at the bar, didn't have a reservation and I loved everything we ate. Everything tasted fresh, flavorful and was delicious. Service was great too. The ahi appetizer was outstanding as was the curry. Can't wait to go back, I've been craving it ever since.
author: Amy S.

description:
Delicious, fresh, flavorful Thai food! Best part (for me) was the gluten free menu - full of yummy things I could eat. Best Tom Kha I've had in the city (and I've tried a lot of different thai restaurants!)

My sister recommended the restaurant to us, after having gone herself. She made a Yelp reservation a few hours before going and loved it. When my parents and I went, we had a great dinner there too!
author: Katie B.

description: I was very disappointed with the food delivered to my house. I live five minutes from the restaurant and it took 90 minutes for the food to be delivered. When I finally got the food, it was cold and mushy as as if it had been cooked 80 minutes before. It had to be heated and tasted like day old left over.
author: Alice M.

description: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in SF right now. They have this crispy fried chicken with a turmeric curry that's unbelievably good. Also, the blue rice is really neat and the kid loves it. They also have solid vegetarian options for the hubs. Their to-go service is quick and the in-house service is friendly!
author: Bella S.

description:
Ohh Farmhouse that yummy dinner gave me sweet dreams.  I visited Farmhouse with my lovely co-workers on a Tuesday night. We had a pretty big party and the space was perfect for us. I loved the decor of the restaurant, that faucet wall might be one of the most photographed  walls soon:)

We started with a couple of appetizers the Thai Crispy Rolls, Neua Num Tok Rolls, and Samosas. My favorite was the Neua Num Tok Rolls the steak was so tender. For dinner it was a Tom Kha soup and yellow curry with beef. Their take on the yellow curry was a little different then what I've had before. I loved the Roti on top of the curry it was almost like a creamy curry pot pie. The Tom Kha was one of the best I've ever had with so many fresh veggies and mushrooms I'd definitely order it up again. They give you spices to add to your dishes but I do wish they let you order by heat. Dishes were pretty mild overall.

I was so impressed with the presentation of the dishes they were just beautiful. My co-worker ordered the BBQ chicken and it was unbelievable the fried chicken was also an impressive dish. I would definitely revisit Farmhouse again it was so yummy.
author: Lauryn C.

description: Oh my gosh, I LOVE this place . I can say this is one of the best Thai restaurant in the entire Bay Area.. everything is SO TASTY!!! they have amazing atmosphere whether it's for family, friends, casual gatherings, date, or even team bonding dinner..  They also bring these fried grasshopper and larvae around and ask people if they want to try some. HIGHLY RECOMMEND YOU TO TRY IT ! Be brave .  GO HERE !
author: Tee B.

description: Best of the best! We had the herbal salad, fried chicken, and the special beef curry. Holy cannoli this was one of the most authentic Thai restaurants I've been too since Thailand. All of my favorite things. Highly recommend.
author: S S.

description: Love everything about this restaurant, delicious food (we ordered Hat Yai Fried Chicken, 24hr boat noodle, and Kun Tok), nice ambience, lovely service (Austin was amazing). Highly recommend.... definitely will come back
author: Kate C.

description:
Man this place is lovely. I was directed here during their soft opening by a coworker who had a hot tip about Farmhouse's recent opening.

While I'm sure this place would be a perfect dinner location, I'd actually suggest it for lunch. It's place on Florida is sunny, warm and welcoming. The first thing I got off the menu was the whole young coconut which was fresh and refreshing. It wasn't too sweet, but seemed to perfectly quench my thirst. I noticed they have quite the coffee bar as well, so if you are looking for a midday pick me up this is the place. 

We ordered a few dishes, but by far and away the best standout is the Hat Yai. It's a friend chicken dish with a side of blue rice. Additionally, it comes with a wonderfully crispy roit and potato curry. I wasn't totally sure the process of eating the dish (was the curry for the chicken? Was the Roti supposed to be dipped in the curry? Why was the rice blue?) But I ended my meal quite full and content. 

Word on the street from some spice fiend friends is that you can really ask them to kick up the spice. That alone is a reason to come back, but having looked at their menu there is a lot more I'd love to try.
author: Jake B.

description:
I wasn't sure what to expect when I came here.  I mean the name itself is kinda weird.  When I think Farmhouse, I think stuff like brunch with eggs and bacon, not Thai food.  But aside from the name, my dining experience here was pretty good!

A modern atmosphere with a touch of Thai decorations to remind you you are here to eat Thai food, not brunch :).  They started us off with some sweet potato chips that were lightly salted.  Actually really good, and I don't prefer sweet potato chips.

We ordered the Herbal Salad, 24 hr Beef Noodle Soup, and Hay Yai Fried Chicken.  The Herbal Salad was good, but not really my thing.  It had a strong taste of Coconut rice, which is not a bad thing.  The textures within the salad were varied and come together well, the different flavors were okay together.  

The Beef noodle came out next, and wow, I was really surprised at how much I enjoyed it.  The beef was so tender and came bone in!  It had a very distinct thai twist to normal beef noodle soup, with a hint of boat noodle broth that I really love.  The noodles themselves were normal egg noodles, but the star here is the soup and beer rib.  

I wasn't sure what to expect from the Hay Yai Fried Chicken, but it was presented well.  The fried chicken was heavily battered but flavorful.  It's greasy enough that I don't know why people would think its dry, especially with the sweet and spicy glaze drizzled over it.  It came with pieces of Roti to dip in a curry that was really, really flavorful.  I wasn't sure if it was mean to be put on top of the chicken (with glaze sauce and all), but it was really good.  Came with blue coconut rice!  (I was pretty coconut riced out by this point).

Portions were really good sized so we didn't finish what we ordered between two of us.  Slightly disappointed they didn't include the curry with the take home box for the chicken.

Service was a okay, still need a little tweeking.
author: Veasna H.

description:
Farmhouse Kitchen: in one word? Adorable.

In more words...

+Poke/tuna app = the jam
+Vegan spring rolls = delightful (and dat spicy sauce)!
+the Folk Machine white complimented all of our dishes quite well
+Wish I had gone w/ 24 hr beef noodle soup instead of the Tom Yum (which was still quite solid in its own right... )
+Awesome tuneage in the "party" bathroom; think Thai Beatles covers, super loud and fun (different from the music in the dining room... so strange and fun)
+Great ambiance, décor + service
+Incredible, diverse menu full of almost too many options... would love to return and try more next time I find myself in SF!
author: Rachel F.

description:
Oh my god, the food was good!
We were in Bay area for business and came to dine here twice during our short stay. It was that good.
We still have not found a very good Thai restaurant in our new area in Hawaii, so we have been desperate to get good Thai food.

We tried fried chicken & curry, chicken noodle soup, curry noodle soup. They were all good. 

The parking is street only. It is hard to find a spot, but we just drove around the area twice and found one eventually.

The restaurant gets really packed on the weekend. On saturday night, we waited for about 40 minutes for sitting at the bar. But on Wednesday night for our second visit, we did not have to wait.
author: Ai T.

description:
First off you should go to this places just to go to the bathroom! Why? because they are pumping in psychedelic pop music from Thailand that rules and you will probably never hear anywhere else! Now we ventured here on a Wednesday night at around 8pm and got in right away by calling ahead. 
The place is modern and beautiful, as was the food! They had a great selection of wines and beers from around the world and they were priced right! 
I got a beer from Thailand and I ordered some fresh spring rolls with peanut sauce and they were amazing, the whole table enjoyed!
Then for my main course I was wanting something large and in charge, since my lunch was small and I had some serious karaoke to be singing in just a few hours  so I got the tofu noodle soup. 
It was just what the doctor ordered, it was huge, and had an amazing spicy flavor, they even brought me out more spices to try on it! 
The service was great, the price was right, and we were in and out in an hour and it was pretty busy in there! This was a destination spot for us and I'm glad we took the trip to go here! 
One of my fave meals I have had in San Fran!
author: Patrick T.

description:
Pros: The atmosphere is pretty, and great for photos if you want 'em, there's street parking nearby, and the food presentation is on point! The wait staff was nice and friendly. 

Cons: The portions are on the small side, and definitely overpriced for what you get - you can find better Thai food with bigger portions for less $$ elsewhere. I think they try a little bit too hard to make the food and the restaurant 'modern'. 

Giving 3 stars because the food is pretty mediocre for the price. The food presentation and atmosphere make up for it somewhat, but not completely.
author: Lianne K.

description: I really wanted to like this place but the food and service were simply just ok. The prices are a bit steep but it is a fancier place. I had the fried chicken with roti and curry. The plate itself was beautiful and very full of food but the textures/flavors were bland. We were the first ones seated for the night and the food seemed to take awhile as well. Overall not a bad place, but maybe I just ordered the wrong thing. I'd come back to try again.
author: Guisela L.

description: FUN. We were greeted warmly and entertained the entire night by the lively and festive atmosphere. Hip, inviting interior and vibe. Food choices ranged from solid to very good: Pad Thai could have been better-- overcooked to point where veggies were a bit mushy and tofu rubbery/dried out. But our steak and chicken dishes were flavorful and presentation was fun -- loved the blue rice. And food came out *fast.* Actually feels a bit like an Asian street market with the long communal tables, blingy lights.
author: Kate A.

description: This was the best Thai I've ever had. The wine list was great, service on point, and the food amazing.
author: Hope M.

description: San Francisco has its share of good Thai food so I was excited to try Farmhouse Kitchen to see how it compared to some of my other favorite Thai restaurants (Lers Ros and Kin Khao). First off, it was incredibly easy to get a reservation for a party of 13 which is rare in the city. The space is pretty large and the ambiance is casual and fun. Our group ordered close to 10 different dishes, but my favorites were the Hat Yai Fried Chicken and Herbal Rice Salad. The fried chicken had the perfect amount of crunch while the meat was still nice and tender. It went perfectly well with the fried roti and curry sauce. The flavors in the dishes were not as bold or robust as some of my other favorite Thai restaurants; however, Farmhouse Kitchen excels in presentation. Each plate is beautifully plated; perfect for all your Snapchats and Instagram photos. Oh if you come for a birthday, they will do a nice little birthday song and dance for you. Our group walked out pretty full and each person paid $36.
author: Cindy A.

description:
Really enjoy this place. Great food and good service. 
The food came out super quick. Didn't need a reservation. I was there at 6:30 on a Tuesday and was waiting for my friend at the bar. It got busy and I was worried that I will not get a table but they kept me in the priority order and got us a table when my friend arrived. 
Loved it and will be back.
author: Sherezad S.

description: Three words: mango sticky rice. I'd recommend the Chef's Special- Southern Thai Chicken with curry and blue rice. The serving is large so consider sharing. Very unique and flavors we're delicious. Our favorite dinner in SF all summer :) I'd highly recommend it. The restaurant gets busy so reservations would be advisable
author: Annie W.

description:
I like this place because I was able to make a reservation, and this is a huge plus for any casual dining restaurant in the city. On my last visit, we were seated promptly and served shortly thereafter. We started off with the Tom Yum soup, which was pretty decent but also rather standard in flavor, so if you want to skip an order during your meal, this would probably be the one.

We also tried their famed fried chicken and penang beef rib served on the bone. The fried chicken was tasty and served with a side of curry and their blue rice. And not to worry, their blue rice tastes like regular jasmine rice, but just comes in an interesting color. The penang beef rib was by far my favorite and the standout dish of the evening. It was very tasty and also nice and tender. The flavorful meat easily came off the bone. We tried the Pad Thai too, but that also tasted pretty standard and could be skipped to try something more unique on their menu.
author: Daniel H.

description: This place is hands down the best Thai I have had in California. Portions are a good size, quality ingredients and spicy! I love it.  Ps - make a reso...
author: Sarai T.

description: Another sign of the tech gentrification. Bland and unauthentic. This is something you'd never hear someone say about a Thai place. But somehow this place managed to achieve that, both for their "traditional" blue rice dish, and the more street-foody pad thai. For their high price you can eat much better.
author: Norcloud S.

description:
Come here for yours or your friends birthday. The happy birthday song will not disappoint.
Best thai food in San Francisco.
author: Kat S.

description: Stumbled into this place since it was around a friends neighborhood. I didn't know what to expect. Cozy Thai place with cool decor and an old school sewing machine upfront. Our server and staff was friendly. We had a little bit of everything. Pork Belly Salad was very delish. Pork cooked perfectly. Chicken wings and Thai sausage was flavorful. It went well with the sticky rice and dark chili paste which tasted homemade. Our mouths were on fire but it was so good we couldn't stop eating. We had the Pad see ew, crispy Roti and the Thai fish cake. ALL WAS AMAZING and tastey. Authentic taste and the right amount of heat. I tried the Thai-Chelada but wasn't my cup of tea. I will definitely be making a trip back.
author: Junelle F.

description: Tonight I had one if the best and funnest dining experiences.  I reserved on yelp and noted that it was for my friend's birthday...forgetting days later that I wrote that and they made our dinner so special by singing and making our dinner so special!  Their attentiveness and service are amazing and the food was soooo good.   The atmosphere and their warmth will bring me back.  Thank you for making my friend's birthday dinner unforgettable!
author: Florence K.

description: The food and the especially the presentation are amazing. Really great experience there. Also, the service is really awesome! Definitely will go back again!
author: Clare L.

description: It was our first time eating at this Thai restaurant and I must say our experience was wonderful thank u! I ordered the Hat Yai fried chicken it was $16 but it was amazing to me .. The presentation was beautiful.. The interior of the restaurant looks rustic and creative my kinda style! My husband ordered the peppered chicken but he kept eating off my plate it was that good! I just love love the Thai iced tea on that hot day hit the spot! The house soda was also good!!! The service was nice and I never had to ask for a refill on my water the waiter made sure it was always full.. We will for sure come back!!!
author: Lynn M.

description: Their curry and pad thai were both SO savory - really wonderful.
author: Kelly G.

description:
Got food poisoned here!!!

We three came to have dinner at this restaurant on Sep 21st and two of us got severe food poisoning symptoms at the midnight. I started vomit strongly around 12am and meanwhile started diarrhea. My colleague didn't vomit but kept diarrheal (not stopped even when I am writing this review). Both of us had fever, ranging between 100.8 to 101.3 degree. By far, my colleague still has fever. 

This is our first time came to this restaurant. We didn't eat other food before came to dinner and didn't eat anything else after dinner. From the items and smells vomited, you can tell it is all the food from this restaurant. 

What we ordered: street style green curry noodle and Tom Yum Soup Noodle. 

We called the restaurant and talked to the manager. Nothing is solved. Anyway, whoever is considering to come eat here should be very careful. Hope you don't get the same experience as us. Food poisoning is painful....
author: Elaine L.

description: Really amazing, authentic flavors. Had the fried chicken which was so delicious and the green curry noodles. Service was great and fast. We really enjoyed our lunch.
author: Carla F.

description:
Farmhouse Thai has a vibrant atmosphere with it's colorful wallpaper and decorating. I went to Farmhouse as a party of 2 and we were immediately seated in the bar area even during the dinner peak rush (it also helps to call in). The waitress was helpful in explaining the menu and explained what the most popular dishes were.

We ended up ordering the Fried Chicken and the Beef noodle soup. The fried chicken turned out to be too dry to eat by itself and the small side "salad" turned out to be too spicy to enjoy, I typically enjoy spicy food but there was too much pepper to enjoy the salad properly. The noodles turned out to be a good choice, the meat melted off the bone as we were picking it apart. Eventually due to the spice, we ordered the thai iced tea which was by far the best Thai iced tea I ever had before. However, it was a shame that it costs $5 for each tea and it was half ice.

I would recommend getting the soup and a thai iced tea.
author: Michael T.

description:
Very disappointed with my visit. I felt cheated when I ordered the "Crab Fried rice" for $20. I was expecting to have crab in the fried rice. NOPE. The ONLY crab I saw was the few pieces (3 small pieces) that was used as garnish on top of the fried rice. The fried rice also came with a crab seasoned soup and two sides of dipping sauces. I was not happy with paying $20 for rice and eggs.

The Thai sausage we ordered was very good, but with a price tag of $8 for just one sausage (about 6 pieces), the '$' signs quickly washed away the flavorful taste.

My final dish was the Herb Salad. I've never had anything like it before and I have to say, it was great !! Perfect combination of herbs, spices, peanuts and rice in one dish. It truly leaves you feeling refreshed and satisfied. 

Go for the Herb Salad, skip the crab fried rice, but if you like paying $20 for a bowl of rice and scrambled eggs, then be their guest.
author: Co C.

description:
Farm House is your fancy, trendy, Mission hipster Thai place. The decor is a mix of modern and Thai. It's quirky and I like it! As for the food, it's got your traditional (by traditional, I mean popular in American Thai restaurants) dishes, so your curries, noodles, etc.. But it's also got other unique dishes. 

Overall, it's pretty good Thai food, but definitely on the pricy side. So, definitely a place for a special occasion or a place to impress your date. I wouldn't necessarily come here for a quick lunch bite as it gets quite busy. However, you can always call in your order and swing by to pick it up. 

(34/100)
author: Cassy H.

description: No yam, no pumpkin in my panang curry. That's the whole point. Have ordered this delivery 3 times now, no yams any time. Lame.
author: Sarah K.

description: 3.5 stars. Okay, I really feel like I should like this place more than I actually do! I *want* to like it--it's like that guy you're dating who is great and sweet but you just don't really feel any chemistry with. I love the way Farmhouse Thai looks--as someone else described, it's a hipster Thai restaurant, and there really aren't many of those. The interior is quirky and gorgeous, and the service is great. The food itself comes in huge portions and is beautifully presented. But I've come here twice, once for a group dinner and once for lunch, and I didn't really enjoy either meal (I got the Tom Yum Soup the second time, forgot what I ordered the first). The flavors are almost a little too intense, and the food's just too heavy for me. As much as I appreciate the creativity of the interior, I think I just prefer more traditional Thai food.
author: Ava H.

description: This place is so good.. from the ambiance to the food, everything was spot on. Having said that, I must say it's loud but that's how I like it. I love the energy it exudes. The flavor of its food was bold and authentic. Some are fusion but it's no doubt Thai. I love the presentation. The servers were fast and friendly. I will definitely be back and will be bringing lots of friends.
author: KL H.

description:
One of the authentic Thai food I've eaten.  Went here with friends to celebrate a birthday.  The place is averaged size, with a mix of rustic/ somewhat traditional Thai decor.  I really liked the rustic lights in the dining area and bar. 
We had a huge party (10 people) and made reservation ahead of time.  We did family style and ordered about 6 main entrees, 5 appetizers and 2 desserts. 
For appetizers we ordered the calamari, wagyu beef , chicken wings, papaya salad and herb rice salad.  The chicken wings only came with 4 pcs but it was tasty.  So are the wagyu beef and calamari.  The papaya salad was spicy, we asked the server if it can be less spicy but she said the papaya salad has been pre-made so it's already at medium spicy (this is thai chili we're talking about so their medium spicy= it's spicy!). The herb salad was good too with blue rice. Very tasty. 
For main course we ordered two of the slow cooked braised ribs, the fried chicken, pad see eew, pad thai, beef noodle soup and tom zappp.  The fried chicken was juicy and came with blue rice, roti and curry sauce for dipping.  Mix the blue rice in with the curry sauce and you'll be satisfied.  The pad see eew and pad Thai were also tasty.  The 24 hour beef is a must try, the meat is so tender and the panang sauce is soooo good.  I wasn't a fan of the tom zappp.  I just didn't like the flavor.  The beef noodle though was awesome! 
For dessert we ordered the platter which came with taro/black sticky rice, pudding, coconut ice cream, watermelon, macaroon and other fresh fruits. It was delish!  We also ordered the yim yim... which consist of coconut ice cream with coconut milk and toasted coconut flakes.  I didn't get to taste this but was told it was awesome... 
I forgot to mention we also ordered Thai iced tea, Thai coffee and coconut latte...
author: Bash B.

description: I just can't get enough of this place. Everything I have tried, I love. Oh, and I can't forget to talk about the dessert platter...soooooo good and totally worth it. I think it is meant for 4 people BUT my friend and I can eat the whole things ourselves. I do wish they delivered in my neighborhood but it's okay. Coming here is a treat and I'll come here when I can :) Love it.
author: Mel P.

description:
Their presentation is amazing! I tried a lot of dishes - fried chicken, Panang Neua (braised short rib), mango sticky rice, bbq chicken, tom yum soup, and beef noodle soup, and thai fried rice with pork belly.

The standout dishes were the braised short rib and the bbq chicken. The short rib was so tender and the meat was falling off the bone. A lot of their dishes come with this interesting blue rice which is pretty delicious. All of their dishes look too pretty to eat. You almost feel bad ruining the dish just to eat it...

I liked that they offered thai fried rice with the option of add ons - add the pork belly, you won't regret it!

Overall, it's a pretty solid thai fusion place. The prices are kind of expensive for the portions but I think you're paying for the presentation, which is worth it in my opinion!
author: Theresa L.

description: Awesome food. Interesting/lively atmosphere. Great efficient servers!  Must do in the mission district!  Do not miss this place...
author: Chris W.

description: This place was good. I love it but the food was small for comparing with the price. And service was great too. It loves the decoration here.
author: Pinarat S.

description:
Really cute, modern Thai restaurant on a hidden street in the Mission. I loved the traditional touches of decor in the modern, open space. There was a line when we went, but luckily we were able to snag last minute reservations and were seated early.

FOOD
* Herbal rice salad - SO GOOD. I loved the crunchy texture and herbs in the rice. It was really flavorful, savory and coconut-y all at the same time. The portion was pretty big, and large enough to split between 2 people. Really enjoyed it, and would come back just for this dish.

* Panang Neua - The short rib was really well flavored, spicy and tender. It had a bit of a chew to it, but I still liked it. Good portions for sharing.

* Pad see you - My usual go-to Thai dish. I was a little disappointed in this one, since the other two were so good. The chicken was dry and the noodles were a little mushy, but still tasty.

Service was really great, and our waters were always quickly refilled. Great place for Thai in the Mission, but I think I still prefer Lers Ros.
author: Vivian H.

description: Wow was this amazing food! We ordered delivery, and it came ~20 min early (yay). All of the food was just amazingly flavored and fresh. Also I ordered stuff extra spicy and it was quite spicy! My favorite dish was the "Samosa Dinner" - don't think I've ever had something quite like it... they were so flakey and good, and the yellow curry dipping sauce was awesome. Also got the yellow curry dinner which was good though I'll probably try a different curry next time as it was maybe a little boring for my personal tastes. Lastly, we go the Pad Ka Pow which was very spicy (as requested) and very good! Mmmmm. Can't wait to order more sometime soon!
author: Ashley N.

description: Need to return for the beef short ribs with the blue rice was amazing! Came with a large group and there was not one complaint about any entrees ordered.
author: Sarah E.

description:
Awesome food, very artistic and original. Service is great and there is actually parking along Florida street. 

I had the Neau Steak and they set it on fire in front of me haha!
author: Lex K.

description: I've been meaning to check this place out since I've seen it on yelp near my gym so went for lunch with some friends. I got the Pad Ka Pow with tofu and it was tasty and spicy enough but for the prices on the menu there wasn't a lot of food and I left feeling hungry afterwards. So overall ok but wouldn't make an effort to come back.
author: Tavia Y.

description:
our go to thai spot in the city! cute decor. chill neighborhood with one of our favorite bars, trick dog  right around the corner. theyre often busy when we come but we almost always can snag a seat at the bar. my boyfriend and i always get the same things.. 
apps- these little beef rolls to start. sooo amazing & refreshing! with mint and some awesome dipping sauce. mm
entree- he gets seafood fried rice and i get tofu veggie pad thai. the fried rice is very garlicy & oily & rich. i always have a few bites of his but i couldnt order a whole plate. however, i always clean my plate of the pad thai! i like that it isnt saucy.
author: Taylor N.

description:
As a kid, my family ate Thai nearly every weekend, but never have I had such an amazing experience at a Thai restaurant. This is not your mom's Thai joint.

The decor in this place is remarkable. There's a strange disconnect between the farmhouse/country style decor and the Thai cuisine, but somehow it works. Also, going in the bathroom, you'd never guess there was a housing crisis in SF - it's absolutely massive, and there are inexplicably two sinks even though it's a private bathroom.

My friend and I had a heck of a feast when we went. We ordered the samosas, fried chicken, crispy pork fried rice, Thai iced coffees, and the molten chocolate cake for dessert. Everything was superb, but as many other reviewers have pointed out, the Hat Yai fried chicken is to die for, and the iced coffee is the best I've ever had (like a superior version of the Mint Mojito at Philz).

Overall, this was the best Thai restaurant I've been to and I can't wait to go back. A++++ 10/10 would buy again, etc.
author: Ananya M.

description: Delicious food but I wish the portions were bigger since it is a relatively pricey place. In general, I enjoyed the clean, natural vibe of the restaurant.
author: Lori K.

description: Not your ordinary Thai restaurant, clever and creative menus, friendly staff and fun environment. We enjoyed everything so far, reservation is recommended. My new favorite!
author: John H.

description:
I feel like I really have to review this place because I'm worried about its location. Its not on any major corners like Flour and Water or Salumeria. It's a little hidden but its definitely near some other really delicious places. 

There is not another Thai place close enough around this area. I can't say I know a lot about authentic Thai food although I have had thai food all my life being my mother's favorite. My friends though are and they were quite impressed. 

Service: Their service is really good. Everyone is really nice and you can tell they are really trying to do their best. I cannot say that about almost all of the other restaurants around being that this is a very "hipster" area. 

Atmosphere: I really like the decor. It's defintely hipster in its design so I was a little nervous that the food wasn't going to be very authentic but despite the hip design of the space it was! Glad that authentic asian food can also be met with nice design without overcharging as well. 

Food: I had the 24 hour beef soup. That is a lot of food. It comes out with a giant shank of beef. I really apologize for not taking a picture. If you love beef like I do then you should really try it! I also had the tom yum noodle soup which had a lot of flavor. I found it slightly oily though. Their thai tea was a little too sweet for me, I just asked them to add more tea and they did without question. 

I really hope word spreads about this place!
author: Carmen L.

description: I love this place. I was taken here as a welcome aboard lunch and immediately I fell I love . The service is five stars hands down. The food is excellent and arrives very promptly. My favorite is the fried chicken dish. JUST TRY IT. I promise you it will be good.  It's breast meat fried to perfection in a light crunchy ( maybe tempura batter ??) and served with some kind of amazeballs curry that's sweet with a hint of heat on the side ( with potatoes ) the roti bread may not be my favorite because I like naan but it's good . Now the honey sauce on the side ..... baaaaybeeee yaaaaaas... ( total hood moment ) it is the bees knees!!!! Drizzle it alllllll over that chicken (or dip it) . And then we come to the blue rice.... it's disconcerting but tasty ! Give a go . only problem for me is the price. I'm cheap .While it is TOTALLY worth it , I wish that I wouldn't have to drop 23.00 on lunch . If I could afford it I would eat here alllllllllll the time . The flavor is amazing, the service makes me feel like they value my business and the vibe is so nice .
author: PeachBrande B.

description: I've been to this restaurant three times.  The 24 hours beef noodle soup is EXCELLENT.  The pad thai is ok but definitely don't get it with prawns (grilled river prawns pad thai)--ask to change prawns for chicken.  The prawns are not cooked well and not de-veined--really terrible. The iced tea unsweetened is refreshing.  Papaya salad is delicious but don't get it with the fermented fish sauce. Overall nice place. Sticky rice desserts are delicious.  The ABSOLUTE BEST dessert not to be missed is the THAI VACATION!  Love it!
author: C S.

description: Go if you want to burn your mouth!! We went for my husband's birthday dinner but turned out to be ridiculous. Ordered a pad ped and kept it medium spicy. It came to be a so spicy that I had to ask for ice to make into an ice pack and put on my mouth area because it literally irritated the skin for almost an hour. The servers noticed every time they passed but no one bothered to say a sorry. I understand every restaurant has their own spice levels but if you have a higher spice level, it is extremely important to mention it to each and every guest!!
author: Kanika A.

description:
2 1/2 stars

My wife LOVES this place, but I cannot understand why. We come here about once a month, and every time they screw up the orders. I want mine EXTRA hot. They never make it that way. The last time we went they instead made the salad we were supposed to share hot (but not extra hot) and my dish extra hot. Instead my dish was mild and the salad was insanely hot, so my wife couldn't eat it, and since it was the first course, it destroyed both of our palates for the remainder of the meal.

When they get it right, it's pretty good, but that's apparently quite a rare occasion. 

The wine selection is outstanding for an Asian restaurant, but don't try their "cocktails", they're horrid.

The extras they come around selling are interesting.

Service is rushed. They don't care if you're not done your appies; if the mains are ready, they hit the table whether you're ready for them or not. Also, they put a little card on the table for tonight's special. My wife ordered it, but they were sold out, so WHY WAS THE CARD ON THE TABLE?? Kitchen needs to communicate to waitstaff better.

Don't show up without a reservation unless you want to wait 20 minutes+.
author: Steve T.

description:
Hands down, the best Thai food I've eaten. We went here during Thanksgiving (drove up from SoCal to NorCal), and noticed this was one of the few restaurants that were open. When we went inside, people were performing which was great! It gave that cultural feel. 

The food was beyond delicious. The jasmine rice (it was blue lol) was great and the yellow curry was so damn good! Waiters / waitresses were super nice as well. In the end, we even played games where we were given a dart to shoot at some balloons to win a prize! 

All in all, great place!!!
author: Paul B.

description: Love this place! The fusion of Thainess!! I love the new experience this place offers! Each plate has its surprise for me. I know the Hadyai Fried chicken but I was surprised it was served with blue rice along with yellow curry. Love the ambiance! The most surprising plat du hour was the deep fried bugs! I am not a big fan but it was a great instagramable event!!!
author: Penchan P.

description:
The food is great, the waiters are friendly. Reservations are easy. 

There is one problem

We were there yesterday evening and had to YELL AT EACH OTHER to talk.  Their restaurant needs sound insulation, sound panels on the ceilings, walls, that absorb the noise in that echo chamber of a restaurant. This is not the only one in the Mission, but having to yell at the person in front of you ruins the appetite. 

Waiters also need to be a bit louder because of this but they are polite and silent, which makes it even more difficult to talk to them.

I'm tempted to give it a 3 because this is something that is severely lacking in most hip restaurants in this area, but it's not always like this, so it gets a 4. It's great food, but the environmental aspects of the place needs heavy acoustical treatment.
author: Baris B.

description:
Very good place! 
Very good food !
When u need Thai food u need to come here !! Farmhouse
author: Usa S.

description:
I'm from out of town and was in San Francisco for a girls weekend trip. My friends are from san Francisco and they heard this place was good and wanted to try it. We had reserved reservations for 5:30pm but came early to see if there was any room earlier. We were seated immediately which was good. Their Thai food is honestly mediacore for the price they charge. Beware, the portions are pretty small as well. We got the curry, pad Thai chicken, Papaya salad, and chicken fried rice. Chicken fried rice was flavorless. We had to use ALOT of the powdered red chili to have some flavor. I've had way better Thai food in hole-in-a wall places where it's inexpensive. So as far as food goes, it's MEH. Nothing special and nothing to rave about.

At one point, my friend tried to ask for help and she said "excuse me" to our waiter politely I may add. And he legitly held up his hand rudely in her face without saying anything and walked away. WHAT THE HECK. I've never seen anyone do that before..Maybe the polite thing to say was "I'll be right with you". But he didn't do that. We also still had food on our plate we were finishing up. They continuously asked 2-3 times to take our plates away when we were still eating...Maybe instead say "is there anything else I can help you with?" NOT "are you guys done, can I take this plate?"..when there's still food on our plate! After they took our plates away, we were still sitting finishing off our beers, and the waiter came to clean the table with our napkin right in front of us while we were still at the table. WHO DOES THAT? Not to mention when the waiter cleaned, she brushed all the food scraps on to my lap! I've never been to a place that was so rude to their customers. Will definetely not recommend this place to friends and will not be coming back.
author: Hong N.

description: I heard many good recommendations about this restaurant. Decide to give it a try today. Make a reservation at 1:45. After 10mins one of the staff give me a call say that their kitchen closed 1:30. If that is the case don't take reservations at 1:45. I also ask if I can order in advance, I know staff might not want to serve last minute customers. But he say he cannot they can only do Togo in advance. So I told him that I'm on my way, i will try my best to make it earlier. But there might be traffic. He told me to drive faster and nothing else he can do. I would suggest to change your business hour to 1:30 instead of 2:00. This is so ridiculous. I hope the management level read this and take action. I don't care how good the food taste, with this type of services. Don't expect customers to return. At least I'm not
author: Danny L.

description:
I've really enjoyed this restaurant when I've been in the past (probably 5-10 times). My previous visits have all been on the weekend. Although there's usually a wait, the servers have been attentive and friendly, and the food has been yummy and fresh. 

I recently visited on a weeknight. There was no wait. Our server was inattentive and the food was bad. The food came out super quickly, but my husband's food was cold and the vegetables in my soup tasted old/rotten. We were in and out of the restaurant in 40 minutes. Hopefully they were just having a bad night, but I was surprised to have such a negative experience at a restaurant I would have called great in the past!
author: AC R.

description:
Came here after with the misses on a Thursday night and this place was packed. We did have to wait about 10 minutes for a table but the hostess was very attentive and sweet. When we finally got seated, we ordered samosas (odd for Thai food) and Kai Yang, a chicken dish, to share. I will say the prices are on the steeper side but it is SF and in the heart of hipster land.

Though the presentation and decor were top notch the food was lacking. If I were blindly eating this food, I couldn't even tell you it was Thai, or Southeast Asian for the matter. I am not trying to say the food was bad, it in fact was great, but it just didn't taste remotely Asian/Thai. Very fusion to say the least.

Our meal somewhat ended when my girlfriend took a bite from the papaya salad, and I guess she ate a pepper, which burned her mouth. She could barely speak and had to go to the restroom to soothe her mouth and stomach from the burning sensation, which lasted over 10 minutes. And my girlfriend is one of those people that can handle the spiciness of foods.

Definitely a disappointment for the hype this place gets, but hey if your down for a place to take cool pictures of your food, then check this place out.
author: Alan N.

description:
Was looking for Thai food in the Mission and this popped up as one of the best. And it was! Delish. I think I've driven by this place 100x and never realized it was there. Courteous and attentive staff. Reservations definitely recommended, even for lunch. We made it for the last seating at 1.30pm and the place was packed. 

Lots of good looking dishes on the tables next to us and our favorites were: 
Tom Kha soup which is mildly spiced
Panang Neua rib (which was HUGE, spicy and enough to take some home)
Pad Prik King w/ tofu - vegetarian approved and super tasty
Pad Black Pepper Garlic w/ chicken

Make sure to ask for their chili's - they have a cute carrier w/ 4 different chili condiments to choose from to suit any taste. Thai iced tea is served very different than most... kind of like shaved ice. Interesting and worked out for me. 

It is a lively atmosphere with bustling staff and lots of content looking customers. Thai pop music playing and beautifully decorated. Definitely recommend for yourself or visitors. The prices are higher than I would pay daily for lunch out, but the quality and unique offerings make it worth the price.
author: Sandra H.

description:
15.05.30.    Soft Opening  -  RAW review

Soft opening originally slated for 5pm ... was delayed

Food -------------------------- 4 1/2 to 5 stars 
                                          raw review 
                                             only tried 2 items
                                          will update
Factors:
  Soft Opening ... a little slow ... hey normal for first run
                 I care heavily on quality and taste heavily!
                 I always have all the places to do it slow and right than
                      satisfy childlish egotistical wanna be Ramsey
                 


FLOWER ROLL
 Delicious looking and unique.
 Had purple editable flowers
   neutral in taste ... most edible flowers are like that
 Peanut dipping sauce was pretty good
   provided most of the flavor
 Rice roll was slightly denser than other place
   a plus ... holds everything together without breach


PANANG NEUA
  Bumgarner, MVP of the meal, for now, so many to try 
  Short ribs was tender but retained the beefy taste
      (braised short ribs and pulled pork are getting common
          all of them are tender but lacking of base meat taste)
      This one was pretty good and was roasted.
  Charred caramelized onions and veggie 
      complements and lent some flavor to the sauce

Both dishes
  - Banana leaf laid on bottom of both dishes
      Nice touch
  - Enamaled metal plates like my friend's grandma used

They haven't able.to.place the sign outside
Was in process  ... but removed it

During the appetizer ... I was curious...
Farmhouse Kitchen ... odd name for Thai
Do they have "Farmhouse" in Thailand
    Western concept only...
It hits me ... "Kitchen Story"
Asked the wait staff

They are from the group formed "Kitchen Story"
Nope ... never tried their dinner ... now tempted
Did tried their brunch ... pretty good.
author: S.K. Y.

description: We ordered delivery and it never arrived. We kept calling and asking when the guy was going to come, and they kept telling us that he was almost there. Then, they said it had been delivered already when it hadn't. We never got food. They were rude and unapologetic. Will definitely not ever go here again.
author: Hannah P.

description:
Less than 25% Asians eating at this Thai place.

Wait time ridiculous because they hold reserve tables for hours while the walk in people stand around the empty tables.

Small portions for $$ pricing. There were 2 pieces of potatoes in some curry dish we got. Not authentic tom yum with hot water and chili only. Beef flavoring of the padseeew so bland.

Seriously, the worst food and experience ever! Only thing decent was the service.
author: Tam T.

description: Farmhouse kitchen is my favorite Thai restaurant anywhere. The menu is diverse and authentic, the food is consistently delicious, and the service is fast while the staff is still pleasant. All in a charming and well done space.
author: Jeff W.

description:
Wowza, that Thai Vacation coconut dessert.  Wowza.  

I'm not even a dessert person.  I'm a "chicken wings/Tom Yum/spring roll/pork belly" kind of person.  And all of those things were so good.  A few notes though:

I think there were 4 chicken wings in our order, and it was $10 for the dish.  Eeek that's harsh.  Panko isn't that expensive!  I want a minimum of 6 wings!

The Tom Yum was so spicy that I started to cough.  Then my coworker who bragged about her spice abilities started to cough.  Full on burning lips.  My lips were burning off.  BUT, it was really good.  So I kept eating it and then had a second bowl.  I had to use a lot of chapstick after dinner.

We got a dish with sautéd green beans and fried pork belly.  The pork belly was like candy, it was insanely savory, crispy, gooey, salty - all the things in this world that I want out of meat.  The green beans were 'meh.'  They should offer a dish with just fried pork belly.  That's what people really want!  Don't waste veggies.  

I'm coming back for that Thai Vacation.
author: Rachelle P.

description: I ordered delivery, the red curry with pork. Super bland, no flavor, overpriced for the quality of the meat.
author: Michele M.

description: Amazing meal. I have come here two or three times and it's been absolutely great each time. They get busy but their food is always great no matter when you come.
author: Rohan D.

description: One of the top Thai meals that I've had to date! We arrived without a reservation around 5:45 however with some luck we were able to sit and eat before the place got packed around 6:30. Amazing for a Sunday night! Three out of four of us ordered curry, which had just the right amount of spice. Loved the fresh rice paper roll, especially topped with peanut sauce.
author: Kaitlin F.

description:
Came here on a Friday night and had a great meal. 

Must order:
-The Hat Yai fried chicken totally delivered on my extremely high recommendations, and would've eaten the yellow potato curry and blue rice that come with it as its own dish. 
-The herbal rice salad is amazing, with really sweet, complex flavors. It rivals Burma Superstar's tea leaf salad and the Souvla's chicken salad as the best salads I've had in the city.

Very cool atmosphere with fun lights, cool cocktails (including a giant ceramic punch bowl with massive neon straws) birthday songs, and a bunch of fun stuff all over the walls and on the tables.

Strongly recommend you get a reservation. Lots of people were walk-ups but looked like they had to wait forever.
author: Charlie R.

description: Good food.We ordered delivery through the yelp app which was very convenient. Happy to finally find a thai restaurant that will do pad Thai without fish sauce. I've been a vegetarian most of my life and a lot of thai restaurants will not make pad Thai without fish sauce. Very happy with the food we ordered.Also the spicy is spicy.
author: Monica D.

description: Farmhouse is really good. The service is a bit rush and can get a very noisy at night. But the food was good, esp the phad see ew, and beef ribs.the crab  fried rice was amazing too. We tried the chicken with som tum it wasnt that nice.
author: Shore K.

description: Great vibe inside! Service was very fast especially at 9 pm on Thursday. Between 3 people we shared the crab fried rice and the fried chicken. The fried rice was some of the BEST I've had with generous amounts of crab meat. The Fried chicken was a little heavily breaded for my liking BUT still delicious with honey and panang curry. For me it was like 2 meals in one: fried chicken and honey then panang curry + roti + blue rice. Also I've never had blue rice before. We made reservations via Yelp which was definitely the way to go since the restaurant was packed!
author: Paulina L.

description:
Bumped into this place late one night and was pleasantly surprised. 
But if you get the rice herb salad, get some plain rice to go with it. It's got so much sugar and flavor that it's overwhelming.
author: Kate G.

description: Such good food! Cool blends of Thai and Indian food...Also, has a really cool environment - loud, funky, and awesome.
author: Kelsey W.

description: This was an amazing meal. The chefs special pork, papaya salad, tuna, and panang short ribs were all amazingly flavorful and inventive. Particularly happy about the fried grasshoppers that were brought around mid-meal.
author: Matt P.

description:
Good food
Nice and clean place
Love hipster Thai music
I order maing-kam, oyster Kumamoto, and kanom-jeen green curry.
author: Namtan A.

description: We had food delivered. It came when they said it would come. It came still warm. We ordered the fried chicken with the yellow curry dipping sauce. It was crunchy outside & moist inside. We also ordered crispy pork belly Pad Thai. It was so good. The crispy pork belly added another dimension to the pad thai. I'm recommending both this dishes to anyone I know. Next time we will dine in the restaurant.
author: Dorcas C.

description:
Just got Farmhouse delivered by Caviar. Really, really excellent food. Got green curry noodles, hat yai fried chicken and papaya salad. 

Pros:
* A minor thing, but the packaging was impeccable. curry and salad were in plastic, but the chicken was in cardboard so it didn't get soggy, and the presentation was was perfect all around - hard to do for delivery. 
* Everything was good, but the fried chicken was exceptional - every component was great
* It's expensive (esp. with caviar fee, though can't hold that against them) but the portions are HUGE. definitely get your money's worth

Con:
* This barely even counts as a con, but their food is SPICY. we love hot food and green curry is supposed to be hot and papaya salad is definitely supposed to be hot, but they are both HOT. i had to tap out on the salad, but fortunately my husband was there to pick up the slack on that. Just know that if you have a limited tolerance for heat, order carefully. But order, because it's amazing!
author: Erica W.

description:
tl;dr the food was good, but for the value - it's too expensive. 

My parents and I ordered these things for dinner:
-Crab Fried Rice-
This was delicious. It came with Dungeness crab meat on top of fried about the size of 2 small rice bowls. it came with these 3 sauces and garlic soup. Delicious, but hella overpriced for portion.
-Panang Neua-
This was delicious. It was a whole short rib bone with pananag sauce right on top with a handful of fresh vegetables and some crispy noodle-like stuff. again, pretty expensive for what it was.
-Tom Kha-
It arrived cold with no flame. The vegetables were fresh and the chicken was delicious kind of like hainan chicken. However, it was too sweet.
-Papaya Salad-
This was solid. Nice and spicy with lots of sauce. GET THIS.
-Thai Iced Tea-
Solid, but too expensive for what it was again.

I like this place. My wallet hates it though. The value exchange is just not there for me.
author: Geronimo Carlo R.

description: Had a lovely meal of Mok Salmon (the blue rice is pretty and tasty) and mango salad. The latter was soooo spicy we had trouble finishing it. Also enjoyed the walk-bys offering tempting treats - though we did pass on the crickets because...you know...bugs. I have to admit they smelled good but I just couldn't. Fabulous wait staff. Warm, knowledgeable and happy to see everyone on top of providing good service. And really appreciated the quirky colorful but somehow tasteful vibe of the place. Funky but you could easily bring your parents here. Very enjoyable evening!
author: Dana F.

description:
Very small portions for the price. Would have been fine if they would have at least tasted really great, but they were just really simple and not worth the price...
Also, service is soooo slow!
author: Tammy O.

description: Mediocre Thai food that's outrageously overpriced. Does every entrée have to be offered as vegetarian or vegan simply so this restaurant can charge you an extra $4 or $6 to add meat. Our meal for 2 people was just shy of $100. The price is too high for calamari that arrived cold and soggy; som tom that was too spicy to eat when it been especially ordered mild; and pad thai that was bland and congealed into a ball. However, the 2 shrimp and 2 rings of calamari that we paid $6 in the pad thai were delicious. If they had arrived sooner, at least most of this meal would have been eaten instead of using up in our green bin!
author: Nick J.

description: weekend lunch and tables plenty...music playing in the background, fresh flower arrangements and great trendy atmosphere...cacti around all tables...view of the open kitchen busy at work...starting with flank steak appetizer...4 pieces wrapping sweet pickled cucumber slices...beef marinated bit strong and slightly salty...puree of very spicy green sauce beneath...power of flavors...sweet cucumbers, salty beef, pungent cilantro and spicy sauce...24 hour beef stew noodle soup next...enormous piece of short rib in light beef stew broth...tender and hefty chunk of bone-in beef...this is quite filling and good piece of meat...the crab fried rice was delicious with light soup included..plenty of crab meat in every bite and seasoned perfectly..might be better with an sunny side egg on top of the fried rice to mix in...portions are plenty and prices justifiable...
author: Hen A.

description: Good authentic Thai food. Had the street food style pad Thai with tofu and the red curry. Pad Thai was delicious. This place is definitely a tad overpriced though.
author: Ashmita V.

description: Best new Thai place I've been to in a long time.  Great food, atmosphere with reasonable prices.  So glad to have new places like this in the city.
author: leah g.

description:
The only nice thing about this place is the decor.

Meat is overcooked; noodles don't have flavor; curry is too watery; rice is too dry

None of the dishes that we ordered is edible
author: Peter W.

description:
Always had great eating experience at Farmhouse Thai kitchen. It serves good thai fusion cuisine from different regions , and wonderfully represents thai cultures in in-house decoration and service.  The restaurant is perfectly fit for groups and private events. The service is on top of everything. Love the vibes!
 I would come back for more!
author: Ffaahh N.

description: This place is always a solid bet.  The food is consistently good and service is friendly.  It's not cheap but fairly priced for the quality.  They have most of the classic dishes you'd expect and you can tell it's all fresh and probably organic.  I'm not really sure how "authentic" it is because it seems like they have their own small twist on some of the items but it's really good regardless.  It gets crowded and you might have to wait awhile but delivery is also a really good option.  The food is packed well and travels just fine.  Minor complaint is sometimes when you say "extra spicy" it's not that spicy while other times it's really spicy.
author: george c.

description:
Have you ever been totally perplexed by the difference between your experience and what other reviewers are saying? 

We ordered takeout at 9:50pm on a Friday night and found Farmhouse through yelp. I concur with the person who said this is the most hipster Thai place ever. Service was friendly and I had high hopes for the food based on other reviews. 

Papaya salad - omg this was spicy as hell and I eat spicy all the time. I have a pretty good tolerance but this was really, really spicy. I can't imagine your average person could eat this.  The flavors were delicious but I couldn't find the chillies or maybe there were seeds in there I couldn't see so there was no avoiding the spicy. It's the kind of burn you feel in your stomach even. 

Tom Yum Noodle soup - ridiculously salty. Inedible! I doubled the liquid quantity with hot water and it finally became barely acceptable. It was inedible and my husband agreed. 

Chicken noodle soup - really good 

Pad Thai - dry and no flavor

Green curry chicken - wonderful and the blue rice was a fun surprise

I'm hoping I hit it on an off night or maybe it was so late they gave me the end of the tom yum soup and all the spices had settled in it. There was more than a half inch of red oil at the top of the container.
author: Shannon T.

description: Love this place! The atmosphere is chill but modern. The service is on point, with a very friendly staff, and the food is to die for! We started out with the samosas and the fresh vegan rolls and then moved on to a vegan pho soup and the Panang Neua. I had the Panang mysef and I was eating on it for 2 more days! It was one of the best dishes I had enjoyed during our time in San Francisco!
author: Kim W.

description: " Superb taste, presentation, service "
author: Navapon S.

description:
Ambiance: Hip and relaxed - with dim lighting, subtle Thai music, lovely decor and wooden tables. 

Service: Excellent. Waters were constantly refilled and everyone was nice and friendly.

Food: Delicious! However, it's on the pricier end of the scale for Thai food... but the dishes are not like your typical Thai dishes. They have a fusion-style take on plating and taste - similar to how Kitchen Story or Hash House dishes are like. We got:

Herbal Rice Salad ($12): SO good and a must try. Includes their staple blue jasmine rice, mixed with a myriad of ingredients such as peanuts and green mango. Think something like the Tea Leaf Salad at Burma Superstar.

Fried Chicken ($18): Came with a side of curry, roti bread, and blue rice. The chicken was perfectly fried and juicy! I loved the presentation, with a knife stabbed through the roti bread on the chicken.

Panang Neua (Braised Short Rib) ($22): Very tender and flavorful, a little spicy. This dish is a bit heavier on the spices, and includes a mix of brocolini and veggies topped with their red curry sauce and blue rice. 

We loved all our dishes and would come back to try other dishes. It's a nice date spot, with excellent food and good ambiance - nothing too fancy but still upscale enough.
author: Venus L.

description: This Thai restaurant is super cute -- both the interior of the restaurant and each plated dish. I came with a group of 5 and we ordered the flank steak starter, fried calamari, Thai Hainese chicken, prawn pad Thai, Panang beef curry, and dessert platter. My favorites were surprisingly all the things you can get at any Thai takeout place -- the Pad Thai and fried calamari, which were done really well. I also really enjoyed the Panang beef (think beef short rib ont he bone) and flank steak roll, with the meat being super flavorful and tender. I was less excited about both chicken dishes, where presentation was on point but meat was dry and less flavorful. The dessert platter was also fun -- my favorite was the fresh coconut filled with ice cream and coconut shards. Highly recommend trying this place, although next time I'll prob stick to some of the basics.
author: Shirley L.

description:
I really wanted this place to be good. Before I get into the experience, let me say the food was ok; not spectacular. Certainly not worth everything that came after. Everything else was a disaster. You will not find a parking spot. Catch an Uber if you decide to disregard this review. The place is small and crowded. Horrendously crowded. A friend and I ate on a Wednesday evening and can't imagine what a Friday looks like. We called ahead and the wait for a table was still over an hour for a table for 2. We decided to sit at the tiny bar until a table came available. Finally decided to eat at the bar because we got tired of waiting. And tired of being ignored by wait staff. Eating was a mess of getting jostled and bumped into. The place was cramped. What happened next was half my fault, but the waiter left my credit card at the register when he handed back my receipt. I didn't realize that he didn't give my credit card back until I was in the airport 12 hours later. 

Called the restaurant. They did have my card but would not discuss it. Told me a manager would call me back. And happily he did. I asked him to mail the card to me and after a reluctant conversation he agreed to send it. I pay for everything with that card and wouldn't be back in San Francisco for 3 weeks.

He didn't send it. Now I've gone through the trouble of canceling a widely used card and getting all my accounts reset to a new card I am very unhappy with the total experience.

Needless to say I work in San Francisco a couple of times a month and will never eat here again.

Update. The card came today. Postmarked 2.17.17. You had not sent the card as stated in your response. Photo of the envelope available.
author: Dominion M.

description: Probably the best Thai cuisine I've ever had. We had the herbal rice salad, the prawns, and the special of the night, which was chicken in curry sauce and noodles. For dessert, the sticky rice with coconut ice cream. This is what Thai food should be like, it has to be as authentic as it gets. The open kitchen with a literal army of people working back there is also something to see. Too bad I don't live in San Francisco to enjoy it more often.
author: Arvind G.

description: This place was pretty good. Very delicious. Had a pad thai there, but one of their special ones and it was really good. The place is not really surrounded by any other restaurants and easy to miss. You can also make reservations for this place, which is how we ended up there. Overall, I'd come back.
author: Julie L.

description:
Ambience: 8/10
Food: 8/10. Different and tasty compared to other Thai places. Tried 4 entree and 3 starters. Starters were really good.
Service: 7/10
Value for money: 7/10 45 per person with drink, starter and entree.
Total score: 7.5/10
author: Abhijeet T.

description:
This place is good! The ambiance is a little nicer than your average Thai restaurant, but not too fancy. 

I started off with the Thai cooler - lager and pineapples and it was so good and refreshing! 

We got the mango salad, which is super spicy and really not worth it if you can't handle spice (which is me).  We asked for dressing on the side and they literally came with a plate of shredded mangoes and cabbage with a huge bowl of dressing on the side. 

We got the beef noodle soup and the beef was so tender and fell right off the huge bone! It was so good! the soup was flavorful and not too salty and the noodles were cooked perfectly! This noodle soup dish was HUGE and can be shared among at least 2 people. Probably the best thing I ate here!

We also got the Yat Kuan (?) fried chicken and it was SO good. the chicken was so juicy and not too fried. it also comes with some yellow curry and roti bread which was also good. Dipping the fried chicken in the yellow curry was bomb. and then it came with blue rice. i've never seen blue rice before so that was really cool! it tastes like regular rice..

We also got yellow curry with pork which i guess was a little bit of a waste since the fried chicken came with a goood portion of yellow curry. the yellow curry was really good though and i would highly recommend it. 

We also got the pad thai which was normal pad thai and nothing special so if you aren't feeling adventurous this is also a solid choice. 

Overall, for a party of 4 it came out to be about $35 a person with everyone getting 1 drink. Pretty reasonable for the amount of food that we got!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
I usually love the food and the prices are understandable if maybe you're eating dinner but for lunch to pay dinner prices is just absurd. Plus the portions are so meager I don't know how they can morally feel okay with that. I know the rent is expensive in San Francisco but $17($21 with tip) for a bowl of noodles(just an example but every entree is over $18 with tip) at lunch is just unjustifiably  extravagant, guys.

Also to have my dish served incorrectly and then re-served with the correct choice of meat tasting bland and undercooked because the cook just threw it back in the pan and picked out the wrong meat is just bad business.

I hope this place gets it together because the food and atmosphere is great but repeat eat value is low.
author: Destiny F.

description:
Overpriced thai food strikes SF again! 

I'll admit the samosas and the fresh vegan rolls are delectable. Really good. 

I always get the green curry with chicken (you can add eggplant for $1.50- do it). The chicken always tastes really under seasoned and not good. It's got a weird taste like it's old. 

The pad kee mow is great- got almost a citrus tang and spice kick to it. 

Thai tea was overrrrly sweet to the point it almost tasted bitter.

I've only ordered take out here but hope to try it for dine in some time. It looks very festive and they have gigantic fish bowls.
author: Sia P.

description: Ordered a delivery from Farmhouse kitchen last night and was terribly disappointed.  First they got the order wrong.  Most of it was correct but the entree was not what we ordered.
