To make things worse, every item that was delivered was not good.  This was literally the worst thai meal I have ever had...
author: Ryan B.

description: This place helps you unleash a new dimension of taste with thai food (Well, I'm a little biased considering I love thai food). I had the green curry which was spectacular and good portions, as I expected it to be. The pad see ew however, I am not normally a fan of given that it's generally oily and not as flavorful as I hope for Thai food to be. But, Farmhouse seems to have figured out a way to flip over the pad see ew hater in me to quite the other extreme. One thing to watch out for is the spice levels. Whatever you imagine the spice level to be, this is a level higher.
author: Namratha M.

description: This place is excellent. Nice venue and cool vibe and the food is great at a reasonable price as well. I tried the curry and tom kha and I eat thai a lot and this is definitely in the top 3 for me in the bay area.
author: Rod M.

description: If you're looking for a modern take on Thai cuisine with a hint of authentication, I would definitely recommend this place! When you come in, you are greeted by someone who is dressed in a floral button up with some fashionable authentic pants. They also try to capture a little bit of Thai from the up beat Thai music that's circulating throughout the restaurant and in the bathroom. The food was exquisite, especially the Panang Neung! I would definitely go here again, especially if you're celebrating something special because they offer a little surprise for the birthday guest! Overall, it was a pretty great experience with awesome service!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Wonderful food. Great atmosphere and decor. Fun happenings for birthdays. Brilliant service. Highly recommend.
author: Hayley J.

description: Yum! I came here with my boyfriend for date night and it was such a fun date! We ordered the wagyu beef rolls, which were a flavor explosion in my mouth. We also got tom kha soup, which was a lot bigger than I had expected. The flavor was really on point. For entrees, we got the 24 hours beef noodle soup and the hat yai chicken. While the beef noodle soup was really tasty, I'm not really sure if it's worth the price tag. The hat yai chicken was probably my favorite item. The chicken was perfectly crispy and the curry on the side was so good! Pro tip: save room for dessert!! The Thai Vacation, which is a sticky rice with vanilla ice cream and strips of fresh coconut inside of a fresh coconut was absolutely delicious. I had to use all of my willpower to not order another one!
author: Jennifer C.

description: This is definitely an "in" restaurant in the Mission.  Full house on a Saturday night.  Overall the food and decor are nicer than typical Thai restaurants and the menu is more creative.  They have servers walking around with (presumably) street food offerings of fried crickets and chicken feet. We passed on those.  Didn't care for the beef jerky appetizer, but overall food was good and nicely presented.  My main complaint is this: we felt rushed from the minute we were seated.  Server came immediately and pushed us to order drinks and appetizers before we had a chance to look over the menu, then returned quickly for the rest of our order.  The bus person kept trying to take our plates away even though we were not completely finished.  We were there for just over an hour but felt like we overstayed our welcome by at least 15 minutes. They were trying to turn over tables too fast, especially for a nicer establishment.  This made the experience less pleasant than it should have been.  Might return, but wouldn't give them top marks for service.
author: Debbie W.

description:
Out of this world amazing tasty cuisine. Go with friends sample the menu, you won't regret it. Amazing beef and chicken dishes, served with blue smirf lol jasmine rice. Curry sauces to die for.

Staff very friendly and helpful. Place is packed, make sure you take the time to make reservations. 

A must if your visiting the city, and if you live in the Bay Area a great reason to come into the city and dine.
author: Brad C.

description: Currently the best Thai food I have experienced in SF! The great thing is that they also take reservations even through yelp, so you should definitely make one before going. Their pad Thai is excellent, they have good soups and deserts. The atmosphere is great and the decoration very original. You might wait a little even if you have a reservation but it worse it!
author: Sara-Fleur S.

description: Very busy and had to wait 40 min even w ressie on sat night but they comped us spring rolls and food was delicious. I had ginger sauce with veggies which was very good and the Thai vacation dessert.
author: Elana R.

description:
The place very crowded so our expectation  jumped a notch higher as the review for this place was good. However our food was very oily. We order samosa , Penang curry , Hat Yai chicken , roti . 
Roti and chicken were very very oily . 
We didn't feel  we had relaxed dinner . We will definitely give another shot.
author: S V.

description:
We ordered delivery from them, and the food arrived cold and 25 minutes late. The buttermilk chicken wings we received were pink and undercooked. Will not be ordering from them again.

Edited(5/23/16): The owner was very responsive and apologetic for the bad experience. I am willing to give them another try. Based on the other positive reviews, I will try to go in person.
author: Jason G.

description: I feel like I am the pickiest eater so it's rare I give a restaurant 5 stars. The food here blew my mind. Everything was extremely flavorful, moist, and delicious! I came in with my family and ordered the papaya salad, salmon, pork stir fry, curry, and deep fried chicken. The facility had cute decors and made the environment very home-y. Not only that, but the service was excellent. The food also came out quickly which is always a bonus! I will definitely come back and recommend this restaurant!
author: Kimberly T.

description: Had this place bookmarked for awhile to try and finally got the chance when I was craving for Thai. The restaurant has an open setting and is very welcoming, had nice decor and is a fun place to eat. Staff was nice and we got great service. But since this is a restaurant and my main purpose there was to eat, if the food isn't memorable then, well the experience isn't memorable either. It's over priced for Thai but that's even okay if the food is tasty. But it wasn't. It wasn't bad either, just mediocre and unmemorable, like solid three stars. I got the Pad Ki Mao and the serving size was like a snack size. I looked over to the table next to us and their plates had larger portions so maybe I have portion envy. Who knows? But can you blame me when I left with both my tummy and wallet on empty? I may give this place another shot but since there are just too many other restaurants out there, I can't imagine being back very soon. Come here if you're looking for a fun hipster fusion type Thai and for a social gathering, but if you're looking for some serious Thai, you should look elsewhere.
author: Melissa C.

description: Although the atmosphere is lively, I found the pad thai to be more sweet than spicy and the menu overpriced.
author: Jena J.

description: This is the best Thai food I have ever experienced.  And the crispy grasshoppers were quite an unexpected treat.  Don't miss the coconut granita dessert.  Oh... and the salmon was very fresh and tasty.
author: Mitchell B.

description: Beautiful interior, attentive service and very tasty food. The food was excellent, just a bit pricey. My only complaint was the servers repeatedly trying to take away our plates before we have finished. Yellow Curry  with chicken was great, I also recommend Spicy Eggplant. Would be happy to go again
author: Ilya K.

description: Picked this restaurant because of the reviews I read on yelp. It was great. There were five of us and we picked five dishes and shared. Also had the fresh rolls and chicken wings as appetizers. Fellini! Their fried chicken was great, as was the yellow curry. Service was really quick and very friendly.
author: Sabrina L.

description: Love this place. One of the better Thai restaurants in the city. Great authentic flavors and the only restaurant in the US I've seen that uses river prawns - those gigantic shrimps that almost look like lobsters! Luckily we didn't have to wait at 6pm on a Friday night but once we left around 8 the line was insane so get here early!
author: Allison Y.

description: Overrated, I came here with my coworkers for lunch. We both ordered a tom yum seafood egg noodle soup.  When our soup came out, my bowl only had tiny bit of egg noodle compared with my coworker bowl.  So we notified the staff & he took 10 min in the kitchen & came out & told us that the way it is & took off.  Terrible customer service.
author: Pam L.

description:
Five stars for food. One star for service. Huge bottleneck at the front door, driving chaos as to who has been helped or checked in. I ended up waiting to check in for my reservation and got the call checking on whether I planned to come in while I was in line. Really?! I had been waiting for awhile...

Staff could improve the check in process because that is a black mark in an otherwise nice evening out.
author: An B.

description: I don't have anything bad to say about this place. I've been here multiple times and it's my favorite Thai restaurant. Food is delicious! My favorite plates are the Pad Prik Khing and Panang Curry. Ambience and decor is great. Reservations are recommended for weekend nights.
author: Gary R.

description: The food was amazing. Try to be on time for your reservations because they wont seat you unless the whole party is present and will give your table away if they are too late. However they do try to accomodate you once the whole party is there. Go on friday nights that is when they walk around the tables selling street food just like in Thailand. It was a great experience. I got to try crickets and silk worms for the first time.
author: rosanna b.

description: The hat yai fried chicken was sublime. Literally one of the best fried chicken I've had in the US. Of course, it's a different type of fried chicken from, say, KFC. But still, it was cooked to perfection. It also came with curry and blue rice (and a sweet sauce for the chicken) and each part was absolutely delicious. It's a little pricey ($19 for my meal without tip and tax) but I thought it was absolutely worth it. I recommend anybody who loves Thai food to come here.
author: Ray K.

description:
We reserved a place for 8pm and we got there early and was able to accomodate us. 

The restroom is spacious and the food was good. The pad kee mow wasnt so fabulous but the tom tum soup gave us a real spicy kick and the mushrooms were so fresh, so were the other veges that came with it!! Yummmmy.

We had some tasty spocy prawn dish and that was gooooooood.

Very busy place
author: Michael V.

description:
Farmhouse gets Thai food right, and you'll realize that all other Thai food in America is wrong.

Me: Farmhouse Regular / Patron of All Valencia St. Restaurants / Thai Upbringing

Food: Farmhouse perfectly captures the authenticity of every dish while making the flavors accessible to a Western audience. The food is so good, you'll want to come back several times that week. After eating at Farmhouse, I don't ever "crave" Thai food. I crave Farmhouse.

Presentation & Ambience: From the dishes, decor, server attire and music, Farmhouse tells you a story about Thailand. You might sit underneath a farmhouse metal awning or neatly lined rows of faucets. The table centerpiece may be a succulent sprouting from an old pipe or an elaborate floral arrangement you could only find at a Thai Temple. When you order a dish (ex: Kai Yang), your sticky rice is served in a traditional basket and your chicken is served between a pair of sticks. It's an authentic experience balanced with a modern atmosphere and exquisite food.
author: Sarah Z.

description: We came here on a Saturday Night at 9pm without reservations and we were seated right away.  Our party of five were all present and they just happened to have an opened table. The atmosphere was fin and exciting, and ambience was very colorful. Thai rock-a-billie "Luk Thung" country music gave the entire place an awesome party vibe. Waiters were all very friendly and attentive. Some male servers were dressed in traditional dancer attire and were very pretty.  Attention to detail definitely gives this place a very attractive aura and warmth. Water was served a couple of minutes after we sat down and drinks were ordered right then.  The food was as authenic as the village Thai food in Thailand. The Laos Style Papaya Salad with Salted Blue Mud Crab brought us back to the street vendors in the heartland of Thailand...freshest ingredients and the right amount of fish sauce, chili, palm sugar, and other ingredients. We ordered extra sticky rice to polish off all that good sauce mixture and delicious shredded green papaya. We also had the "Sai Ort" sausage....perfectly smoked flavor and roasted. The Green Curry, Marinaded Grilled Chicken, and Beef Rib soup were excellent.  The entire meal's presentation was very traditional as everything was served on old school decorative trays.  The "Wow!" factor is definitely found in the fresh ingredients and unique herbs used in each dish...a la cuisine.  We followed the meal with their Dessert Platter that included Monkey Bread, Coconut Ice Cream with real Coconut Meat, Fresh Watermelon, Strawberries & Cream, Lava "Fudge" Cake, Pineapple Ice Cream, French Vanilla Macaroon, and Light Whipped Cream galore.  Beautiful People, beautiful place, and wonderful food.  Only downside is there is only one restroom for a restaurant this size.  Nevertheless, we will be coming back to this Thai party for sure!!!
author: Axiomi A.

description: Arrived at 5 PM being hungry East coast time. Hostess was kind and ask us to wait till opening. Decor was whimsical throw back Thai farmhouse. Hostess let us sample wine before we bought a bottle. Enjoyed delicious fried chicken, spicy shrimp and drunken noodles. Nice spice and gave us extra spices for extra heat. Great dinner!
author: Soo B.

description: Amazing food that has incredible plating made for instagraming. The fried chicken was crisp and juicy. I ordered it because I saw it came with blue rice. So cool right! Except don't have high expectations because it doesn't taste any different from regular white rice. Pad thai was good, nothing phenomenal.
author: Lucy Y.

description:
The first time we visited Farmhouse was shortly after their grand opening. We were impressed to say the least. Then we traveled to LA and ate at Isaan Station. THAT was real Thai food. I'm not saying Farmhouse is not authentic, I'm saying it's just not as good. They are trying to be something higher-end than they are by charging an exorbitant amount for simple Thai street food. The ambiance is nice, but you definately do not get what you pay for. We should have known better because no Thai people eat here. Amphawa in Inner Richmond  is way better. 

Kai yang: 5/10 ($16)
Green curry: 7/10 ($16)
Yum moo krob: 6/10 ($12)
Thai coffee: 1/10 thimble-sized ($4.50)
author: Edward T.

description: Not a Thai food fan but this place is bomb. Get the ahi and waygu steak appetizer! For my entree I had tofu yellow curry which was also delicious.
author: Zephan P.

description: Was great. Definitely coming back again. Recommend tying the fried chicken and curry. Super friendly staff too boot.
author: D. V.

description: Seriously amazing. Cute, eclectic, and superb flavor and service. Even if you are not in the area, plan a trip (like we did) and try it!
author: Melissa B.

description:
I went there for lunch and had their Pad Thai. I thought the Pad Thai was good, but it was WAY OVERPRICED!!! a plain pad thai (no meat) was $14 and shrimp pad thai was $18!
Come on, $14 for a plain pad thai of noodles, bean sprouts and peanuts WITHOUT meat?
author: Hieu P.

description:
Very good food and service and I would have probably given you the 4 stars if it were not for the tasteless dessert menu with inappropriate jokes.
We were there with 4 of our grandchildren and the restaurant was full of kids.  Please, watch what you hand out.
author: Conchita L.

description: We celebrated 6 months birthday of our baby there. They have best servers, food is great. However, it is very expensive for 4 peice of chicken wings that costs $11. Other than that everything is perfect!
author: Sita M.

description: Dined with 4 people on a very busy Thursday night. Seated us as quickly as they could despite us and many other groups not booking in advance. I had the salmon which was lovely but I hade massive food envy from my mum who had the yellow Thai curry and my brother who had the thom yum soup. All enormous portions. Brilliant atmosphere good customer service although a little mechanical and uninterested. Excellent value for money and a great reason to have a wonder round what seemed to be a lovely neighbourhood.
author: Jessica M.

description: Ordered delivery and they didn't bring me utensils!  Uhh... do they expect me to eat with my hands??  So annoying... I called the delivery driver right away and he said he would be back in an hour to bring me utensils.  Smh really?  They never came, but it didn't even matter by then.  I ended up going next door to another restaurant and asked them for som.  Another reason why they only get one star is because the pad cabbage I ordered was TINY, like a tiny handful of cabbage for $8!!!!!!!!  Seriously, if they are gonna rip me off with cabbage, they didn't have to be so cheap with the ZERO utensils.  The also expensive $15 pad Kee mao was just OK.
author: Esther L.

description: Really good and great atmosphere.  My favorite was the 24 hr beef noodle soup - the broth was really rich with a lot of depth.  Also had the flank steak, which was very good but very pricey.  Had a few appetizers as well as the fried chicken. Again, everything was very good - but be prepared for the bill to be about twice that of a typical Thai restaurant.  That said, I would come again.  I've read some negative reviews about the service, but our service was excellent.
author: Diana M.

description: Food came quickly and the order was complete - Loved the quality and amount of chicken in the dishes, but wasn't a big fan of the appetizer rolls. Overall a great find, and you can definitely taste the quality that you're paying slightly more than your average Thai restaurant for.
author: Bailey D.

description:
Came here for a work lunch and the food was not only gorgeous but incredibly tasty.

I would say the only downsides were that it was pretty loud in there, and the service was on the slower side. All but my food came out at the same time and it was slightly awkward having to wait for it.

But that Jasmin rice more than made up for it!
author: Adrienne T.

description:
Cannot recommend this place enough. 

The Hat Yai chicken was everything everyone said it would be. And more.

We also ordered the 24hr beef noodles. Holy hell.

I couldn't work out which dish I liked more. 

That never happens.

What are you wasting time reading this review for? Go there immediately.
author: Sally H.

description: I returned from Thailand about a week ago and I was so excited to try this place with such good reviews. I took some Thai cooking classes and gained a pretty good understanding of the flavors used. I was a little confused as to why the reviews are so good. This place is insanely overpriced! I actually don't mind paying $22 for my main course but I expect it to be worth that! I ordered the "kai yang, som tum". Mainly because I love papaya salad. The chicken it came with was extremely dry. As dry as chicken can get... paired with sticky rice and a side of what I think was vinegar? Dry, flavorless chicken with dry rice. Not good. Maybe the papaya salad will save the dish? Not really. It didn't taste fresh at all. Like the papaya had been sitting in its dressing for days. Overall just not worth the price. Maybe we ordered the wrong dishes. If you come here just order whatever is most popular.
author: Brianna N.

description: Love Luton garden I been a long follower of kathy!   The best food ever a great  restaurant! Professional great service and excellent food!  Then going to Kathy for over 15 years! Highly recommend the service and the food!!
author: Victor R.

description: Really large plates with beautiful presentation. The grilled bbq chicken with papaya salad and purple rice was delicious! The shrimp pad Thai was a great choice too. The tom yum soup was more herbal than hot and sour, but overall, great dinner. Decor is really nice and staff are really patient and helpful.
author: Denise D.

description: Not quite as good as the write-ups. The first thing that I notice was how colorful it was but it was rather noisy. The service was good but the food looked better than it tasted. This first thing that I noticed on my plate was blue rice which had no taste. Since there are so many other Thai restaurants in the city I would not make a special effort to come here.
author: Mel C.

description: Love this place!  So happy it's in my neighborhood. The food is excellent especially the steak and the curries. They also have special nights with dancing and live music plus waiters dressed up in street vendor uniforms. Take out is also great for when it gets busy.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Can I just say the food was SOOOOOO good. One of the best meals I've had in a long time. The Hay Tai chicken was so crispy and the meal had the perfect combination of different textures and complimentary flavor. 

My friends got the 24 hour beef noodle soup (another thumbs up) and the yellow curry was a hit as well. They also have a wide variety of interesting and fun drinks - the coconut cream latte was the perfect ending note for my sweet tooth. 

Prices are well on par with other thai restaurants as well as newish american spots. It was the perfect place for a girls night out in the city.
author: Courtney C.

description:
Super fresh authentic Thai food- and the staff is
Quirky and fun too!

I had the Panang Curry with vegetables and we also ordered the crab fried rice. Small portions but make up for it with taste. We also got the bread pudding dessert and was very full after main course and two appetizers.

Would be a great spot to take out of town visitors!
author: Danica P.

description: The staff was kind and thoughtful. The atmosphere was perfect for brunch. The food was great, especially the fried chicken dish, which was not at all a typical meal and was both flavorful and well-presented. The best Thai meal I ever had, and a testament to San Francisco's reported impressiveness in American-made Thai cuisine.
author: Joe I.

description: Been to this place a couple of times now and it has never let me down. It is a thai restaurant, but it has a lot of dishes that you don't normally find at a thai restaurant. I'd say it's pretty thai/fusion (with the fusion being american). Their fried chicken is reallyyyy good and would highly recommend. Comes with chicken, rice, and roti. The other dishes are also really good, don't recommend the pad thai though as that is just expensive. Their curry is very solid.
author: Victor D.

description: Love this Thai restaurant. So many great options that you can't find at other Thai places. Long wait but worth it. All the dishes we ordered had large portions and were incredibly delicious. Our dessert, Thai vacation, was the best part. That sticky rice inside the coconut was so good.
author: Irene C.

description:
Food was interesting but small portions and chaotic arrive caused a negative experience.  

Not planning on coming back and do not recommend.
author: Robert F.

description:
So this review is going to be about my 2 separate visits that took place less than 12 hours apart :P

I've had this restaurant bookmarked for a while now. First of all, I LOVE Thai food. Secondly, this is a sister restaurant of Kitchen Story. Beside it's location being a wee bit out of the way, I didn't see any reason why I should not pay it a visit. Last night, I finally came here with the BFF for a weekend dinner, AND today again with my mum for lunch. (Mum got a bit jelly and curious when she saw my food posts on a different social media handle. Curse Internet!!)

It's an interesting location for a restaurant. Then again there are a few other cafes in the neighborhood. Gentrification at its best. Parking seems packed both times I was there yet I got lucky and someone pulled out of their places both times. Super cute and trendy decor filled with hippie ambience. Can be a bit loud with the music though.

The service was great both times. During my first visit, we were greeted promptly and led to the bar area since we didn't make reservation and the place was pretty crowded already. During my second visit today, we were seated at a table as the place was pretty empty. I supposed that people would opt for a brunch place with bottomless mimosa instead of Thai food on this gorgeous Sunday. 

Now on to the food. Portions are decent and presentation is beautifully Instagram-worthy (when you see two big guys sitting at the next table taking picture of their food, you'd know what's up.) During my first visit, the BFF and I tried some of the dishes the lot raved so much about:
*Hat Yai Chicken: The fried chicken breast was crunchy with decent flavor. The curry was flavorful but a bit on the sweet side. The roti, unfortunately, was hard and difficult to chew. We had to put each piece into the curry sauce to "rehydrate" them and it would still be difficult to eat. 
*24 Hours Beef Noodle Soup: The beef was fall-off-the-bone tender and very flavorful. Regrettably, the broth was awfully salty.
*Ahi Scoops: Warning: super spicy chili sauce sitting right on top of the piece of tuna. I literally sat there for a good minute or two before I regain a little sense of my taste buds. I could barely taste any other flavor from the rest of the dish. Just be sure to have your water ready for it.
The second time around, my mum and I decided to try something different:
*Daily special red curry with (something) prawns in half pineapple: We wanted to try a curry dish and the waitress was recommending it so we thought why not. It wasn't very impressive. Again, the curry was not spicy at all and rather sweet. The two giant prawns were somewhat undercooked and difficult to eat. Love the coconut rice though.
*Pad Thai with Tofu: Decent and solid classic Thai street dish. Yum.
We also tried their *Mango Sticky Rice for dessert. They seemed to have combined black sticky rice with regular sticky rice so the consistency was pretty interesting in a good way. Love the fragrant sesame seeds as well.

Their drinks are pretty interesting too. Besides just the usual Thai Iced Tea that could be found in regular Thai restaurant, they have variety beers, wine, hot drinks and tea as well. Collectively during both visits, we have tried their *Honey Milk Lavender, *Ginger Milk Tea, *Coconut Cream Latte, and *Rogue Hazelnut Brown beer. They were all wonderful. 

People might find the price a little higher than other Thai restaurants but I am willing to pay for the wonderful meal, service, and ambience. It's probably good for date night too :P Overall, I enjoy both meals I got there. The one star was taken off because of the overly salty broth and sweet sweet curry. But I will probably go back sometime to try different dishes to see if they might earn that star back.
author: Pearl T.

description: Food was excellent but environment was very noisy.  Pad see fantastic, Panang curry excellent.
author: Allison D.

description: Good food...But a bit pricey for the cuisine. Tom Kha was alright...I've definitely had better.
author: Shawn S.

description:
Quaint, pretty and pure, from the authentic, bold food that embodies the word "fresh" to the simple, yet charming aesthetic of the restaurant.

This place gets straight to the point:

   --The service is highly professional and efficient, and they really go above and beyond to make sure you are enjoying your visit and that everything runs smoothly with your order. I love it when I don't even notice exactly how it happened, but my water glass is magically refilled--these are a few of my favorite thingggs! (sorry broke out into song)

   --The food is OMG never leave my mouth tasty. We ordered a BUNCH of different things, and it was all on-point. My favorite though was the green curry tofu--the veggies and sauce were so fresh and distinct. The word bland doesn't exist here.

To sum up YES OMG YES! Go eat here.

**Be warned though: It's very loud. So if this is important to you, get their food to-go and find a quiet place somewhere**
author: Brian K.

description: The best Thai restaurant in San Francisco. The food was very authentic. We had a great time there in the nice and cozy atmosphere.
author: Yui R.

description: Ew. Took a leap and ordered three large chicken Tom Kha for the first time. Big mistake. One soup had three large fragments of bone. Another had about 3 ounces of chicken skin. Gross, dude! I called to let them know and the manager offered to comp one soup in lieu of an actual apology. Cool. That means I paid 26 bucks for Tom Kha as bland as Jennifer Anniston.  Giving two stars cuz the delivery was hella fast at least.
author: Stephen M.

description: Fried chicken with blue rice and curry 4 star. The 24 hr beef soup has good flavor both both times I ordered it was not hot.
author: LT B.

description: You notice the care here: festively plated dishes, happy servers, and well sourced meats. The soups and curries vibrate with vibrant bright flavours like kefir lime and cilantro yet still carry weighty depth with rich umami flavours like thick coconut milk and tomato.
author: Wiley W.

description:
Had an excellent meal here!! My friend who is part Thai recommended it and it was honestly one of the best Thai meals I've ever had. It kind of reminded me of Burmese food too....We had the short rib, green curry with eggplant and tofu, pad Thai, fish cakes, tiger prawn appetizer, steak and their street food special. Everything had great flavor. A little sweet and a little spicy, which was a perfect combo! The green curry was a little watery and not thick like I'm used to, but the flavor was still excellent. I'd definitely come back!!!

Our reservation was at 7pm and they sat us right at 7, which was great. They did rush us with our meal a little, clearing plates before we were done but I think they were just trying to turn the table since they had a wait. Overall it was still a great experience
author: Jessica B.

description: Surprise!   I had no idea this was near me.  I took my adult son there last night and had a thoroughly enjoyable meal!  Everything was so tasty, fresh and done with terrific blend of Tai spices.  The menu was tough to chose from because everything sounded wonderful.  We cleaned our plates!
author: doug b.

description:
YEAH!!! I love this place. It's part of the same family as my all-time favorite, Kitchen Story, so it has the same quality of flavors and ingredients, attention to detail, and *instagram-worthy* plating, except the focus is entirely on Thai food.

We came on a Wednesday for an early dinner, when they were actually taping for KQED's Check Please. Even with the camera crew, the restaurant was running very smoothly, and service was impeccable. The chef/owner even came to our table to explain the taping and see how we were doing. Food-wise, this is some of the best Thai food I've had - full of flavor and SPICE!! Definitely felt the heat, but not so much that I didn't enjoy the meal like some other places I've been too. We ordered the mango salad, penang curry with tofu, and crab fried rice, which were all delicious. We were also offered some complementary "street food" appetizers.

The ambience for dinner was dim but relatively lively and colorful, so good for a fun date or outing with a group of friends. They have small tables that seat 2 or 4 as well as long tables that could hold a large party. 

I will DEFINITELY be here again. I want to try everything on the menu!! I recommend making reservations or coming early, as the restaurant really filled up towards 7pm.
author: J L.

description: Cannot believe we haven't been here sooner. Farmhouse's food fits perfectly with Flour + Water and Central Kitchen. It's food is why you come and the atmosphere is fabulous. We do wish we came with others because we had difficulty choosing. The Neua Nom Tuk Rolls hit it out of the park with a perfect balance of savory and sweet acid with the crunch of the cucumber. The Vegan Fresh rolls felt more like they were wrapped in a wonderful noodle rather than rice paper ... and the Chef's Secret Kitchen chicken made the meal (we may have gotten the last one of the evening). Bring friends and bring a birthday boy or girl who enjoys attention
author: G R.

description:
I've eaten here twice. Both times I thoroughly enjoyed the food. The reason why I hesitate to give this restaurant a higher review, despite the delicious grub, is due to three reasons- two of which are the result of restaurant stingy-ness. 

1- First, upon asking if we could have a bit more of the sauce that came with our appetizer spring rolls, we were informed that they don't give out anything for free. This was a big turn-off especially because this restaurant is above-average priced comparatively speaking to other Thai restaurants. Their higher prices should well encompass offering a small amount of extra sauce. We then asked them for soy sauce instead. 5 minutes later the waitress came out with the tiniest drop of soy sauce in the smallest bowl. Obviously they had a huge issue with providing anything extra at no-cost, even for small items which normally come at no-cost with a meal at a restaurant.
 I see this as equivalent to a burger joint charging you extra for ketchup or mustard. A bit ridiculous in our opinion.

2- Second, they don't do anything gratuitous for birthdays. Only if you order a dessert do they come sing you happy birthday which is quite lovely but if and only if you order on your own. Both occasions I ate here was for birthdays and we were too filled from dinner to order dessert so we missed out on the experience. 

Third, the restaurant design is quite a lovely open space but because they are packed in the evenings- you have 10-20 people standing at the entrance literally peering over all of the diners seated towards the entrance of the restaurant. This makes for a stressful environment for the entrance-seat diners and as a result you feel obliged to eat faster and enjoy your dinner less. Their space is such that it could easily be fixed with some sort of separator to divide diners from tens of people anxiously waiting to be seated.
author: Talya R.

description: Service wasn't great . But the food omg ! Totally worth the wait for you waiter and your drink every time you order one . Excellent food , nice portion and good price . Definitely one of the best Thai food I've tried , different and very rich flavors . Desserts? They have a big list ! And all of them are delicious. 5 starts for food and presentation. 2-3 for service.
author: Yuel L.

description: My hubby and I went to this place about 1 month ago, saw some reviews on TV about bay area foods, they said some good things so we thought we'd give it a shot. We arrived around 8:45pm and we were offered to sit at the bar since a table was going to take about 15 mins. The bar was small but no biggie, the place was busy, our server was a bit too serious and we felt a bit rushed. While looking at the menu we were asked 3 times if we were ready and i swear we just got there. The food is way over priced. I ordered chicken yellow curry, it was nice that it came with Roti. It was good but the food was not hot, it came out cold to warm. The hubby ordered the chicken wings and crispy calamari. The portion size is a bit small for what you are paying for. I find that you can get more bang for your bucks else where. The cocktails are not so great, ordered the coco lada, it was mostly just a cup of ice to me. Don't think we wanna come back, sad because I thought I was really going to like this place.
author: Christie M.

description: I heard good things about Farmhouse Kitchen Thai Cuisine and was super excited to try it out. The atmosphere is great but the food was no where near the 4-star rating that people gave on yelp. I ordered three dishes: Vegan Fresh spring roll (more Vietnamese than Thai), Mieng Kum Kung (Shrimp), and Papaya Salad with Salted Crab. Everything was so salty, especially the papaya salad. The flavor is not authentically Thai. Plus, they served the dishes on possibly the cheapest Thai metal plates available in Thailand. I told the waiter that the papaya salad was super salty. He said it's probably because of the salty crab. If the chef knew salty crab is already very salty, he should have adjusted the salad accordingly.  They didn't bother to fix it, so that's a knock of their service. Plus the Mieng Kum zesty mixture is also very salty. They served a fried shrimp on it, but the shrimp had no flavor and was way to big to eat with the Mieng Kum the traditional Thai way.  Lastly, I also ordered sticky rice so that I can eat it with the papaya salad the traditional Thai way, but the sticky rice is dry and hard. I don't think I would recommend anyone to eat here and personally would not return again. Two thumbs down!
author: Julie H.

description:
Way too pricey.  
They should definitely add a lunch special menu (with lunch special prices).
Long waits for to go orders.
Not super attentive service.
author: elena r.

description: We had our Christmas party here this year, and the food was really amazing. Even vegetarians were enjoy the food! I definitely will recommend this place to my friends and come back again! 5 stars for sure!!!! Love this place :)
author: Li-Hua L.

description: Farmhouse offers a quirky take on Thai dishes, the most successful of which was the Hat Yai chicken, with the khao sui noodles in second place.   We also had some "OK" stuff: a shrimp and veg dish, crab fried rice, and fresh rools with (OK, delicious) peanut sauce.
author: Aaron M.

description: I love Thai food and live right near Farmhouse, so I've given it quite a few chances and have concluded that it's overrated. I especially don't recommend it for vegans. The vegan fresh rolls and tofu noodle soup are so bland--and I have a pretty bland palate, but I found these barely edible. The curry dishes are too heavy for me (I always felt slightly ill after eating a few bites) and don't have enough tofu in them. My boyfriend would get the mok salmon and it was hit or miss, sometimes good but sometimes undercooked. And I don't like the atmosphere here--it's always super crowded and noisy, and I find the decor and uniforms garish and tacky. I tried so hard to like this place but it just isn't for me.
author: Mary E.

description: Reservation online process easy. Table ready at our arrival. Atmosphere fun, casual. Food was very good though pretty pricey. Fried chicken was awesome. Ahi scoops just ok and not worth $14 for four tiny pieces of ahi. Service was good though a bit aggressive in clearing plates when we weren't quite done yet, and we were not being pokey. I would go back. Oh best Thai iced tea I've ever had though it better be for $5!
author: D R.

description: The food is quite good and the environment is enjoyable for lunch or casual dinner.   A little pricey for what you get.  When Pad Thai is above $20 and Noodle soup is more than $10, I would say they don't intend to attract too many Thais.
author: Oranee D.

description: Loved the Pad Black Pepper Garlic Chicken! I'm not sure if it comes spicy already but I did ask to make it spicy and they did not disappoint. I can see myself coming here often for sure.
author: Deeeray P.

description:
Thai delivery doesn't get much better than this!  

Got pad see ewe with beef and the green curry, both spicy.  Honestly, it's Thai food, so you kind of know what you're getting into...noodles were good, beef was fresh and tasty, curry was amazing.  Rice is blue which is kind of cool, but I have no idea why it's blue.  The best thai delivery I've had in the city so far.

Recently ate at House of Thai, and can verify that Farmhouse is significantly better in all metrics.

Awesome take out and even better eating the next day as left overs.
author: Casey P.

description:
Came in for dinner with my boyfriend as we've been craving Thai food since we just came back from Thailand (Bangkok and Chiang Mai), but I think we had some regrets in dropping in here.

Overall, staff and decor was great. Super friendly and attentive. And the presentation of the dishes were well thought out.

Unfortunately, we found the flavor to be subpar. We ordered the 24 hr beef noodle soup, pad prik with pork belly, and the neung neur. All the dishes we had relied too heavily on the use of sugar and salt and was lacking in the complexity of spices we were hoping to find.

If you do come here for dinner, be prepared to drink a lot of water as we left rather thirsty. I did enjoy the ginger milk tea (although a bit on the sweeter side too). The drink was very aromatic and they frothed the milk very nicely.

Not sure if we'll stop by again. The prices were pretty steep ($18~ average per entree) for what we got.
author: Steph C.

description: This place was delicious. Definitely overpriced, but it seems for one to get a great food experience in the city, it's gonna be costly *sign*. However, I highly recommend this place. The overall experience was delightful and will definitely be coming back.
author: Eunice G.

description: ordered the hat yai fried chicken dinner, yellow curry with chicken, and beef jerky appetizer. the serving size of the fried chicken dinner was perfect enough for 2. their Thai ice tea is a must! food was soooo delicious and prices were reasonable for the great portion sizes!
author: Megan Y.

description:
Delicious, clean, and new. Never pretended to be "authentic" thai - it's very clear, from the name, decor, and menu, that it's Americanized (ex = fried chicken with curry).
Highly recommend!
author: Meghan W.

description: Great food, but the ambiance fell flat for us. We started with the fresh rolls and had the pad thai and the pad see you which were all delicious. However, the restaurant was very loud for a Sunday night with the music turned up and we had to flag down the Hawaiian shirted wait staff for refills. We ate quickly and asked for the check.
author: Margaret M.

description: New fave Thai pace. We had the BBQ chicken chef special and the fried chicken entree. We started with the Aji Scoop and the tom Kha soup. The scoop was stellar. Spicy. The soup was on the sweet side for my taste, but the broth was well balanced in its viscosity. Good amount of veggies and chicken. I liked their "street food" menu. Decent beer selection, though the glasses were not chilled and the beer was a bit warmer than I was hoping for. Good wine list. The rose had a healthy acid but was also good. I'll be back. The staff and service was super friendly and I felt like part of the family. Fun birthday todo's.
author: Seth P.

description: Another yummy meal from Farmhouse Thai. My girlfriend and I ordered some delivery. Spicy papaya salad, Tom Kha soup and my fave, the Pad Cha Shrimp with the delicious Blue Flower rice. The heat was turned up and the flavor was spot on. I love having places like this to share with friends.
author: Karen G.

description:
After searching Yelp for a place to celebrate a couple birthdays, I settled upon this place. It got great reviews, the menu had a mix of Thai classics and some new entrees, and the interior looked pretty quirky. Here's a rundown:

Service: From the beginning, we had excellent service. We were running late and had to push our 6:15pm reservation back to 6:30pm -- no problem. Once we arrived (about 5 minutes earlier than our 6:30pm reservation), we were seated immediately. Our waitress was so friendly, attentive, knowledgaeble, and enthusiastic, but not in an annoying way. Our water glasses were never empty and we had several other employees waiting on us, changing out our plates for clean ones, serving our drinks and food, and replacing dropped silverware.

Food: The menu is quite extensive, and like I said, they have Thai classics like Paid Thai and new items like their version of fried chicken! We ordered the Vegan Fresh Rolls, Fried Calamari, and an interesting take on jerky. The fresh rolls were pretty good, but the peanut sauce made it really good. They were well constructed, so they stayed together even when cut in half and the sauce was thick enough to stay on the roll, but not overpowering. The calamari was interesting. Probably my least favorite, but not bad. The batter was unlike any other I typically have on calamari, and reminded me more of the kind you get on fish 'n chips. The jerky was pretty tasty and definitely reminded me of jerky. For entrees, we ordered the Hat Yai Fried Chicken, Pad Char Shrimps, and Pad Thai. The Hat Yai Fried Chicken was a hit. I wasn't a huge fan of it, because again, the breading reminded me of fish 'n chips, but everyone else like it. To be honest, the chicken was amazing, and melted your mouth, but it was too greasy for me. It also came with roti, yellow curry, and blue rice, which was tasty. The shrimp dish was just okay - nothing spectacular. The pad thai was really good. Something about it... I couldn't put my finger on it, but it was delicious and the first dish to disappear. There was also a chicken special going on and they offered single serving portions for $7 from a guy wearing one of those sticks across his shoulders to carry things on either side (what's that called?!). Anyways, it was an eye-catching display and got our attention. The chicken was just ok, but you could tell it was authentic.

Drinks: They have an extensive drink menu and you can get whole fresh young coconuts! I'm typically not a huge coconut milk person, but it was so good! Between that and all the food, I was stuffed when I walked out.

Price: This is definitely thai food done with quality ingredients (they use Mary's chicken for their chicken dishes!), so expect to pay more, but with four drinks, three appetizers, and five entrees (we asked for two orders of the fried chicken), the total was a little less than $150.

Would I return? Probably. This is a fun find and the food is good. Also, parking isn't too much of an issue.. You just have to look.
author: Leana L.

description: Amazing Thai cooking fresh flavor, beautiful presentation, and tasty dishes like salmon wrapped in banana leaf.  Try the BBQ chicken and rice salad.  The samosas are a bit fried and heavy.
author: M S.

description:
Ambiance - 5 stars by far they had a good vibe in there that made you feel like you were in a foreign place but in like the hippest modernist version of it .


Food ; the food was really amazing. Try the fried chicken and the blue rice it comes with.  Not sure why it's blue but don't worry it's amazing 

The curry that comes along with it makes you want to drink it without anything to dip it in.

Word of caution : there's a green curry chicken dish that the chicken itself is bland but the curry is great 

I'd definitely go again and try everything . Im sure it will be amazing
author: Laura G.

description:
We ordered the northern Thai chicken special, the pad kee mao and the fried rice. Everything was really really good - the fried rice was phenomenal. All of the flavors were extremely fresh and delightful. I would definitely go back and this place made my list for favorite Thai restaurants. The food came pretty fast too. If you can, uber there or drive there - there's a good amount of parking.
I also recommended the kickboxing bowl for a group!!!
author: Saadhya S.

description: I had beef jerky for starters and a Pad See You with crispy pork belly, both was really delicious. For drinks I had a delicious glass of Plum wine and a Singha beer of course :)
author: Christina J.

description: Great thai food! They go out of their way to make the experience unique. Would definitely go back.
author: Stephen B.

description:
This is a solid place for Thai food. We live really close and I'm always ordering takeout. The Pad See Yu and Chicken Pad Thai are good. The fried chicken special is also amazing. The tea is worth trying too if you decide to wait for a table.

I've had mixed experiences while dining here. I think they need to work on the overall consistency. Sometimes it's great, other times it seems like something just isn't quite right. 

Overall good spot, four stars for this hip looking Thai spot.
author: Brian H.

description:
i'm fascinated by this place. it's super thai kitschy, but everything works somehow. they are blasting a mix of thai 80's country oldies and 2010's new hits remixed in the cha-cha-cha style. this is a good start. 

definitely order from the 'special' section. other things you can get from standard thai restaurants for much cheaper. but the special section is the real deal. they are some specialty dishes from various parts of thailand, but they class it up so much that it becomes its own thing. it seems a bit pricy from the menu as far as thai restaurants go. but the portion is more than generous. my salmon is probably half a pound. i struggled to finish. 

the staff is very friendly and polite to us although we got there around the time they were closing but they were not rushing us at all. i pulled my thai card as usual, but it's not at all necessary for a friendly service. 

will come back to try more things from the special section.
author: Te R.

description: Great food and authentic for sure. They have a great selection and as an added plus they include a lot of locally sourced ingredients. It is expensive however and finding parking can be a task. Also seating is limited so once it fills up you can end u waiting a while to be seated.
author: Milan L.

description:
Farmhouse Kitchen is a new interesting and different Thai restaurant in the Mission. When you walk into the restaurant, you are taken aback by the unique decorations and the variety of different fresh plants around the place. I really enjoyed the vibe of this place - kind of felt like we were in the jungles of Thailand. 

On to the food and drinks. I started out with the beer and pineapple juice drink which was super refreshing! There were pieces of fresh pineapple in the drink and it didn't have a strong beer flavor; I'd definitely recommend it. For food, we shared the red curry with tofu and the basil tofu dish. The red curry was pretty thick and a little more spicy than I like. I ordered the roti to eat with this dish and it was a good choice because the thick texture of the curry. I enjoyed it but it wasn't your traditional red curry.The basil tofu dish had a LOT of vegetables. They were all really fresh, but I think I would have enjoyed a little more tofu in this dish. I really liked the sauce it was served with and wish there was more of it. 

All in all, it was a pretty satisfying meal and I would definitely go here again! This is definitely more upscale than your regular thai restaurant so be ready to pay more for that too!
author: Malika R.

description: It's a nice restaurant with good ambiance, the food is good, but everything I tried there was over medium-spicy.  When we asked for the papaya salad to be just slightly spicy, they could not accommodate us.  They try to get your full name and cell phone number when you check in, which I didn't like and they are up-selling their expensive specials just a touch too much.  Over all it's a good restaurant, but a little over-priced compared to other Thai restaurants for no apparent reason.
author: T. B.

description: Really wanted to give this place a try because of all the amazing reviews. Sadly, I cannot say I had the same great experience. The food is quite expensive considering that the portions aren't that big. Had a crab fried rice and it was definitely not worth it. The food was just average and had a very hard time communicating with the sever because of the language barrier. My table was left unattended for long periods of time because of how busy it was. It even took some time to get a re-fill on some water.
author: Whislie W.

description: Amazing. The fried chicken is where it's at. We started with the little steak rolls-very flavorful, the sauce on the side was amazing. We had papaya salad which didn't disappoint. The fried chicken was amazing and full of flavor. Very interesting dish with many different flavors and textures. The only thing I was disappointed with was the crab friend rice. Could've had more flavor. We are OBSESSED with the Thai vacation, so yummy!
author: Claire V.

description: First time at this restaurant from Chicago. All foods its so amazing. Love all presentation. Testy and great services. I will be back again!!!
author: Justin S.

description: So delicious! The food is packed with flavor. They have your traditional Thai dishes but also some really unique ones as well. There's something for everyone on the menu.
author: Roberta V.

description: Fantastic restaurant. Love the food - very creative, fresh and pretty quick. Service is attentive. Definitely not your run of the mill Thai!
author: T F.

description: Somehow this place managed to have favors that were both comforting, yet stood out as special among the standard dishes that most Thai restaurants have in common. The red curry is a great example--delicious and non-generic. Cute ambience, nice servers.
author: Phoebe J.

description: Try to booked before you come! I have tried many thai restaurant, but this is the best their representation of the food is instagram worthy! Their lavender milk tea is a must order, its different from other milk tea, the scent of lavender is just the perfect match!
author: Rebecca A.

description: Came to this place for lunch on Sunday. I would say the food is alright but alittle too expensive. The total amount per person worked out to approximately $40 with a meal and a non-alcoholic drink. The quality of food is not up to my expectations but the presentation was a 5/5. I ordered the tom yum noodle soup which did not taste like tom yum at all. The fried chicken dish was not bad though. The drinks r pretty good though such as honey lavender milk, and the iced coffee.
author: Qianqi L.

description: Whelp. I can't say how the food is because it never arrived. The restaurant was clearly busy when we called for delivery and they said it would be about an hour. Fine. It was longer than that but the driver called to say they were outside and we needed to come down because there was no parking. Not awesome-but OK. (There's always parking) we went down and there was no one there. We called her back she yelled some stuff down the phone said we needed to come down (we were already in the street looking for her) she argued some more and finally we just cancelled the order. 90 minutes and still hungry! Also to call back the restaurant to cancel their line was busy for about5 minutes and then they accidentally hung up on us. So servicewise a pretty big fat fail. Hope your experience is way better. Delivery shouldn't be this haaaaaaard, right?
author: Shannon B.

description:
Came here twice over the last month it was that tastey. 

Consistently ordered the Kao Soy, Waygu Beef, Fried Chicken, & Short Ribs. They even come around carting thai street food if you'd like - we got to sample some deep fried grasshoppers.  

The desserts were phenomenal as well.
author: Trish M.

description:
Too expensive and low quality. 
Worst food in my opinion and the prices don't even match the receipt.
author: Jose C.

description: This place is top-notch! Definitely recommend the herbal rice salad and samosas. The samosas have the best flaky crust and it comes with delicious dipping sauce - yum!
author: Chelsey M.

description: My fellow foodie friend took me to her neighborhood Thai restaurant. It's a family owned place that received a Bib Gourmande this year, its first year of operation. I've had Thai in the two best Thai food cities in America: Las Vegas and Chicago. This place takes it to a whole new level. I'll be back the next time I'm in town!
author: Mark B.

description:
I went to Farmhouse Kitchen Thai with a friend on a Tuesday night - it was such a cool dining experience. As others have said, the interior is beautiful. It's spacious, with tons of seating without being too close, and there are lots of cute touches - plants, decorations, candles, etc. 

Service: Took us a while to flag down our waiter after we asked for a few more minutes to decide, but after that, the service was impeccable. My water was refilled every single time it was down below half the glass - so fast and so attentive! I was pleasantly surprised. The food also came out pretty quickly once the order was in. 

Food: 
1. Green curry - was really excited for this dish, but it was just alright. The fresh vegetables were great (green beans, eggplant) but the curry itself was extremely oily and heavy. I wish it was a little lighter because my friend and I both couldn't have more than one serving. 
2. Pad kee mao - delicious! Noodles were cooked perfectly, good balance of noodles and veggies, and also had a little spicy kick. Loved it. 
3. Basil Fried Rice - Decent. Not the best I've had. Again, a little too oily and not as flavorful as I'm used to, since I had to keep adding spices. Again, the fresh veggies were good.
4. Cool BLUE rice - never seen this before. It tasted just like white rice, but it was pretty cool to be served blue rice. 

Pricing: A little above average (each dish, which we ordered with tofu, was about $14) with average serving sizes. 

Verdict: Food was a solid 3.5 stars, but rounding up for ambiance and good service.
author: Anu P.

description: I ordered delivery and this review is for the 24 hour beef noodle soup and the house soda. First of all that beef noodle soup- just wow! Super flavorful and just fall off the bone meat! The noodles were good. They were a bit stuck together but I'm guessing it's because the broth was warm and not piping hot(delivered in a plastic container) Still, very, very, very good! It has definitely convinced me to come into the restaurant and try other dishes! The house soda though, didn't do it for me. It seems to be one of those items that you either like not don't like and it didn't hit the right notes for me. Other than that, I'm definitely willing to try other items. This is on the list to try in house.
author: Kristine S.

description: This place is amazing!!!! Authentic, awesome food, not oily, service is great, friendly and fun! Come on a date or bring friends!! Trust me- you won't regret it!!!
author: Vicki K.

description: I really liked the ambience and plating of my food. I went there for lunch bymyself and got the salmon. There were a lot of small and medium sized parties sharing entrees as well. I would recommend for lunch. I have not been to dinner.
author: Steve G.

description:
Food was okay... the service was hard to ignore as it took forever to get our meals. Although very nice people.. they did not do so well with service. Asked about a to go box and had my food delivered to my table. Had it returned to have it bagged and it came back on the platter. Did not make sense. An hour past and not only were we ignored but others who came after us were served first. We even ordered immediately after sitting down. As our wait time was enough for us to know what to order.

The place itself is gorgeous and very low key and behind the scenes which I loved and what caught my attn. 

Coming back to review to see if they can change my opinion but my first impression was not the greatest.
author: Nikole D.

description:
Probably the best thai food in San Francisco. I always get the panang curry with beef and it's amazing every time. 

However, I would recommend you get take out, not eat in. The music in the restaurant will drive you crazy after a few minutes. It is like a loud thai rave in there and you can hardly have a normal conversation over it. 

Will continue to get takeout from here at least once a week but probably not eat in anymore.
author: Gina T.

description:
I really loved this place in terms of ambiance and service. It's so pretty, modern and unexpected, given its location, that it feels like you've just stumbled accross a secret, cool spot that not many people know about (even though the restaurant will probably be full because it actually seems to be trending).

I also loved the staff, which are cordial, joyful and know a lot about the food they offer. That being said, I gotta tell you I did not love the food itself. And since my friends, who know much more than me about original Thai food, said it is pretty much the real deal, I feel like I have been given fake Thai for a long time. Or maybe my expectations were just too high. All I know is I did not fall in love for my shrimp pad thai, wich I felt was too sweet and a tad boring, or any of the entrances I tasted, like the one that had tiny fried mushrooms stuck together (sorry but I didn't quite memorize the name).

I do have to make one very special mention for their dessert though: we had the pudding with ice cream and it was so incredbly good! Definitely order that next time you come. I'd be happy to return and try other dishes - maybe after my upcoming trip to Thailand I'll have an acquired taste for it!
author: Gabriele J.

description: I've been here a couple times and thought the food was alright, nothing special. $16 for mediocre pad see ew? Last night, I ordered for pickup which ended being 15 minutes past the time they told me. This is what made me write this review--I got food poisoning from their food. I'll never go here again after that terrible experience.
author: Pauline Q.

description:
* Reservation is essential.. there were empty tables but they were reserved and quickly filled up. Sat at the bar.
* More like $$$ in terms of Thai food.. sigh SF
* Ordered beef noodle soup and pad see ew. Food was flavorful but extremely salty.
author: DJ S.

description: Great Thai taste. Better than anything I've tried in the states. Impeccably decorated surroundings.
author: Rachel M.

description: What a great experience to dine at Farmhouse! Delicious food with fabulous presentation and the wait staff was excellent! Plus what a fun birthday celebration environment!
author: Alicia M.

description:
My daughter (10) says Pad Thai is much better than Osha and better price.  

This is definitely a go-to Thai.
author: Flo B.

description:
Farmhouse is awesome - clearly a level above other Thai restaurant's we've tried in SF. Super tasty food, very reasonably priced, in a cool, not-too-noisy setting. Will be back to try more things!

Highlight:  bbq chicken & papaya salad: probably one of the most delicious chicken dishes we've ever had. Also, the fresh coconut is well worth it (especially if you've only had coconut water from a bottle!)
author: Stefan P.

description: I will say this about Farmhouse; if you are not a spicy food lover, beware! The dishes here are not for the faint of heart (or tastebud). However, if you enjoy spicy food or love a good challenge in cuisine, this is the place for you. I particularly enjoyed the Papaya Salad and the 24 Hours Beef Noodle Soup.  If you are looking for the next new Thai place to cross off your list, this is definitely the place to go!
author: Leah C.

description: A pleasant departure from the Thai fare at most restaurants. Novel presentation and flavor combinations. Small, chic space in the Mission, offering an amazing Lavender Latte for dessert.
author: Irina P.

description: Amazing food, great ambience. But WAY TOO HOT / SPICY for my taste
author: Ahmad R.

description: Overall, the food was good -- especially if you like Thai street food (there's a section on the menus specifically labeled street food, but everything we had from other parts of the menu was also street food). Fun ambiance, but some of the wait staff was pretty brusque. They don't want you to linger, and they made that clear from the start. We got a pursed mouth and a sour face when we weren't ready to order right away, and we were asked to leave as soon as we paid the check because they wanted our table. Which further contributes to the street food vibe.
author: Paul E.

description:
This was my first time eating at Farmhouse Kitchen and I was really excited. I saw a lot of positive comments & food photos on Yelp so I chose this place for my wife's bday. I also invited a few friends to join us to surprise her. When we got there the place was packed and lively.....maybe just a little too loud but I was ok with it. Our reservations were at 7pm and it did take some time to get seated, 7:35/7:40, so be prepared to wait a little during peak time. When we finally got seated and ordered appetizers/dinner I was very pleased with the service. We ordered the samosas, ahi tuna & grilled beef appetizers. The appetizer servings are very small for the price, since we were a party of 6 I had to double or  add a 1/2 order to each appetizer, for example 1 x samosa order only included 3 pieces for $9. The samosas were very small, with little filling but the presentation was very nice, the ahi tuna was good but it was very spicy. I was ok with it but others in my party thought it was too spicy. Now the beef roll appetizer was perfect and I would order that as a meal. After appetizers our Tom Kha soup arrived. I was a little disappointed, too much coconut and not enough lemongrass, a big miss for such a basic Thai dish. Then the main dishes arrived. 3 of us ordered the most popular dish Hat Yai fried chicken. Presentation was nice and the dish was pleasantly good, I give this dish a 3.9 Star. The chicken was cooked well but I think the surrounding food such as the roti (a little oily) and curry fell short (not enough curry flavor/bland). My brother-in-law ordered the short ribs and it looked good! I almost wish I had ordered it myself until he commented. It was too spicy and it was burning his mouth. I could tell though the dish was cooked perfectly as the meat was easily pulled off from the bone. And the final order was the bbq chicken. Again, great presentation but I heard that the chicken was a little dry and the side salad was way too spicy.

So, my final thoughts are if you're looking for a cool, hip & trendy restaurant then this is the place. If your palate can't handle the spice let your server know and maybe they can adjust the spice. 

For me I'm 50/50.....I'd probably go again but for lunch. My rating for the food only is 3.85 stars....just missing that 4 by a little and can easily become a 5. The Service though is a solid 4.5 stars.

I hope this helps....enjoy if you go!
author: Dennis M.

description: Really delicious, expertly cooked Thai food in a lovely, upbeat atmosphere! The coconut marinated BBQ chicken was so tender and flavorful and a huge portion. The staff is so polite and attentive and were nice enough to seat me even though it was almost closing time.  Going to bring some friends who are visiting here again this weekend.
author: Monica O.

description: Honestly, I'm still a bigger fan of Sai Jai's pork shoulder fried rice or Lers Ros's dry tom yum noodles, but this place is a lot cleaner and their service is better. Those that strive for authenticity might feel that the interior styling lacks the traditional/authentic Thai feel. Food is slightly more expensive than you'd find in the Tenderloin ( home of my two fave Thai spots ), but is good for a dining experience with friends.
author: Kay C.

description: Found this amazing place thanks to everyone's trustworthy Yelp reviews! Made reservations for our Fridate at 8:30pm-highly recommend making a reservation. This restaurant gets packed quickly, also don't recommend this place if you plan to have an intimate/serious meal since it gets pretty loud! We tried the Waygu Beef, Hat Yai Curry, the Beef Noodle Soup, and the coconut sticky rice for dessert. And I highly recommend these dishes! You can absolutely taste the quality of ingredients in these dishes-hence the high prices. But definitely worth it and would love to come back again soon!
author: Kimberly C.

description: so, first visit today during lunch with my team members. awesome decor, very spacious, fast n friendly service, clean environment, large communal tables. everything was beautifully presented but i was not impressed with the flavors at all. my noodles were drenched in sauce, i had 4 shrimps in the dish (so $1 each), and the garnish was just thrown on the plate like an afterthought. i'll definitely be back to try some other items to get a better grip on the place, but VERY underwhelming first visit given the new bib gourmand nod.
author: Christina L.

description:
I haven't written a proper Yelp review in a while but feel inspired to do so after grabbing an early dinner at Farmhouse this evening. They use only the freshest of ingredients, and their food isn't the typical Thai cuisine you'll find in SF. Their Tom Yum soup wasn't the usual red, oily concoction I'm used to seeing. Instead, it used a deep chicken broth for its base, with a mix of spices that made the soup taste like it'd been cooked in a Thai home, not restaurant. I had the Hainese chicken/rice dish for my entree. It was deliciously cooked and went very well with the homemade spices on the table, made by the server's grandma! And we ended our meal with a delicious dessert called Fhuk Thong of squash, custard, and ice cream with fresh coconut. The dessert was a real standout and a great departure from the typical desserts in SF.

Aside from the food, the restaurant itself is super cutely decorated, with a clean, modern aesthetic. And the staff and servers could not be any friendlier. I'm really impressed by this new spot, just a couple of weeks in, and I will definitely be going back for more food!
author: Joyce S.

description:
Very Good Thai and their presentation looks quite beautiful!  Friendly service too.  They kept our water glasses full.

The best dish we had was the Roasted Chicken- 4 stars,  close 2nd was Yellow Curry (with beef)- 4 stars and finally the Shrimp fritters appetizer -2 stars.  The shrimp fritters are tasty, but they are more appropriate to share in a group of 3-4, but for a party of 2 it's just too much fried mini shrimp (it weighs you down at the end of the meal).  Imagine a cereal bowl portion of fried mini shrimp.

Would love to come back and explore some more dishes.
author: Nicolas G.

description:
I'm a little shocked to say I think I may have found a Thai restaurant to rival Ploy II on Haight. Ploy II still owns the 1st place blue ribbon for Pad Thai noodles and shrimp, but the Farmhouse is a worthy second place.
However, the overall ambience, quality of food and service the Farmhouse is flat-out Amazing, without a doubt.
The Farmhouse Kitchen Thai Cuisine is a super well-run place, with incredibly creative renditions of Thai favorites. The Fresh Rolls are unbelievable! Wow. Also notable is the blue rice. When I saw the blue color, I thought it was some kind of gimmick, but no, it's a special way of seasoning and presentation. Tastes great...mmmm good.
OK, what else? The service staff is fast, efficient, not overly in your way and always there when you actually need or want something.
I can't wait to go back.
author: Jim S.

description: Excellent, attentive service. Unique and flavorful food that is actually spicy! Fun atmosphere, great attention to detail. I will definitely be back. Reservations highly recommended.
author: Emile N.

description: Never had I have such light yet flavorful thai food. That blue rice was soo good and memorable. Ordered the herbal rice salad, the tom kha, and yellow curry. The herbal rice salad was a great start to open our tastebuds. The soup came shortly after and the lightness of the soup was amazing. Never had I have Thai food and it was so light and fresh! The yellow curry...The least spicy of the 4 types that they had were delicious. The right amount of spiciness for me and it left me wanting to eat the whole thing by myself but we couldn't finish everything because the portion size are very generous. Left with a full belly And more than enough for a delicious dinner too!
author: Fanny C.

description:
So excited to have good Thai on this side of town! 
We are home sick and needed some spicy Thai food in a big way.
They were super nice on the phone and it was waiting when we got there.
Favorite dishes includes the baby shrimp fritters & herbal rice salad. Good curry and soups and all the meat was cooked PERFECTLY.  
Really interesting, fresh flavors, and I can't wait to go back to try more things. 
Welcome to the neighborhood!
author: Alisha A.

description:
Live bug fell from the ceiling into my food. Tried to wave down a server. Empty room except for a couple tables. Still took forever. Could have killed the bug. That would have made it harder to explain a LIVE BUG FELL FROM THE CEILING INTO MY FOOD. Finally someone shows up. Takes the bug away. Doesn't say anything. 

Wait for a while. Another woman finally comes over and asks if I want anything else. NO. NOPE. PRETTY MUCH DONE AFTER A BUG FELL INTO MY FOOD THANKS. I get my bill. Charged for food with bug in it. 

Her: Please give us a chance and come again
Me: You just made me pay for a bug in food experience
Her: We had to charge you because you had eaten some of your food
Me: 
Her: 
Me: Yeah, no

I could tell you the rest of the experience (bland, inconsistent, slow) and why bother. Nothing is right about this place. Stay away unless you like being told to pay now so they can have a chance next time.
author: Mulberry S.

description: The best Thai food I've ever had. I've been to Thailand and I'd say this isn't very "authentic" street food or anything like that but what they are doing is amazing. We got the steak and a few appetizers all of which were on point. All of their flavored rice was awesome too. Fried shrimp appetizer was amazing. Will come back many times. Cool atmosphere too, casual and big space. Good service.
author: Linn L.

description: I love this place. It is our go-to spot for office lunch. The food is fantastic, and the ambiance is a mix of local modern weirdness and traditional Thai. I suggest a reservation at lunch though as it can get pretty crowded.
author: Muse W.

description: You'll pay a little more here than other Thai places, but it is worth it for the fresh, delicious, beautifully presented, authentic food! The staff are super friendly too. This will surely be a go to spot for me and my friends.
author: Mark S.

description:
Just starting out. Not a typical Thai place! They have street food, whatever that is! The server is super friendly, and smiles nonstop. 
The shrimp fritter is tasty and sure looks authentic
author: Dan T.

description: I love Farmhouse! I've eaten here for lunch, dinner and even ordered for special events in the office. The service is fast and amazing, the people are friendly, and the food is always delicious. And the presentation is always so pretty - plates are colorful and detailed. If you're coming for lunch on a weekday, plan to arrive a few minutes before noon to secure a table. Otherwise, you'll be stuck waiting for a bit since it's one of the best restaurants in the area.
author: V N.

description:
After eating here some 40 times, I feel qualified to post a review.

I'll keep it simple: Farmhouse is the best. No hyperbole intended: it is _the_ best. The food is delicious. Every single dish is genuinely inventive. The portions are massive. The price is just right. If you've got friends from out of town and want to show them the Culinary Delights of the City without showing them the Insane Price of the City, Farmhouse is unequivocally the place. If you're alone and want to chow down at a bar, Farmhouse has you covered. And if you want to grab the best takeout of your life at 9:30pm on a Tuesday, Farmhouse is there for you too. Within 20 minutes you'll be on the couch, in your underwear, stuffing your face with kobe rolls and a soup with a comically large bone-in rib, and you'll feel like a goddamn king.

I cannot praise this place enough: there does not exist a bad item on the menu. And trust me, as a local who eats here 2-4 times a week, I've exhaustively searched. This is not the sort of joint where you want to order a pound of Pad Kee Mow or Red Duck Curry: aim for the specials and treat yourself to brand new flavors. Personal highlights:
- Panang Neua. Bone-in rib cooked in delicious panang curry, with blue rice and broccolini. I suspect this is their most popular dish, and with good reason: it's phenomenal
- Crab Fried Rice. Everything about this dish is amazing, but the sauce is what really makes it stand out.
- 24 Hour Beef Soup. Zesty, decadent, perfect levels of spice, complete with that signature rib. My go-to comfort meal.
- Mok Salmon. Juicy, perfectly cooked salmon, wrapped in a banana leaf. Sauces are out of this world.
- Fried Chicken. How do they keep perfectly cooking things? Unbelievably juicy, perfect levels of spice, yellow curry dipping sauce.

I could go on. The Neua Steak is fantastic. The Pad Thai is great. My girlfriend claims that if she had to eat one meal for the rest of her life, it would be Farmhouse's Tom Yum Noodle Soup. This place can seriously do no wrong, and while I'm greedily sad that it has received so much attention (I remember when you could get a last-minute table on a Friday night), I wish them all the success in the world.
author: Stephen M.

description: This is a great place for 4 or more, so you can share lots of their delicious plates.  I love the decor, parking is reasonably easy, and the vibe is very friendly.  Happy to be heading back later this week with more friends.
author: Christina T.

description: Unique decoration , nice bar seating I love this place at the first time I walk in. Food is absolutely great. Order  the friend shrimp,It is real street food in thailand and I have never seem this dish in the state. Must try Michelada ,it is so refreshing.
author: Wirunna W.

description: The food here is pretty expensive as far as Thai food goes typically, but the service was great and the quality of the food was very high. We had a great time and I would definitely come back.
author: Amanda M.

description:
Really wanted to like this place, 'cus Thai food is one of my favorites, and I live nearby, but alas, that was not the case. 

The fresh spring rolls were anything but fresh - yellow lettuce, a handful of sad bean sprouts, hardly any tofu or basil. I was especially bummed about these.

I also got the Hat Yai. The chicken was good, however, the curry was overwhelmingly thick and salty (did I get the bottom of the barrel??), and the roti was also crazy greasy - If you're not down with eating all things salty/greasy/fried, this dish will not be your jam. I was hoping those fresh spring rolls would balance everything out, but... see above. 

Don't think I'll be back. Shame.
author: Colleen C.

description:
