Came here for dinner last night and am so impressed that in a city full of great thai food....a new restaurant has now raised the bar for great thai food! 

The bay shrimp fritters were wonderful. Don't expect little fried sticks....you get a heap of fresh mini shrimp battered in red curry with a great dipping sauce! 

I then had the Mok Salmon...it is actually a recipe from the owner's mother and it was excellent! I love how they use butterfly pea to color the rice blue...never seen this outside of thailand before! 

We overindulged with the bread budding brioche which was to die for and a thai ice tea. 

The excellent wine list is a huge plus and they have really put great thought into wines that go with their food!
author: Alleah F.

description: I'll start from the end: The Dessert Platter is an absolute dream of textures of flavors. The food is playful, delightful and, whichever combination, always provides a feast to the eyes: the Jazmin blue rice contrast beautifully with the might reds of the spicy Ahi Tuna starter, the fantastic braised Lamb and the Great Prawns Pad Thai. Everything is rich and outright delicious, with a zesty level of spice that can be turned up of down depending on your palate. The Crab Fried Rice is delicious, the service is excellent and the ambiance very lively. Great place to celebrate a birthday party.
author: Pola O.

description:
We stumbled across this place because we were taking tango lessons upstairs, and had mistakenly walked in the restaurant when we were looking for the elevator. Even then, we were greeted with a smile. After tango, we decided to eat here and they were very gracious and let us in even though the kitchen was closing in 15 minutes. 

Our service was no less attentive than if we'd come in two hours before close, and for that I really appreciate them!

We had the Pad See Ow and another dish with minced pork, basil & chile. Both were phenomenal and much smaller portions (which I think is good) than normal heaping Thai restaurant plates. 

The prices, ambiance, and portion size make me describe this place as "upscale Thai". We spent $57 on two entrees, a Singha, and a "Thai-chelada" (basically a bloody mary with Singha).

Above all, really appreciated the smiley, nice guys who were servers.
author: Sonya Z.

description: I've come here many a time. This is one of the best restaurants in the city. It is great for big groups. 5 stars for flavor and environment!
author: Danielle B.

description: Consistently the best Thai food in San Francisco. I have been here over 10 times for lunch and dinner and am always so satisfied. They use fresh high quality ingredients and do an awesome job in the presentation of the dishes. The place is well decorated and the staff is very kind. Definitely recommend coming here for lunch or dinner.
author: Eric K.

description: Pretty good Thai place. The restaurant has a really cute space, there's a wall in the back with sprinkler heads and their food presentation is awesome - definitely Instagram worthy for all you foodies. Food was great, but not amazing. A little bit on the expensive side. I highly recommend getting the dessert platter at the end - it was the highlight of my meal! Oh, and they have purple rice - how cool is that?!
author: Caitlin B.

description:
Its a harsh 1.5 stars, not for most of the food (I really like the yellow curry here!), but for the management.

We visited this evening. My wife had ordered Chicken Noodle Soup. It's a big bowl of broth, noodles and chicken - looked great! But it was completely unseasoned and was the most bland thing we've ever tasted. Clearly something wrong with the 

We had some soy delivered and some spices, but dishwater can't be made edible. It remained a terrible meal.

Anyway - clearly this dish was clearly a mistake and someone forgot some ingredient(s). Our server was understanding, but when he had the manager over, the guy couldn't have been more vague about addressing our complaints. No offer of another dish or even replacing the existing one. Ruined the entire meal. 

I do like the food here, but we had a bad meal and my wife was super annoyed (and hungry).
author: Nick L.

description: Best Thai in town. Period. Amazing food, great service, great decoration, music, etc...
author: Dimitri S.

description: It was so cool thai food ever.. Love the design, the test and the food. Green curry and the noodle was super perfect yummmm!
author: Chu O.

description:
Made a reservation for 2, an hour before I went. We walk in and there are only 3 people seated. It was ok until they seated us at the only table adjacent to the bar, in the corner. Bad start. 

Everything sounded yummy so we took our time ordering, getting waters first. 

A server came by and took our appetizer and drink orders. 

Samosa- $9 
This came with 3 pieces and a bowl of curry for dipping. The size was smaller than my palm and I'm a petite person. The curry lacked flavor so it seemed a bit useless.

Num Tok Rolls- $13
This came with 4 small rolls of flank steak. Decent portions with a good flavor. I understand the pricing on this one because of the meat quality.

We kept looking around for a server to take our order for the entrees but we couldn't get their attention. By this point, three more tables had been seated. We weren't able to order our entrees until they brought us our appetizers. 

Red curry w/ chicken- $13
This was pretty basic. Hard to screw up. 

Hat Yai Fried Chicken- $18
I was really excited to try this after reading the reviews. The presentation was beautiful, with the blue rice, chicken nicely stacked with roti on top, and colorful potato curry. The chicken was nice and crunchy. Two stars for this.

Not sure if this is a cultural thing, but each server came up to us to ask if we were ok... But they only looked/talked to my boyfriend... ALL 3 boys and one girl. I get he's good-looking, but I felt really disrespected especially since they asked him if he wanted a second beer and didn't bother to look and ask me... And I actually wanted one. VERY RUDE. To top it off, once they saw my boyfriends plate was empty they asked him twice if he wanted MY food boxed up, even though I was still eating...

2 appetizers, 2 entrees, and 2 beers= $74

This place is overpriced for whatever Thai food. Definitely geared for all the money in the area. This place needs better customer service.
author: Lilimae S.

description: Very nice food, attentive service, and a lively ambience that isn't your classic Thai place, but clearly the Thai place you want to be eating at again. Even better to have it in walking distance...
author: Knut M.

description:
My coworkers and I visited this restaurant, which I am understanding is the new kid in town, and they've totally got it going on. Service, cuisine, drink menu, and lovely interior design. I loved their concept and idea for a restaurant, because to me farmhouse, chicken and waffles, right? But i'm just a foreign Texas girl in the big San Fransisco city, so what do I know?!

I am a sucker for this farmhouse decor trend, so my heart was won over by the long wooden family style table we were sat at, along with the rest of the interior decor. Mason jars, big glass containers of flowers, and a super homey feel through out the entire place.  The drink menu was extensive, with beers and cocktails, and even some mocktails, which I am sure my former pregnant self would have appreciated back in the day. I stuck with an IPA which perfectly complimented my dish of Crab Fried Rice. My portion was a huge and served with a soup side dish. We had some heavenly appetizers chosen by our host for the evening and the Papaya Salad was incredible! But warning- the spice level is UP there. It left even our pro Thai eaters sweating a few bullets that night! Our server for the evening made sure our water glasses were constantly filled (perhaps it was the sight of us fanning ourselves!), and took wonderful care of all ten of us for the entire evening; everyone's order was perfectly executed and dishes were cleared promptly.
author: Casey S.

description: Came here for my birthday with friends and loved it! The place was hard to find at night since it was dark and kind of remote, but good thing there's parking right in front of the restaurant. I got the fried chicken dish with blue rice and it blew me away! Will totally come back again just for the dish. My friends got the special dishes (northern something- It looked like pho noodles), the pad kee mao and ribs- but they all said it was too spicy for them. I recommend asking them to adjust the spice level if you are not used to eating spicy food. Other than that, you must come here for the fried chicken curry with blue rice!
author: Michelle O.

description: best thai food I've ever had. They use organic marys chicken which is a huge plus for me. The atmosphere is seriously on point. The presentation of the food is beautiful and definitely Instagram worthy. The service was perfect and very attentive. Will definitely be back!
author: Tea F.

description: If you dont notice, you'll miss this place. Its in between houses and business warehouses. My bf and I were on our way to the sf auto car show and decided to get food on out way. Hes been here before but today was my first time. Lets just say i had no regrets. Good service and good food. Also first time ive ever seen blue rice!
author: veronica s.

description: Oh man, this was some of the best Thai food that I've ever had.  It just tasted like high quality ingredients.  Sort of modern decor, definitely packed, and not really on a main drag out in the mission, but definitely worth checking out.
author: Charles C.

description:
I dunno man, this seems like a case of the Emperor's new clothes. Overpriced and middle of the road new clothes. I came, I saw, and I'm not coming back.

I lived in HK for 4 years and traveled frequently to Thailand, so I have some sort of benchmark to compare to, flavor-wise. The coconut chicken soup is delicious, the pad thai is decent, the papaya salad is not bad, the curry is ok. I'm not sure I get the overwhelming love, not to mention this place is way WAY WAY OVERPRICED for what it's producing.

There's comparable quality at cheaper prices just a few streets over. Don't feed the high-priced hipster yuppy foodie beast in SF!!
author: J K.

description:
Food: 5/5
Very original meals on the menu. I got the Dok Salmon: fresh fish, excellent cooking, authentic presentation, various spices.
Service: 3/5 
So-so. We got asked about our food order 3 min after we got seated, while we were still looking at the menu and chatting. Same thing happened for the desert order. They also brought us the wrong desert, and instead of leaving it on the table since it was already 1/4 eaten, they took it (and assume throwed it away) before bringing the "right" desert that was ordered.
Setting: 4/5
A cosy and spacious room. And on top of that, not noisy as most of the restaurants in the city. It could be a bit warmer in the room though.
Value: 4/5
Well worth it for the quality and quantity in the plate!

Overall, I really rcommend this place!
author: Sabrina B.

description: Order anything and it'll be amazing! I love their fried chicken and curries. they need to make more unique dishes!
author: A L.

description: Frankly, we discovered farmhouse when we were desperately waiting for a bowl of pasta just like beggars! in front of flour+water, Good riddance, we were asked to wait for an hour and during those desperate moments we took a stroll around the block and BAM! there you go, farmhouse! Lamb chop and fried chicken is phenomenal, it's like go-to food each time i dine here. I am not a fan of their drinks tho, go to next door to tick dog ;)
author: Beril Y.

description:
Upon entering I immediately knew this place was something special! The decor, like a farmhouse, was different from any other Thai restaurant I've been to.

Ordered the curry noodles and the Short Rib Penang curry.  The curry noodles were really good but the Short Rib Penang was the one to rave about! Tasty and with just the right amount of fat to moisten the taste buds! :)

I really like how they serve with really large platters and condiments, reminding  me of back home in Asia! 

Ended our meal off with coconut sorbet. I'll be honest I wasn't expecting much from it, but was also just blown away with the presentation. 

After this got a chance to meet Chef Kasem and he explained his design inspirations for the restaurant !!  

Thanks for the talk Chef Kasem it was a great pleasure meeting you and congratulations on this new restaurant!! We Will definitely be back soon with our friends!!
author: Kelvin Y.

description:
Excellent food ,deep rich Thai flavors, quick and delicious. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable.
I love Thai food, this place is awesome.
author: eigil q.

description: My favorite Thai place as of late and since it opened!  You can also make a ressie here.  I recommend the fried chicken, thai crispy rolls, curry and their specials.  Great service here!
author: Carli F.

description: Love this place, really great presentation and taste for food. Atmosphere is definitely on the louder side
author: Jessica S.

description: Amazing Thai food. The dessert even was amazing. Best in the city, maybe even country.
author: Meaghan H.

description: Poor service. They make you wait forever. Surprising that their guests tolerate such poor service. The food was delicious -shame about the service at our dinner table and their denying that the service was poor.
author: SD K.

description:
We were visiting from NYC and our local friends suggested this place (we are OBSESSED with Thai food!).

There were 8 of us on a Sunday night and we tried at least one plate from each category. I can still taste the short ribs...and the red chicken curry. The quality of meat they use is by the best I've had (could be an SF thing?!).

Our only complaint was the door kept opening and chilling the space; other than that, service, ambiance and food were all amazing.

I'll go back to SF just to go here again.
author: Alyson D.

description: This place is in a cool area of town which is on the brink of the Mission and Protrero areas. Food was ok, but expensive. Service was attentive enough. The noise level can get loud.
author: Angela L.

description: Great space . Parking sucks. Good food and service. Interesting blue rice some things are very spicy and they are not able to adjust the heat on some dishes
author: Smith S.

description: Love the food, decor & service! Must try Hat Yai Fried Chicken & 24 hours Braised Noodle Soup! The fried chicken is moist & not heavily breaded. The beef is fall off the bone. For appetizer - Neua Num Tok Rolls! The beef is deliciously marinated & full of flavor. Try the Ginger Milk Tea, nice kick.  Thai ice tea too heavy on ice.
author: Cindy C.

description:
I ordered Tom Yum, Pad Thai and a Mango Salad to be delivered.
Delivery was painless, on time and the food was warm. Pad Thai was average. The mango salad was less than average. The Tom Yum had chicken bones and more chicken skin and and fat than meat. I won't go back.
author: John G.

description:
Amazing food. Just disappointed that they threw out one of the dishes I asked to be packed away.

I forgot to mention quality service in and out of the restaurant as you can see from their response below :)
author: Justin B.

description:
Recently moved from Inner Richmond to Dogpatch and have been struggling to find a good Thai restaurant.  Well, the search is OVER! Our meal at Farmhouse was like finding the promise land!  The entire experience was that of discovering the unexpected, and we LOVED it!  The decor inside is more what you would expect of the latest and greatest new american "gastro pub"; not what you would typically expect from a thai restaurant.  Such a wonderful surprise!  On to the main show stopper... the FOOD! 

I love Thai food, always have, always will.  I find it rare that a thai restaurant throws a curve ball at me and serves me up something I've never had.  That was exactly what happened with the unbelievably good food at Farmhouse!  We got the wagyu beef wrapped around mint & cucumber to start, panang curry with chicken, and the pad kee mao.  I'll start with the appetizer: absolutely amazing!  I've never had anything like this, and that automatically excites me. GET THIS APPETIZER!  The pad kee mao had some really fabulous flavors that I've rarely had in a thai noodle dish.  Somewhat reminiscent of masaman curry flavors, but even more intricate and some extra spicy kick!  The curry was also great, although it was our least favorite of our amazing meal.  Plus, there's blue rice... that's right, rice, that's BLUE!  That makes the trip worth it all by itself!
author: Kendall S.

description: Ordered for pickup via Yelp and everything was made delicious and on time! Perfect for a Friday lunch at the office.
author: Sarah U.

description: Had an 8:00pm reservation arrive at 7:55pm I was told to wait 5min, 15min went by and was told they where waiting for a table. 15 more min went by and still no table and finally after I express my frustration at 8:35 we finally got seated. Having a reservation serve no purpose at this place very disappointed won't be coming here again.
author: Ulysses W.

description: Magically delicious, start to finish. The chicken dishes in particular were amazing. The top Thai restaurant I've been to outside  Thailand. And very reasonable for SF, too.
author: Doug B.

description: Two words: Hat Yai. The bombest fried chicken I've ever had from a Thai place; definitely worth the wait. Pairing them up with a few scallion pancakes, curry chicken and blue rice: match made in heaven. Also, you don't have to worry about the bones! Highly recommended!
author: Eddy X.

description: This food is phenomenal. I love to come here with big parties and try all the tasty offerings. BEST DISH: fried chicken with the yellow curry.
author: K P.

description: This place is a definitely must try place! I came here with a group of three and we explored the menu like nobody else could. We ordered the Khan-toke set, street fair shrimp fritters, papaya salad, 24 hour beef noodle soup, and the Hat yai chicken. I have to say my favorite was the hat yai chicken! The curry was so flavorful and the bread that they served was flaky and not too oily. The chicken on the dish was also very moist but I had to keep dipping my bread in the curry. The street fair shrimp fritters was something new and interesting that I haven't ever tried and they were really good. I love going to southeast Asian restaurants and ordering papaya salad; there is something that is so comforting and fresh about it, and this is by far one of the best! The salad was really spicy which I loved and very balanced. The only thing I would have to say that was a little let down was the 24 hour beef soup. It was good, but I was comparing it to a Chinese beef noodle soup, which might have been the wrong decision, but none the less was still good.
author: Brandon C.

description: We celebrated our friends birthday party last 9/16/2016 it was an amazing experience, all servers are friendly and attentive to our needs. Reasonable price for the service and food we get. The crew will sing a birthday song with their authentic Thai drums that will create loads of attention to the dinners.  Over all it was a fun night of celebration.  Just be aware the food portions are small money for the bucks tips are included for large parties.
author: De N.

description: Well,  don't tell anyone,  but this place is off the charts good. Excellent food,  service, venue. Try the calamari, herb rice salad,  panang curry,  finishing it off with a coconut latte and mango sticky rice. All exceptionally delicious. And reasonably priced,  too.
author: David C.

description: Did delivery. Pad kee mow was ok. Papaya salad was way too spicy even though I marked medium and had way too much fermented fish sauce (that's real bad). Curry was not tasty and meat was chewy. Nope never again. Can't count on Yelp reviews for deliveries I guess.
author: Ido K.

description: Food was really tasty (spicy!). They were a bit too busy for their own good. Took about 20 minutes to get our table open even though we had reservations.
author: Q L.

description: great thai place. definitely get that traditional home cooked taste as opposed to the commercialized chain restaurant version. the menu is small and simple which i think lets the chefs do a better job. place get busy quick. come early. parking is very difficult, get an Uber. i held off on the fifth star because of parking.
author: Pingkian S.

description: The staff here was awesome. We were 10 minutes late for our reservation and they still sat us. The food was probably the best thai I've ever had in SF and I would recommend it to everyone.
author: Graham K.

description: Mmmmmmm. My new favorite thai in SF, ties with Lers Ros but for different dishes. The pork belly salad is a must order and is my new benchmark for what $13 is worth. Everything is delicious, especially their chef specials and more unique dishes. Even thai food aficionados will find something new and tasty here.
author: Katherine W.

description: Went there with my wife and two daughters tonight to try it out.  We went all out and ordered every thing we  liked from current yelp pictures. Being from Laos I'm a bit picky about my thai and lao food. Lets just say I was very impressed with all their dishes.  The flavors reminded me of home. Everything tasted just right. The girls and I had a wonderful time and will be back again for sure. Its refreshing to see a busy thai restaurant that has excellent and friendly staff. Unlike Osha who is known for crap service.  The flavors here are more authentic and simple which is what I prefer.  In regards to price I think it's fair for the quality and care that goes into making it so no complaints from me there.  Can't wait to go back!
author: Sho N.

description: Get the Hat Yai Fried Chicken. Omg. I moved out of the area and I must say- this is one of the must have items on my list whenever I come back to visit. Probably the best Thai food I've ever had. Of course I always only get the fried chicken so I'm not sure about anything else on the menu. But it is to die for.
author: Amber C.

description: Based on previous reviews, it seemed like there are many vegetarian options.  In fact, there are very few.  Most of the dishes, even the ones that appear to be vegetarian, contain fish sauce. Our waiter was very diligent in letting us know that. We ended up with pad thai and a curry, both which were OK but not that flavorfull. This is probably a much better restaurant if you eat fish and meat.
author: Shelley S.

description: Delicious food.  Good to share family style or individually.  Great ambiance, friendly service and good for groups.
author: Kim K.

description: This place is so delicious! My fiancé and I love eating here! My favorite thing to order is the panang curry! It's so delicious, I like it with the roti! My fiancé loves the yellow curry we both add chicken and it's so tasty! The prices are a little on the higher end but it's so good! I don't mind paying a little extra if the food is that good! The staff is friendly for the most part, we have had a not so pleasant server here and there.
author: Melody M.

description: Really good for takeout. Flavors bold. Generous portions.
author: Bib G.

description: Beautiful space, big an modern, clean, and the food is amazing. Get the fried chicken, Thai ice tea, and the beef rolls. You won't be disappointed.
author: Michelle D.

description: Overrated! I love Thai food and I've been to pretty much every single Thai restaurant in SF. I've just had the worst pad Thai ever at Farmhouse.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Food: 4 stars. Tasty and beautifully presented. Good use of vegetables--asparagus in my pad kee mow was surprisingly great!
Value: 2 stars. I want a fourteen-dollar lunch entree to fill me up and this wasn't even close.
Service: 2 stars. Slow and inattentive, which is fine at a cheaper place but not one with pretentions to fine dining.
author: Mike B.

description: Was seriously craving some Thai food after spending days wine tasting and eating cheese and this place was recommended by a friend.  The food was everything I hoped for...tasty, spicy and comforting!  The only drawback is that they close at 2pm for lunch and their rice is blue. I wish I knew why it was blue as all I kept thinking was I was eating food coloring for no good reason.
author: LJ M.

description: Farmhouse kitchen is delicious! Such yummy food full of flavour and lots of choice on the menu. Portion sizes are huge, especially for the starters. Wagyu beef jerky and fish cakes were delicious. I had the BBQ chicken and it was amazing. Also try the iced coffee. Definitely recommend it!
author: Allie S.

description: Food was fabulous! We loved the fried chicken and beef brisket.  Both were unique dishes you won't find at most Thai restaurants. Restaurant had a nice modern open feel. A bit loud. Make a reservation because this place is packed on Friday night!
author: Ali Z.

description: Farmhouse Thai is unlike any other Thai restaurant, with a homey farm feel combined with a slightly hipster San Francisco vibe. Their menu boasts some unique items in addition to the typical phad thai and pad see ew. My boyfriend and I came in for lunch and tried the BBQ chicken, which came on a decorated plate with some fun extras. Two chicken legs came still on the skewer with the meat cooked perfectly. It was both juicy and tender and the skin had a delicious seasoning and smoky char. The purple sticky rice came in a little bamboo container that made the rice extremely aromatic. The papaya salad on the side was a little too spicy for me, but it was a refreshing counter to the chicken. We also tried the side of roti, which I would not recommend just because the portion size was miniscule. Other popular dishes include the beef noodle soup and fried chicken, which I'll definitely be back to try!
author: Ashley T.

description: Farmhouse Kitchen is an awesome addition to both the neighborhood, and the SF foodie scene.  I grew up in Seattle and have always lamented over how few good/varied Thai and Vietnamese spots there are in SF and am therefore psyched for this spot.  The food was clean, bright and full of awesome flavors (ask for their homemade chili paste as an accompaniment).  Loved the calamari dipping sauce (could drink it!) and the 1/2 grilled chicken with green papaya.  The mango sticky rice was excellent (clearly ordered basics to start with!); the guy next to us ordered the custard with yam for dessert and I am intrigued...
author: Whitney M.

description: I have only ordered Farmhouse Kitchen Thai delivered. We ordered the Tom Yum and when they say spicy they mean it. I ordered mild and it was still to spicy for me to eat very much. We also ordered the red curry and the fried rice. My favorite was the fried rice. The fried rice just had a different taste that was unique to other Thai I have tried.
author: Paul D.

description: Bright and intense flavors! We had the curry shrimp, short rib curry and blue rice salad. Can't wait to go back to try more! Highly recommended if you like Thai food but want something other than the usual Thai food menu.
author: Sean R.

description: Food was delicious and authentic!  Now I want to visit Thailand!  The staff was so nice!   We went in after a Giants game and it happened to be a New Year (Thai) celebration so there was a live band, prizes.  The staff had on beautiful costumes too.  Will definitely be back!
author: Anna C.

description: DAMN GOOD THAI FOOD. I hate to be one of those people but when I got back from Thailand I was looking for some food that reminded me of my awesome vacation. This place does thai food right.
author: Robert gene R.

description: Awesome. Best Thai in the city. Wonderful ambiance and also kid and allergy friendly. Great service. We come as often as we can.
author: Deborah C.

description: Good food , went there twice aleady,, like the atmospheres there, very enjoying and relaxing,, will go there again
author: Moon H.

description: Amazingly tasty take on Thai food! Not what you would get in a regular Thai restaurant in terms of menu and price but well worth the trip. Everything we had was a pleasant surprise and this is coming from Singaporeans who have Thai regularly.
author: Addy T.

description: The restaurant had great food, interior design, the foods were very creative.  I loved them.
author: So C.

description: Very fun and lively restaurant with outstanding and creative cuisine. We've dined there three times in a month to try different dishes and everything has been great. The 24 hr beef noodle dish is fantastic!
author: David P.

description: Try the coconut cream latte. Then get the hat lai if you're feeling fried chicken.
author: Gordon M.

description:
Beautiful presentation, delicious dishes, stylish decor, and a much more creative menu than your average Thai standbys.  Special touches: Thai surf music, colorful aluminum platters usually used in Buddhist temples, hydroponic sprout garden indoors, the mixed seafood grill platter, colorful rice varietals, and yummy spice mix for the chelatas. 

The staff is absolutely charming - they're excited about the food, helpful in making selections, and super friendly.   I brought a large party of 12 on a weeknight & they were great - very impressive for a soft opening.   My friends have continued to rave about the meal & have said they plan to return ASAP.

Personally, I'm going back for my 4th visit in 4 weeks...  feeling blessed that this opened up on my block. Welcome to the neighborhood, Farmhouse...  may you live long & prosper!
author: Jeneva N.

description: Boneless fish special was not really boneless and kinda mushy too.  This place is way gimmicky.
author: Amy C.

description: This was really, surprisingly good - it is not cheap but was really good.  I had the tom yum at lunch which had what tasted like home made egg / ramen noodles in it as well - the noodles did not get soggy in the broth.  The broth was hot and super spicy.  There was a lot of seafood in it - which was also good and a few greens.  Would have liked a few more greens, but otherwise a great meal.  Nice open, sunny space.  Really friendly staff.  I am a fan.
author: David G.

description: The pad Thai with prawns is delicious! So is the pork belly in pepper and onion sauce.
author: Janelle B.

description: I absolutely love this Thai place one of the best in town! Tried the fish cakes which were great, the chicken wings so delicious and my favorite desert in town the Thai Vacation is to die for!
author: Alexandrina O.

description: Fabulous dinner at Farmhouse Kitchen - great food, fun kitsch decor, and cool vibe. The service was a bit slow but worth the wait. I am going home with a happy belly - highly recommended!
author: Kelly F.

description: Very hip. Clean wth good food. Red curry with blue rice was delish! The beer cocktail was not good but they made up for it with the delicious coconut ice cream dessert.  Only slight downfall and the reason I'm not giving it 5 stars was the service which just seemed a little lacking. Overall nice place though.
author: Marilyn B.

description: Uugghhhh, the pictures on yelp make me drool... the food is as good as it looks!
author: Brooke W.

description: Great place and great interior designing! The food are very good and fresh, customer service also really good! But the location is kind of hard to find and very limited parking.. Definitely worth going!
author: Jonathan Z.

description: So happy Farmhouse landed in my neighborhood. Excellent addition. Most dishes are too spicy for this white chick but I love everything I can tolerate. Always packed - luckily we have the luxury of ordering to go and never having to wait.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Thai food done right. Not overspiced or greasy but very flavorful. Ambience was on point.
author: Kellen M.

description:
Pros:

Food is delicious, interesting, authentic, something for everyone.

Service is very good, well trained, fast, polite, helpful.

Atmosphere is fun, there is loud music playing, so even though everyone is sitting family style large and small tables all together, it's easy to have a private conversation and feel cozy.

Menu is large enough to try something new many times.

Plenty of parking within 2 blocks.

Early dinner is usually no wait, probably short wait for anything else.

The restaurant is clean and has nice finishes, interesting art, fun lights, a nice bar. 

Cons:

It's a bit expensive, though you do get what you pay for, I feel like there could be a few less expensive items on the menu to help those who want an appetizer but can't spend an extra 9$.

The music is not that good and rather loud.  It's Thai pop music, which adds a nice touch to the authenticity and to help keep other loud noises from bothering you, but it's a bit too loud, and after 30 minutes near the end of your meal it starts to get a bit much.  

Definitely come here at least once, it's really worth it just for the food, just for the experience, the two together will almost certainly make you want to come back.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Loved the chicken satay and hai tai fried chicken here.
The staff was friendly and there was no wait at all!
author: Louis M.

description: The food is great and the ambiance is just the same. The fried chicken melt in your mouth and can't pass up the croissant bread pudding.  Reminds me of the southern cooking. Service is great  .  A little bit pricey for me.
author: Vilma H.

description: Great food, superb service and trendy atmosphere. I would recommend it and shall return for more authentic Thai food.
author: Nessa M.

description:
The environment is beautiful.  Lots of wood and original wall decor 

However there was a serious problem with the papaya salad being overly spicy and with a very strong vinegar taste to the salty crab dressing. I ordered this medium spicy, it was uneatable.  My companion lived in Thailand for about a year, and also tried it and found it too spicy. When I explained this to the waiter he said that was the way it came and we should have requested 'mild '.
He didn't offer any replacement or discount 
Although I did not ask for something else, the restaurant should have offered to bring a less spicy dish.
OSHA Thai and regent Thai may not be as hip, but both are more concerned about customer satisfaction
author: Sheila F.

description: Love this restaurant. The fried chicken that comes with a side of potato curry is delicious. I've been back 3 times and now I always order the potato curry! Great place.
author: Daviena C.

description: Got our order wrong but the food was tasty. Bean sprout woulda been good.  Also not peanuts that would kill me.
author: James D.

description: The food was delicious, service was great, and the restaurant had great ambiance.  Overall, a good experience!
author: Reiko M.

description: This is the best Thai food in SF right now. Delicious favorites but also super unique street food choices that remind me of being in Thailand. Also, the staff are soooo nice!
author: Kira M.

description: We had a very enjoyable and delicious meal. The pad see you was perfect for the kids and even they were pleased. The spicy papaya salad was the best one I have ever had even though it was mouth numbing spicy. It was a very cool and nice environment. Definitely going back.
author: Paul G.

description: Both times happy customer. Had b-day dinner here , and I was a pain in the ass, kept adding people to the party, so they moved us twice, and were amazing about it. Will be back again soon. Food top notch Thai and I have had a lot of thai here and in Thailand, service amazing!
author: Delta N.

description: Food not hot enough and they don't give you enough quantities. Been here three times and it's either less rice or less curry. It tastes like any other Thai place. Nothing too fancy or outstanding. Cool vibe, friendly staff, and nice music tho.
author: Sai M.

description: Although we were seated about 30 minutes after our reservation, the food was definitely worth the wait. The service was extremely quick and the food was delicious. Special props to the front of house, who managed the people waiting remarkably and was extremely patient and calm with everyone and even gave us complementary sake!
author: Madhav G.

description: This is my new go to place for Thai... Authentic Thai street food ... I would love to come here again and again and again and...
author: Namrata G.

description: Arguably the best Thai food I've had in the Bay Area! The panang curry was delicious, as was their chai latte.
author: Sid K.

description:
Edit - Farmhouse, you wily pak wan!  You have wooed a fifth star out of me with your promises of sour pepper water.  I am a sucker for flattery (and spicy vinegar).  Consider me bribed (and charmed).

****************************
I want to be irritated with Farmhouse.  Like, yeesh it's expensive and fancy and gentrifying the neighborhood blah blah blah.  But, ya know what, even though I'm from here, have lived in the Mission (off and on) for a couple of decades now, I'M gentrifying the neighborhood.  I setup my company's office in this neighborhood because it was near where I live and a lot nicer (for me) than being downtown etc. but anyway, I'm as much a part of this (or more so) than little ol'Farmhouse. Self-recriminating diatribe over.

I'm one of those annoying bastards that lived in Thailand for a while (a year give or take) so it makes me insufferably fussy when it comes to Thai food.  Which is stupid.  Because cuisine does and should adapt to its environment.  Thai food made here from things grown here should be different than Thai food in any part of Thailand.  It's probably more of a mistake to try and make it "100% authentic" and yet, with that said, Farmhouse manages to give me all the best flavor memories of my time there.  Since it is right by my office, I've eaten there about ten times in the last few months and the only miss I've had so far was their Fried Chicken.  Rather than being a succulent bone in piece with maybe a light dusting of cornstarch and/or rice flour for a slight crisp coating, this was a full on breaded chicken tender that was rendered immediately soggy by the curry side dish it came with.  Overall, this dish was super heavy and confusing to me coming with both rice and potatoes and naan and a breaded chicken breast tender.  No balance and missing the strong spicy-sweet-herbaceous flavor profiles I expect and want from Thai food.

But enough bitching, everything else I've had here is dope.  The pad kee mao is maybe the most spot on ever.  In fact, I'm not sure, at this point, if I've actually had it any better anywhere else.  The pat ped (fried onion+pepper etc.) is awesome and the non-edible seasoning elements (little immature seed pods on a branch, not sure what they were in Thailand or here) which you must eat around none the less enliven the dish with truly unique flavors.  The Tom Kha and Yum, the Som Tum (papaya salad), the different curries, Pat Ka Prow (Thai basil stir fry) which are all, more or less, Thai classics, are rendered both perfectly and with a fresh simplicity that is flavorful and satisfying in just the way that has made many of us love Thai food.  Thai cooking strives for balance and proportionality using ingredients and flavor combinations most of us don't get in our day to day meals - spicy, sour, edible herbs (basil, mint, cilantro to name a few), sweet (important), rich, acidic etc.

Anyway, I'm going on and on here.  Just give it a try.  I would give it 5 stars but it is a bit pricey (par for the course these days), the ambience is on the loud and not super cozy side for dinner (but fine for lunch) and it can get a bit chilly.  But their most egregious failing is that their condiment caddy ("Puang Prik") is lacking Prik Nam Som (literally "sour pepper water" which is essentially white vinegar with sliced jalapenos or serranos typically).  This diminishes my enjoyment of pretty much any Thai dish by about 41% and I have now resorted to making it myself and stocking it in my office kitchen much to the confusion and chagrin of my team.  Come on Farmhouse, Prik Nam Som is one of the four pillars of Thai condiments (along with Nam Plah, Sugar, and Dried Chili bits).  If you provide it, I will be left with no honest recourse then to update my review to 5 full stars (yes, I am attempting to bribe/blackmail you, I am that callow).
author: Milk N.

description: Gem in my backyard! Yay! Ask for your server's recommendation and you won't be disappointed! Fast service. Interesting combination of ingredients and absolutely spot on use of spices.
author: Shifali G.

description: Best Thai food I've had. The hat yai fried chicken won't let you down. Amazing curry. Definitely coming back next time I'm in the area.
author: Tyler F.

description: Nice atmosphere but don't get taken by the decor. The beef soup is out of this world. Doesn't get any meater than that. Flavor fest but caution if you don't like it hot!
author: Marcos T.

description: This place was a random trip but ended up being one of the best decisions! Their Hat Yai Fried Chicken was amazing!! My partner got that and I got their Papaya Salad. I ended up eating his meal instead. My papaya salad was nothing all that great. The prices on their menu is quite high but if you're looking for that delightful fried chicken with thai twist, this is it!
author: Sudha S.

description: This place totally surprised me. Great space and cute decor, food & service was awesome. Everyone loved what they had. The only thing surprising was that it's more along the lines of $$$ and not $$. But we didn't mind it. Will definitely go back again.
author: Divya G.

description: Really unique and delicious Thai food. The food also comes out crazy fast. Usually order take-out, but worth it to go in person.
author: Zach K.

description:
This is the best Thai in San Francisco. 

I have *never* had anything short of incredible here.

Everything is creative, the service is great, and decor is pretty and clean.
author: Michael F.

description: Love this place!! Had the 24 hour beef and hat yai fried chicken. So worth the walk from Missions Bart station, if you know what I mean! Will be back!
author: Tess Y.

description: I recognize how expensive it is to do business in San Francisco today. But I mean, seriously, even the Pad Thai is $20. Reviews are hard, because the food is good. It's not twice as good as so many amazing Thai restaurants in this city. So on food quality alone, I'd give Farmhouse 4 stars. But I have to be honest and say it's very unlikely that I'll be back. And when Yelp says two stars means "Meh. I've experienced better," that's about accurate.
author: Jimmy N.

description: The decor and ambiance remind me of a Napa Valley restaurant but the food wistfully takes me back to Bangkok. Pleasant service.
author: Inigo M.

description:
Super unique thai food! Not a place to get your usual pad thai or green curry, but try the things you've never heard of and you probably won't go wrong. The papaya salad was a great starter and the Pad Char Shrimps with blue rice was a standout.

You can also sample fried grasshoppers that are carted around the restaurant, if your into adventure or trying to impress a date, we happily passed on that opportunity.
author: Tim A.

description: SO much of a yellow Curry Fan and this one is the best I"ve had in the city , tom yum soup was great as well as the vegan eggrolls, but the yellow curry alone earns this place five stars.
author: NAEL K.

description: This place is awesome!!! My husband and I were in the mood for Asian noodles/stir fry and found this gem on Yelp. We got there with friends and it was packed but we were able to get a table rather quickly. The vibe was fun and they had great music playing. I ordered the pad see you and it was delicious. It was just enough food. My husband ordered red curry and he thought it was scrumptious. I would highly recommend this spot. Only wish it was open later.
author: Dana B.

description: Best Thai food in the area I've tried! Curry has *lots* of sauce so be sure to get extra rice for it if you are a saucy person. ;0)
author: Conor M.

description:
I expected more from a michelin rated restaurant. The service was excellent and the food was good..  i had better at other thai restaurants that were 1 $ dollar sign. 
I probably wouldnt come here again, i expected authetic thai food. 

I ordered the fried chicken which came with pita chips, curry, small salad and blue rice. The fried chicken was perfectly cooked but the blue rice was a bit odd. I did have tummy issues afterwards... so be warned.. i dont know if the food was just not clean or the herbs didnt mix well ( i dont have this problem at other thai restaurants)

The wait was pretty long, if you are starving dont expect to be seated within 30 minutes. 

One last thing, this place is not kid friendly.
author: Stefany L.

description: Super fun place for authentic Thai street food ! Reservation encourage . Always something different here
author: Niti R.

description: Huge platters, pretty tasty and authentic food; reminds me of walking around the huge floating markets of Bangkok or Pattaya and the foods I sampled there. Great find in a newer area of the Mission.
author: Aya M.

description: From the reservation process to the food and service, everything was super. I would recommend this place and definitely will return for more authentic Thai food.
author: Vanessa W.

description: Best Thai food in SF! The Seafood Noodle Soup is the best I've ever had. All the dishes and soups are absolutely delicious and generously portioned. The service is warm and efficient. We always been on a quest for the ultimate seafood and beef Pho's and then we found Farmhouse Kitchen. I know it's not Pho...it's better!!!!
author: Frank S.

description: Love love love Farmhouse!  ALL of their food is delicious, especially the Fried Chicken with Yellow Curry.  The staff is super nice and sweet too!
author: KELSEA K.

description: The restaurant looked nice, reminded me of a spot in Miami. The food was very bland (Tom yee soup, yellow curry, pad see noodles). The fried shrimp and crab fried rice was okay.
author: Mar S.

description:
What we ordered - 

Appetizer:
Neua Nom Tok Rolls
Fried Calamari
Kobe Beef Jerky

Main
Flank Steak
The Khan Toke Set
Panang Neua

Desert-
The chocolate Cake
Thai Vacation
Bread Pudding
Coconut Ice cream with coconut cream

My favorite was the Nom Tok Rolls.
Here is the problem, everything here is absolutely delicious,  I think my problem was that I just don't appreciate Calamari and Beef Jerky,  But even so, it was so well made here.  Also the problem with these two dishes is, they shred sweet potatoes into noodle like sizes and fry them, they are remaining at the bottom of both these dishes and it is so fun and delicious to eat.
The Neua Nom Tok rolls are simply amazing.  The brined cucumbers and tender beef go very well together.  There is a green clinatro sauce at the bottom that you just want to lick up.  

For the main - I would have gotten the Panang Neua myself, but I wanted to try the Kan Toke Set.  The set was really good and contains a lot of variety. But for amazing taste, the panang would have been better.  There is also a distinction with how this restaurant makes their panang curry.  Other restaurant is a thinner consistency.  This curry is like a super super thick and flavorful sauce.  Its thick body and even richer flavor will drive you insane, add to that a super tender short rib, it was almost a panang curry gravy.
The flank steak was okay, I don't recommend that if you are going for interesting or flavorful, but the rice that went with it is some of the most delicious rice I ever had (I like the pieces of fried caramelized onions).   Also the blue rice that came with the Panang Neua tasted really good.  

Dessert
Really, don't get the bread pudding.  Everything else is amazing.  We were all surprised that the chocolate cake was really well done(Thai & chocolate desserts, uhhhh???) - no, but it was amazing.  Everyone really liked the ice cream. Coconut cream with coconut ice cream, with toasted coconut.  We also had the thai vacation, which was very very interesting.  The dessert weren't too sweet.

All in all, everything was very good except the bread pudding.
author: Derek C.

description: We were there for lunch on a weekday and ordered the papaya salad and fried chicken special. The salad is my favorite with its freshness and spice and the fried chicken plate is quite filling for the two of us. The waiters are friendly too. I would definitely visit again, perhaps to taste its dinner menu and bar one day.
author: Wei T.

description:
One of the best Thai foods in SF. Didn't have to wait a long during lunch and early dinner time. Me and my girlfriend were here quite a few times and is a lovely place to visit. Here are our Top recommendations.  

Soup: Tom Kha. 
Appetizer: Calamari.
Street Food: Pad Thai or Pad See You  (Pad See You was not fulling). 
Curry:  Yellow Curry . THE BEST.
author: Aditya I.

description: Amazing! Had the red curry with chicken and got it to go. It was ready quickly and very delicious. Not to mention the restaurant is adorable and the wait staff is very friendly!
author: Erica V.

description: Tucked away on Florida St and 19th St, Farmhouse Thai has a clean and cozy ambience. According to their chef, they use spices from Chiang Mai which gives their dishes a more traditional and vibrant taste. I recommend the blue rice.
author: Jay W.

description:
3.5 stars.  Came here with high expectations because sister restaurant Kitchen Story is so delicious.  However, every dish we had here had room for improvement.  

Pros: decor is fantastic.  Really lovely, homey place.  
Cons: for the prices, you expect a stellar meal and this is really not there yet.  

The two of us shared some dishes: 
"Mieng Kum Kung" 11
Crispy crusted Tiger Prawns, leafy green wrapped with a zesty mixture
of lime, ginger, onion, roasted coconut & peanuts w/ Tamarind sauce

Tasted like eating fried shrimp with granola, gross and aggressively sweet.  We learned how to make a similar appetizer using betel leaves in a cooking class in Thailand, and it was so so delicious.  The problem here is that the sweetness isn't well balanced by the acidity/spice so it just made you feel sick. 


Tom Zappp Beef 13
Herbal beef stewed in Spicy & Sour broth, roasted rice, mushroom,
galangal, kaffir lime leaves, lemongrass, bean sprouts, broccolini and
long coriander
For this price, you would expect this to come with noodles or rice, and in fact it was over salted so we ordered a side of noodles ($4) to balance it out.  Not very much meat, and they only filled half the bowl.  Very stingy offering for a $17 dish. 

Mok Salmon 18
Country style grilled Wild King Salmon in banana leaf,
oyster mushroom, lemongrass, dill, shallots, grilled asparagus
spicy cilantro lime sauce. Blue rice

Probably the best of the 3 dishes.  However, the salmon itself was cooked poorly.  It was a very thick slab, maybe 1.5 inches, so the top was overcooked and the middle was still raw.  

Next time I will just go to kitchen story.
author: T Y.

description: I'm no authority on Thai food by any stretch of the imagination, but I did live there for a few months and got to know a variety of the different regional cuisine. And hands down, Farmhouse is the best Thai food I've had outside of Thailand. The flavors and spices caused a wave of nostalgia to wash over, which left me longing for the tropical days in this awesome country. Don't get me wrong, these are not Thai prices so don't expect to get in and out of here with only your good friend Andrew Jackson in your pocket. Regardless, I can't wait to go back and bring others. My only request is that they bring back khao soi, which I think I'd heard it mentioned being offered somewhere, but was not on the menu this time around. Oh man, if they offered khao soi I would be in heaven.
author: Mark S.

description: Farmhouse is another in the very welcome movement of Thai restaurants away from offering nothing but the standards. I mean, they do have pad thai on the menu if you insist, but it's about the least interesting thing. The room is nice and airy, but I do have to say the service is slow. Better to go for dinner when you're probably less worried about schedules.
author: Rick H.

description:
This is a restaurant that wants to be Thai but I think they forgot how Thai  food  is made!!
I go to Thailand every year for the last 20 years and I can tell you that  this is not Thai cuisine !
sorry !!!
The blend of flavors are not there !! the spice is not there !! the curries and the soups are very weak
Very disappointing experience .
On another note, the service was good and pleasant
author: xhr s.

description: 24 Hour Beef Noodle Soup all the way every time. (I've also tried a few of their other dishes, mainly tasting whatever my friends ordered. Everything has been good.)
author: Jeff A.

description: Super impressed by the host and her beautiful sparkly outfit. Service was OK; a little too eager and hurried, but nonetheless attentive. The vegan rolls were very nice and the sauce that came with it was spectacular. Sadly my wild king salmon was excessively overcooked, and I wonder if it really was wild caught as it had the appearance and texture of farmed fish. The blue rice that accompanied the salmon tasted no different than plain white rice, but the tiny dish of spicy sauce that came with the dish was indeed very delicious.  My friend and I shared the coconut ice cream topped with almonds and it was delightful. Loved the trendy vibe of the restaurant which was packed full on a Friday night, but this place could use improvements to their food and service.
author: Moraima P.

description:
Great new addition to the Mission.  Food was really good. atmosphere is nice --bit noisy.
Wait staff seems hectic and hurried. Listens with half an ear. We asked for some suggestions and the waitress was selling the specials, when we told her we did not want those dishes --her response was not helpful and she walked away to take care of another table.  In the end, we loved what we ordered--however, two dishes we ordered they were out of--so we ordered something else and when our check came the orders for the items not available were on our bill along with the items we took in their place--when I showed the waitress the mistake she said nothing --fixed it and handed it back without a peep. Need some work stafff wise--
author: marc m.

description: Very hip new place. Showed up for dinner at 9pm and the place was still packed! I suggest making a reservation if you plan on going at prime-time. The food was excellent. We tried several of the noodle dishes and curry dishes. The braised short rib special was particularly good. My only complaint was with the Hat Yai Fried Chicken. The sauce was great, but the chicken was dry, over-cooked, and not well fried. The blue rice is a nice touch!
author: Laurent L.

description: I really liked the flavors of the two dishes that I got. The beef wrap appetizer and rice salad. I'm not sold on the decor (it's a mishmash of industrial hipster rustic modern...) but I appreciate that it's clean and spacious. We showed up at the end of the lunch rush, right before closing, but the wait staff was very welcoming. With warning that they're shutting down the kitchen soon, they continued to be very friendly and attentive. It's more expensive than authentic Thai joints, but for being in the artsy-loft gulch, where paninis and $5 coffees are rampant, it's a welcoming addition to the neighborhood menu.
author: Bibi B.

description: This is my new favorite place! The yellow curry is the best, most complex one I've ever tried. I also recommend the Herbal Rice Salad and the special drinks (honey lavender milk, yum!). Not your typical SF Thai restaurant, the dishes are ultra-fresh with modern twists and an authentic palate. I'm going back again tomorrow, can't get enough.
author: tura s.

description:
We were a little disappointed with the food - the menu sounded great, but the execution of the dishes missed the mark. First of all, we ordered soup and the our server had all of our dishes come at once ??? Who has the soup come with all of the main dishes. Didn't realize we had to specify to bring soup by itself. Then the main dishes - the chicken and shrimp in each of our main dishes were all overcooked.
We spent a lot of money and were pretty disappointed.  
Too bad - it was a cute restaurant.
author: Michelle F.

description:
We eat out most nights of the week and will often take a break from our main go-tos to try out new places. As complete Thai nuts, we were really excited to try Farmhouse Kitchen as it's right in our neighborhood. We gave it a couple weeks after opening to give them some time to settle in and iron out any bugs in the new space and then went in about a week ago towards the end of June. 

Service was outstanding. Everyone we encountered was incredibly friendly and attentive. Granted, there were only a handful of other occupied tables so this was not a good test of their service for a busy situation. However, we got the sense that this level of service would be maintained on a busy day as well. 

Decor was cute. Nice new clean space. I wasn't totally wild about some of the style choices but ultimately, eating out is entirely about the food for us. 

On to the food. We have a couple Thai dishes that we use as a benchmark when venturing out to a new spot. Green curry, Yum Nuer/Beef salad and Tom Kha Gai soup. For this visit, we went with their green curry and beef salad. We also ordered the baby shrimp fritters and Panang Neua, a slow-braised short rib curry dish. 

The beef salad ($13) was completely average. Fundamentally, there was nothing "wrong" about it but we've certainly had better in San Francisco. 

The baby shrimp fritters ($10) were good if you like that sort of thing. This dish was recommended to us by our server and the flavors of the sauce were good and the baby shrimp were crispy and nicely fried. 

The Panang Neua ($22) was good. I'd order this again...if it weren't $22. Tasty dish that was done well but priced too high. I might pay $15-17 but not more.

Finally, the green curry ($13). This dish broke my heart in all the wrong ways. If you're going to open a Thai restaurant...in San Francisco...you have GOT to nail a basic dish like green curry. My husband and I have eaten green curry all over San Francisco and most recently in Paris and Berlin. There's a consistency that exists all over the world with a dish like green curry that shouldn't be too much to expect from a place ballsy enough to open in a competitive city like SF. This was BY FAR the worst green curry we've ever had. Visually, there was tons of oil that had separated and was floating on top of the curry. Upon spooning it out onto the plate, it was clear that it was in a pure liquid state equivalent to a thin soup. But we've had runny green curry before that at least had good flavor so we thought it might still be okay. Sadly, this was not the case. The flavor scarcely resembled green curry and we might not have even known this was supposed to be green curry if we hadn't ordered it by that name. The chicken quality also contributed to our disappointment. And what's with the blue rice? Maybe that's a Thai thing that we're in the dark about but not super appetizing, guys. White or brown rice will do just fine. I rarely leave a dish completely uneaten but that's what we did. We typically eat some of a dish that we're not thrilled about to be polite but could not even muster that with this one. The server was really sweet and definitely noticed. She asked if everything was okay like she wanted to make it right if we weren't happy. But there were no words for this. It was just plain awful so we just said it was fine. If the green curry was this far gone, what could we have said, really?

The table of three next to us were also unhappy with their dishes. I can't speak for them but I can say that we overheard them picking at their food and commenting in less than positive ways, leaving much of some of their dished untouched as well. 

Bottom line: It wasn't a complete disaster. And their service game is solid. However, there are too many good Thai restaurants in the city that consistently serve yummy food at cheaper prices for us to ever return to Farmhouse Kitchen. And truth be told, I will deal with shitty service to eat kick-ass food any day. So great service alone will not cut it. Head over to Regent Thai on Church St. for some major no-nonsense Thai goodness that is crazy inexpensive for what you get. If you're looking for fancier Thai, Kin Khao in the Union Square-ish area is the place to be. You'll pay Farmhouse Kitchen prices but the food will actually match it.
author: Amy K.

description: Green curry is off. The. Chain. Best in the City, no question. Can't bear to order anything else. Haven't stayed there for dinner but place looks lovely. Have only gotten take-out more times than can count. Love all the drink and rice options. So awesome.
author: Catherine C.

description: It has been a while since I've written  a review for any business, and our family's exceptional experience from Farmhouse Kitchen Thai Cuisine prompted this review. Upon arriving we were greeted by a fabulous host(ess) acknowledging our family of three immediately. It was a busy Saturday night, and I unfortunately was unable to book a reservation online, and magically we were ushered to a table. Farmhouse Kitchen's service exceeded expectations; the price point of the food is appropriate; and since we're on the subject of food it was exceptional from the wild salmon wrapped in a banana leaf to the fish cakes and even the brown rice was the best brown rice I've ever tasted. But what made the whole experience 5-star was the coalesce of perfectly done foods, prompt friendly service, all within the ambiance and stylized form of Thai culture reflected from the servers' attire and the occasional server carrying food on a basket with a rod throughout the restaurant floor. No other Thai restaurant from the states come this close that I am aware of. I definitely come again!
author: Glenn G.

description: I started my job a block and a half away and it was the same week this restaurant opened.  I now return once a week for take out.  I enjoy their Chicken Satay and I really like their green curry.  One time I ordered it extra spicy and it was no joke.  I felt like I had just sprinted a mile.  I know order it medium spicy.  A great place to eat!
author: g c.

description:
Delicious... Authentic Thai food with a twist of love and creativity

The decor is welcoming - farmhouse homey feel - and the greeting the same.  

Service is professional and friendly, menu exceptional, wine list the same.  Food is awesome in both quality and quantity. Food well presented, fresh and tasty, as well as authentic.

The restaurant serves delicious feel good food.  Good home cooked style Thai restaurant that serves exotic, a new street-style Thai food.  

If you love "authentic non-Americanized" Thai food then this is the place to go.

Definitely a gem for the foodie
author: M B.

description: This place is solid.  Ordered delivery and no frills, no forks, no napkins.  Just solid Thai eats.  "Spicy" means spicy, so choose well.  Eat here.
author: Marvin C.

description: Amazing interior decor and one of the top 3 Thai meals I've had in my 28 years of life! Coming back for sure.
author: Grace C.

description: Seriously good food. Intense flavors in interesting presentations in a cool space with friendly service. Can't go wrong w their fried chicken and curry plate. Worth a visit, and come hungry!
author: Garrett T.

description: Cool thai food place. Loved the blue rice and the bread pudding. Nice crowd and good service.
author: Leandro D.

description: Very comfort-food Thai; not much spice or really interesting flavors, but good at what it is, and the dishes are presented really well. There are a bunch of things on the menu you don't see at the usual Thai restaurant, but the two things we got (the fried chicken and the prawns) were both fairly ordinary tasting.
author: E.O. S.

description:
Zero star for service.
Three stars for food.  

There are a lot of thai restaurant in the Bay Area.  I would recommended that you go somewhere else because not only is this place is over priced for what you get, the food is average, and the portion is small.

I came here to celebrate my son first birthday which to me is a big occasion.  I have planned every details of the party and carefully selected the restaurant.  However my experienced at the restaurant was completely disappointing.  First of all I tried to call ahead and preorder the food so I don't have to deal with the ordering and the logistic when I arrive.  The staff still didn't have it together and had to interrupted me while I try to get my party set up and retake my food order.  I asked what is the problem that he couldn't use the order list that I provided earlier, but then he blamed me for being late and not arriving at 5pm when actually my reservation was 5:30pm and my husband and family did arrive before 5:30pm.

But what really made this restaurant the bottom of my list is how they were so unaccommodating.  My son wasn't eating much from their child menu.  So I asked the wait staff if they could do a side order of a fried egg, it can be scramble any kinds of egg, just egg.  The waitress came back and said that they are not able to do anything like this.  I was like it's just eggs.  Most of your dishes have eggs and you can't just do a fried egg.  Their respond was we don't do anything like this.  I was stunned and speechless.  From that moment I made a note that I would not again step into this facility.  For those of you with picky toddlers beware this place is not family friendly.

Finally when it's time for the highlight of the evening.  The birthday boy is about to cut his first cake.  I asked the staff for a lighter to light the candles.  Instead they brought me a check.  a check?  I was stunned!  Did you not here me correctly or you can't see that we are trying to cut the cake.  And there they were handing me the check as if they are telling me that it's time to leave.  I thought that was such a rude gesture.

I have to say this restaurant is not good for party gathering, service is disorganized.  I would definitely not going to be back here again.
author: Mary Anne C.

description: Service was 5 stars but the food deserves 1.  Sadly everything was super americanized and way too sweet.  I travel to Thailand every year and know that some Thai dishes can be sweet but not EVERY dish, even the papaya salad was sweet.  Four of us ordered plenty of dishes to try.  Every single one of them was way overly sweet.  The yellow curry was sweet, the dipping sauce was too sweet.....we hoped for a little spiciness in some of the dishes to cut back the sugar but didn't find any.  At one point, we had to squeeze lime juice into the salad to make it a little tangy.  Oh well, we tried.  The place is super busy so sugar sells!!!
author: jaye b.

description: AMAZING!!!! We had an amazing time coming here. The service was fantastic, the waiter noticed a gnats in a glass of our wine and got us a new glass at no cost. The food was fantastic as well. Be sure to try the 24 hour short rib soup.
author: Heather L.

description: My friend called in to ask for a table for 6 and they said no need to make a reservation. So we came 5 minutes after our call. After we arrived, they said there is no room for party bigger than 5 without a reservation and told us we need to wait 20 minutes. After we waited 20 minutes and ask the waiter again, he told us we need to wait for another 30 minutes. There is just so much mismanagement at this place with poor service.
author: John X.

description: The food is so good. They use fresh and local ingredients to make bomb-#^^ Thai! The servings are generous and presentation is on point. Keep in mind this isn't your T-L spot which is reflected in the price point but the quality and servings justify the price. Service is fun and friendly. Definitely a must try.
author: Matthew B.

description: i love this place! the food is excellent and so delicious and different from most Thai food i've had. the vibe is EXTRAORDINARY.  so fun and welcoming.
author: Tracy W.

description: Had the Mok King Salmon Special for lunch, was unimpressed besides the presentation. Both the Rice and Salmon were way overcooked. Not rushing back any time soon.
author: Crispin M.

description: Good was great and the desert to die for.  Staff was very nice especially during their busiest time.  Can't wait to come back with other friends
author: Randy B.

description: The best Thai food I've had in the city. The classic dishes are made from the highest quality ingredients and the service is top notch.
author: Oren S.

description: Recent transplant from LA and I can't find a decent place for authentic thai food. Farmhouse   is spacious , tastefully decorated, and the service is pleasant. We arrived at 9:30 pm and they asked us to order asap since the kitchen was closing in 10 minutes but they entertained more patrons at 9:45-9:50 pm. Wish they had not rushed us. The menu is extensive but the dishes lack flavor. We had amok salmon, crispy pork stir fry, and fried chicken, all of the dishes were restrained. In LA , Thai chefs make authentic food and people who appreciate the bold flavors flock their restaurants, at Farmhouse, the emphasis is on show (venue and menu) but not on the flavors which seems to be consensus among patrons who crave authentic thai cuisine. If you want mellow thai-ish food then this is a great venue.
author: T B.

description: What a gem! This place has fantastic Thai food across the board and great ambience. The waiters were attentive, patient, and helpful and it looks awesome on the inside. Great number of options for vegetarians too!
author: Neil S.

description: Beautiful, spacious dining area and bar. I had the pork belly salad which was delicious! I am definintely coming back!
author: D F.

description: Hidden gem great staff very diverse tasty and interesting menu and fun casual atmosphere will definitely come back and also order for deliver from this place!!
author: Kat C.

description: Great food, service, place. Had the Tom Yum, green chicken curry, fishcakes. All were great!
author: Richard C.

description: Really good, spicy, seems authentic Thai food.
author: Amanda S.

description: This place is awesome.  Good service, friendly folks, gorgeous/interesting decor, good noise levels, extremely delicious food.
author: Jen L.

description: My God daughter was visiting me today, and planned to take me out to eat. We walked around the neighborhood and decided to try here; I've lived around the corner for more than 20 years now. We ordered cucumber salads, the crispy rolls, a fried shrimp dish, broccoli in a sweet sauce, and shared the Hat Yai fried chicken dinner. She also ordered a steak dish to go, toward the end of our meal. And, I drank a Thai beer, the one at the top of the list. Everything was outstanding. Our waiter, Tar, was very nice, as was everyone else. And, the environment is much more hip than I thought, with a certain elegance that I never perceived when I have walked by and peeked in the window.  I'm so glad I went, and will bring other people there, as well as order take out for myself, to get familiar with other dishes. Welcome to the neighborhood.
author: Donald W.

description: I ordered the Pad Thai with prawns. Not too impressed. The food was cold by the time it was delivered and the noodles were crunchy and clumpy. I asked for mild sauce, but got a pretty spicy green sauce with my order. The prawn shells were left in with the food and the whole dish smelled fishy. Tasted OK. Wouldn't order again.
author: Elyssa M.

description: Just got back from a trip out of the country and had to wait 1.5 hours for delivery to my home a mile away. Was told driver was "stuck in traffic" twice when they could have taken Alabama the entire way to Bernal. This low rating is mainly due to super slow delivery. Still, food was overpriced for generic thai food. I thought the extra bucks for each item guaranteed some extra flavor, but nah. Why can't we get a decent new ethnic restaurant with good food and awesome value on THIS side of town? My search continues...
author: Michelle A.

description: Have eaten at Farmhouse Kitchen Thai Cuisine at least monthly and it's still the best and among my favorites!  I especially like the Penang Neua (braised short rib) and Tod Man (fishcakes).
author: Flynt I.

description:
I really enjoyed my experience here. Four of us went to Farmhouse for brunch today (Sunday) and we loved it. The ambiance is great. I especially loved that they have an indoor spot where they grow the herbs/spices that are in the food!

The host was kind and very helpful. He modified my order to make it veggie friendly. I also appreciated that the cooking staff was Thai, so I was having an authentic culinary experience.

The food was delicious and arrived in a timely fashion.

We will definitely be back
author: April M.

description: Overpriced. The chicken curry was more indian style than thai style (too many of a certain herb). The coconut soup was wayyyyyy too sweet. Not for me.
author: E T.

description: Delicious, fresh ingredients!  Though more expensive than our previous "go to" Thai, the quality and amount of ingredients make it a good value.   We've found our new "go to" Thai!
author: Rachel L.

description:
Beautiful restaurant and tasty. Service was relaxed, genuine, and very friendly.

Will be back
author: Evan O.

description:
Farmhouse Thai is a wonderful find hidden in in an unlikely location.  The flavorful food and the modern atmosphere lend itself to a great restaurant to take a date or enjoy an intimate dinner with friends.

Food
I went with 3 other friends, and we ordered 6 dishes to share.  My favorite was the crispy friend chicken, but I also enjoyed the green curry and pad see ew.  I'm not an expert on the authenticity of thai dishes, but each dish was flavorful, cooked extremely well, and came to the table hot.  My main complaint was that the serving sizes were on the smaller side.  For four guys, one dish per person was not enough.  I would definitely recommend ordering extra dishes to share.

Service
We came without a reservation on a Sunday night, and it wasn't too crowded.  We waited about 20 minutes to get a table for four.  The servers were very helpful in recommending food, and our waters were always kept full.

Atmosphere
To say I really like the feel of the restaurant would be an understatement.  The setting is very modern, with a great variation in table types and layouts.  It doesn't feel like some restaurants where it feels like they just line up tables in a row, and they've done a good job balancing the culture of the cuisine with a more modern dining experience.  Dress up a bit, no sweatpants here!
author: Chen L.

description: My friends came across this place while trying to find a plan B when our first choice for dinner was booked and I'm so glad they did!  We were seated quickly and all decided on different curries (red, green and yellow).  The service was very fast and friendly and the food was delicious.  We were even chatting about how we haven't found a Thai place this good in NYC yet.  It definitely seems like a popular place because by the time we left (6:45 on a Sunday), the place was absolutely packed.  I would recommend a reservation or you might have to wait for a table.
author: Melissa N.

description: New Country Thai Food restaurant for the win! I will be a regular visitor! Try the crispy fritters!
author: M D.

description: This restaurant seems like a chain or upscale version of Kitchen Story. But, I'm not happy about this place because it's WAY overpriced mediocre Thai food. When I say WAY over, I mean WAY over as in double to double times and a half from other good Thai restaurants in the city.
author: Pudgy G.

description:
My husband, daughter and I were in the area and stumbled on this place.  Did a quick search on the internet and learned the owners are same as Kitchen Story.  We were the only ones in the dining room but not a big deal because they're a new restaurant.

Hat Yai - This is fried chicken at its best.  Perfectly crisp and not greasy.  Comes with amazing yellow curry on the side and some roti for dipping.  All the flavors came together nicely, to perfection, some of the best curry as you would find in Thailand.

Panang Neua - Short ribs were juicy and tender, braised in a delicious sauce.  The complex flavor came together nicely and perfectly seasoned.

Phi Phi Seafood Platter - Generous seafood portion of scallops, shrimps, prawns and calamari but a bit overcooked.  (We talked to the manager and felt he genuinely took our feedback.  The meat was well seasoned so I would give this another try next time I'm there).  The accompanying vermicili was tender, had a delicate flavor, and worth ordering on its own, if possible.

Spicy Eggplant - This is one of the better eggplant dishes we've had.  Most of the time at other restaurants this dish can be overly greasy and salty, but not here. 

Thai Crispy Rolls - typical, nothing special.

Kob Tod - frog legs deep fried.  good if you like frog legs.

We've travelled numerous times to Thailand and love discovering Thai restaurants.  Glad to have found this one.  We'll be back!
author: Kim L.

description: Food ok. Ordered calamari which was a bit over done. The kids fried chicken was more rice than chicken. It was decent but definitely over priced for quality and amount. Not recommended.
author: Alicia Z.

description: If I could have the Herbal Rice Salad and Hot Yai Fried Chicken EVERY day .... Absolutely one of my favorite places in SF!!
author: Lee H.

description: This place is amazing. Great decor and atmosphere. And holy moly, the food is amazing. Northern style thai food like you've never had them before. They also pushed a cart around with free mussel pancake for tasting when we were there. And the food was pretty affordable as well. Great spot for a date or a weekend get together.
author: Mai H.

description: Great Thai food.  Some of the best Pad Thai we have had and a great yellow curry.  Blue rice was delicious and unexpected.   Can't wait to try other things during our next visit I am so relieved there is a great Thai option on the south side.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Unusual decor, good service, nice food presentation.  The food is palatable, but unremarkable.  The blue jasmine rice tasted like regular white rice colored with blue flowers.
I'm not likely to return.
author: Robert C.

description: We were seated right away and the food was AMAZING! The staff there is always so helpful. It's a great hidden gem with a fun atmosphere, I can't wait to go back.
author: Teji K.
