description: Place is cute and staff are amazing! Incredibly fast, kind, and considerate. We had a reservation, were seated immediately, and our water glasses were consistently filled all night. We had multiple appetizers, the famous fried chicken dish, the Tom Kha soup, and the coconut ice cream dessert. Everything was delicious!!! Wonderful birthday dinner for my boyfriend. We will be back!!!
author: Melissa D.

description: Food was good here but service was lacking. Not really interested in returning.
author: Ashley R.

description: So glad we found this place. The food is AMAZING and the decor awesome. Really have not had a bad dish yet.
author: Arielle R.

description: This place did not have many reviews on yelp so I was a little skeptical at first but it turned out to be absolutely amazing. Everyone we were with enjoyed our food. The only problem is that they don't have a cocktail menu it is strictly beer wine and special Thailand drinks
author: Caitlyn M.

description: went there twice last week. We have been searching for a good Thai fish cake every where outside Thailand and found it in San Francisco.  Most flavorful and juicy fish cake, yet not oily.  We ordered two orders for the three of us.  The place is very cute, literally like a farm house.  The food comes in traditional Thai plates.  The papaya salad is very flavorful with different level of spiciness.  We chose very spicy because I came from Thailand and it met my palate.  Despite the spice, you can savor the freshness of the vegetable, meat, and ingredients.  Everything is fresh and not drown in fish sauce or sugar.  Every dish is well balanced.  Make sure you save room for the dessert with sticky rice and taro (a lot of taro which slight sweetness and creamy, heaven) and ice cream.  get your warm sticky rice and taro and mix them with cold ice cream will complete your scrumptious meals.
author: Yaw E.

description: I want to reply to the response from Farmhouse.  It was not only my server who was rude; I brought the situation to the attention of the maitre'd as well, who was completely uninterested in my feedback.  Your response should focus on your own policy; tell us if you plan to continue to ask people to leave or not.  I think your customers would like to know.
author: Tim O.

description: This is hands down the best Thai restaurant I've been to. The food (and every ingredient) is amazing and they pay a lot of attention to the visual presentation. Every friend I brought here immediately loved it. It is wise to make a reservation since it can get quite busy around 7pm.
author: Jonas W.

description: The best Thai food I have ever tasted. We arrived post lunch rush and got a table right away. Food arrived quickly and was delicious. Portions were huge. Atmosphere is also very good. Will definitely go again. Highly recommend.
author: Gulshan I.

description: I just had the worst experience at this place. I came in by myself and was directed by their waiter to sit towards the back of the restaurant but first I mentioned to the waiter that I was going to use their restroom. After that, I sat where I was directed to. Once I was comfortably accomodated and reading the menu the waitress approached and asked me if I had a reservation, I said that I didnt but the other waiter had  suggested that table for me and thats why I sat there. She said they were fully booked and I said: Good for you guys standing up to leave. On my way to the exit she asked me for how many people would I need, that let me confused cause she said they were fully booked less than a minute ago. On my way out She insisted and repeated: For how many people I said: Nevermind, Im leaving this place cause Im hungry and you said you didnt have a table for me. By now all their customers were looking at me and not happy to have embaressed me enough she said in a loud voice: Have a good day, drink plenty of water clearly trying to falsely twist or claim that  I was on something else. By the way, If you treasure good and consistent service experience I strongly NOT recommend this place. Go elsewhere. Sorry but your reply below still doesnt sound genuine and just for your own records: The waiter offered me the table before I said I was going to use your restroom. I never ever will go there again and I will make sure my friends neither. I wish you change your attitude and get some customer service training. Regards.
author: Julian K.

description: This place is crazy busy! Met a friend for lunch on a Friday and we waited for about 35 minutes to be seated. We ordered the Tom Kha soup to begin with - good flavors, nothing that was out of the ordinary. Ordered the fried chicken to share as main course - honestly, the potato curry was the best part of the dish! The chicken was good - but the breading was thicker than the chicken and it got to be too much after a while. A good dish to share. For dessert, we got both the coconut ones (don't judge us) - both were really good! Overall a good experience, but nothing really stood out to steal the show.
author: Sachee P.

description: Went there with some co-workers one day for lunch.  Food was a bit different than other thai houses, but that is not saying it was not good.  It was good.  Just different tasting and different presentation.  I did totally enjoy it. Prices were a bit high for lunch, but within the range.  So, for me, it will be more of a splurge lunch place when I want something different.  I'll be back.
author: Clifford S.

description: Wow, I am totally amazed. We were a rowdy group of 10, including a toddler and a baby. Our ordering kept changing and the wait staff couldn't have been more professional and happily accommodating. The food blew me away. The freshest, most innovative, best Thai food I've had. In such a fun atmosphere! We brought in a big birthday cake (a huge no-no at many places) and they staged it, and brought it out decorated, and with drums and hoopla and fanfare. I can't say enough good things about this place! It will be our go-to for Thai in the city and for a big group. Amazing.
author: Lisa B.

description: This is unlike any Thai food you have had before. It is fresher, cleaner, more innovative and just better. Starting with the thom ga soup I knew I was in for a different Thai food experience. We were a loud and somewhat unruly group of 10, including a toddler and a baby, and had w complicated order that kept changing. They responded quickly professionally without complaint and the food came hot and fast and amazed us with each dish. We brought in a birthday cake which they staged and happily served with drums and singing and pomp and circumstance. We couldn't have had a better experience. They made our night special and I want to go back right now.
author: Lisa M B.

description: they resolved my problem and subsequently I'm reviewing my review. as mentioned before the food was great, and now i can say so is the customer service.
author: Joseph W.

description: I ordered there fried rice, drunken noodles and it was ok. I dont recommend this place at all!
author: Mayuri B.

description:
Outside is meh, inside is well done with a quaint rustic theme. Oddly, with the décor they could be server California Cuisine, BBQ or any semi-casual American fare.

Stopped by for lunch as they opened just a block or two away from the office. Looks like same menu for lunch and dinner so prices for lunch are a bit higher than I'd expect. For example, as this is a Thai place, I always order the Phad Thai as my first meal at any new Thai restaurant to gauge their style and ability. For $14 I had the Phad Thai with chicken and opted for spicy. Just the right amount of heat. The dish was tasty but I can get a similar dish 2 blocks away for almost 1/2 the price. The chicken was a little dry, noodles were perfect however.

My guess is that rather than a regular lunch spot this is going to be better for special lunches for folks in my office and surrounding offices.

Worth a visit. I'll be back, but rather than putting this place on my short list of local restaurants, this is likely going to be a spot that I visit once every two or three months.
author: matt g.

description:
hands down my new favorite restaurant in the 'hood. super super cute atmosphere, and tucked away, which i really like. love the decor - it definitely looks better in person than the pictures. admittedly, i'm almost sad this place is this good since i know it will just be a matter of time until the crowds destroy it (you know what i mean...). 
came in at 8 on a tuesday night with reservation and was promptly seated. the service here is amazing - water glass never empty, even though they also brought a carafe to the table. ordered a smorgasbord of yummies from the menu: the wagyu beef, grilled shrimp pad thai, thai cooler, and the yellow curry. everrrrrrrything was delicious; although the beef was my favorite for sure. the cooler was also really tasty - not too sweet. i love the presentation of the dishes - super colorful and fun! even the rice served with the curry was blue! ask for the hot sauces - they don't automatically bring this over, but that dry spicy one is sooo good. and i definitely wish i saved room for dessert - that taro/sticky rice/ice cream is on the top of my list next time! my only gripe was that they brought ALL the dishes at the same time. did not like that.  
to me, farmhouse is very different from your typical thai restaurant - the dishes seem more thought out and more flavorful, and definitely a lot less fatty/greasy tasting than most thai places.
i will definitely be back! :)
author: Corrina S.

description: How many times have you read an over the top review, that seems just... a little unrealistic perhaps? This is not one of those. This is the real deal, this is as good as it gets.From the ambiance, to the food, to the music, to the staff. It all adds to an incredible *experience* - something you don't get in just any restaurant in San Francisco. And all for a decent price. Are you a fan of Kitchen Story? Are you a fan of Starbelly? Yep, this is yet another gem from the same owners. I could go on and on about the decoration of this place, but I will talk about the food first. Every time I come here I try something new. Every time I leave, I leave with a new favorite dish - is that not incredible? Following are a couple of the dishes I've tried: The yellow curry will not disappoint. Please do't forget to order yourself a side of roti - because it is the best I've ever had. The rice salad is my favorite started, but if I feel like something more hefty I wouldn't think twice about getting the beef jerky. The red curry short rib is the.BOMB.COM. If you can't handle spicy food - don't forget to ask for it *mild*. The samosas are also incredible. If you feel like a drink - the thai cooler is just so scrumptious. Finally - please say yes to dessert. Thinking about their bread pudding, it's moist yet sponge-y texture makes me giggle. I am not super into sweets - but this one is just the perfect amount of sweet. The servers are incredibly nice. If you can get your hands on the book "You Are A Circle" flip through some pages - it speaks some truths. One last note on the badass thai rock music they usually play. Don't forget to Shazam it.
author: Lourdes A.

description: Food was delicious... Great menu.. Appetizers were delicious.. It was really loud and I felt rushed by the wait staff... Constantly asking if we were finished... Will be back..
author: Renee A.

description: Extremely good, authentic Thai food.  Great service.  Nice decor. We're going back soon!
author: Lee S.

description: We had a very late lunch on Saturday and it was very good. The service was attentive (but the restaurant was mostly empty, I'm not sure how they are when the place is packed. The pho bowl was good and very, very spicy (which I asked for). The fresh spring rolls were good and my wife enjoyed her curry. Overall, I'd go back. Oh, the space is decorated well.
author: Brian J.

description: It's been so long that I can't even remember what the yummy item was that I ordered although I remember it was wrapped in banana leaves.  The visit before that I was equally pleased.  I am always looking for a Thai place and this place delivers.  Everyone that I take here is pleased and goes back, including myself.
author: Andrea S.

description: Unique, very Thailand type ambiance. Loved the yellow curry specially the bread they give with it. The chicken noodle soup is very Fa like.
author: prashant s.

description: This place is fantastic.  A delicious fusion take on Thai.  Went with a vegetarian and there was plenty for her to enjoy (she loved the samosas).  The service can be a little off (I have been 5+ times), but that is par for the course at many of the Asian restaurants in this city.  Come for the food and be sure to say hi to the owner--she is fabulous!
author: Michael C.

description: Great food, though the service seemed a bit strapped but more so because of timing difficulties coming from the kitchen. Probably just kinks needing to be worked out.
author: Matthew C.

description: amazing food and really huge portions. great to share
author: J W.

description: Came in for take away. Ordered the fresh spring rolls with shrimp. Really good. Staff was welcoming and the restaurant was light and airy
author: Helga A.

description: Great new trendy place in the inner Mission district. Glad we got reservations.  The place was packed.  The place is trendy and hip with a beautiful modern art interior feel to it.  They serve these huge bowl drinks to share that look delicious.  We didn't order it though.....had a few too many before we arrived, but next time. The food is real Thai, the kind you eat in Thailand. Delicious and well presented. Service was fast and our server knowledgeable and helpful. The only negative I would say, it was loud. (They were really busy though.)  I could hardly hear my spouse talk.  But other than that it was a cool place to eat  and experience. We will visit again for sure.
author: Ann J.

description: A decent Thai place, but it feels like they are trying too hard to be chic and modern.  I had high hopes for this place, but my experience was no better or worse than other Thai restaurants which offer similar dishes at lower prices.  To be fair, some of their dishes did seem unique and perhaps more authentic (though I am no expert) to specific regions of Thailand.
author: Josh Q.

description: tasty green curry. fast preparation for a take out order.  the blue rice is either exciting or a bit odd, depending on your persuasion.
author: Micah S.

description: The best Thai restaurant I've ever had in San Francisco. Service was great and the crispy calamari is to die for!
author: Paige R.

description: Food is great but customer service is pretty shoddy. They got my order wrong twice and overcharged me for one dish (I was getting take way so didn't notice until I was home). I'm sure if you're eating in and not on the conveyor belt, it's great.
author: Dante F.

description: great neighborhood jem! food was delicious and i'm glad they use happy meats. portions are HUGE, so be forewarned! staff is very nice, though were a bit slow at times. overall, a great dining experience!
author: Erika A.

description: I lived in Thailand for several months so I'm pretty picky about Thai food. But was impressed. Samosas and 24h beef noodle soup were highlights
author: Tim Q.

description: Beautiful decor, good prices, and AMAZING food. Highly recommend.
author: Krisan N.

description: Really great, really fresh, even on their first night. This place is impressive and I believe will become a neighborhood staple. Great Tom Ka Gai.
author: Sam P.

description: Probably the best Thai food I've had in SF. Unique flavors, wonderful setting. Try the chicken and papaya salad combo -- amazingly flavorful. Love it.
author: Noah P.

description: Delicious, best thai food I've had in SF :)  Restaurant has a light and airy contemporary feel mixed with some traditional thai styling.
author: Rex S.

description: I eat out often and was excited to try this new place. Our reservation was at 8. We arrived and were told someone was still at our table. I asked the expected wait time and was told they had already paid. About 15 minutes later I asked if we could get a drink while we wait and were moved to the bar. About 10 minutes later we see the table leave and they quickly turn it then sit another couple there! I asked the hostess about this and she said they had been waiting longer. Although we hadn't seen them the entire 30 minutes we were waiting. Finally we get sat at a table in the bar. Food was average, split a couple of salads, calamari, and salmon. Salmon was quite nice. We ordered choco cake to split and it took another 20 minutes and that we had to wave then waiter down and remind him then it magically appeared. So when the bill came I expected given all the issues they would have bought our first round of beers or the dessert but no. I raised the entire experience to the hostess and she was indifferent. She was full of excuses then finally offered to comp the dessert.  I can forgive the mediocre food and delayed dessert service to being newly opened, but her utter indifference to the entire situation. With all the options in this city, I recommend you pass on this place. And slone side note, there are tons of tiny gnats or fruitfulness everywhere and one ended up in my beer. I just drank him down.
author: Rich L.

description: Loved this new place! Staff were friendly and accommodating. The food was so tasty! I would definitely love to come back here again!
author: Cristina V.

description: Really delicious food, only complaint is that the sticky rice that comes with the kid menu was really dry and hard. Will definitely come back :)
author: Jane M.

description: Solid new place. Really liked the friend chicken dish and the samosas, both of which came with a sauce so delicious you'll ask for a spoon. Panang curry was kind of meh, but the rest of the food made up for it. Very attentive staff, nice space and great location. Fine work.
author: Aaron A.

description: we celebrated my 30th birthday party at farmhouse kitchen with a group of 20 people & it was the most amazing dinner. the staff was prompt with getting food & drinks as well as attentive to us during the whole dinner party. the food was also amazing & we were able to order off the menu even though we were a large group. the hat yai fried chicken as well as the pad thai with giant prawns was some of the best thai food i've had! this is a hidden gem in SF and didn't disappoint in any way.
author: Kat S.

description: Really good food, great service and nice decoration
author: Aurore K.

description: If a person is looking for traditional thai food this is not the right place. The Tom Yum soup was not Tom Yum. It was chicken soup with a slight asian twist. It wasn't the right color and didn't have any spice to it. The shrimp pad thai was overpriced given the quantity of shrimp included in the dish was very skimpy. The spring rolls were not traditional. Rather than using rice paper they used what I believe to be wide rice noodles which were very thick and overpowered the rolls. In addition, we had to send the rolls back because two ingredients were missing - mint and cilantro. The meal was less than underwhelming and if that is a normal experience, then the average 4 star rating for this restaurant is very misguided. The only two positives were the wine and beer we selected. But at even that, the wine pour was less than optimal.
author: Tina B.

description: ordered delivery from this place on a Wednesday night, via eat24. estimated delivery time was an hour, but it was the only place serving spicy chicken noodle soup, which I needed for this horrible head cold I had. an hour and a half after placing my order, food hadn't shown up, so I called the restaurant. no answer. tried again. no answer. tried again. no answer. tried again. busy. tried again. busy. finally got through to someone and they put me on hold while they went to look for my order. someone else picks up the phone and makes me tell them again what the issue was. puts me on hold again. tells me that my food will be delivered in 5-10 minutes. 20 minutes later, delivery person calls me to tell me they can't bring the food up to my third floor apartment because they can't find parking, though people double park on my street all the time. so I have to go downstairs, sick as hell, to get the food. mind you, I had prepaid the delivery tip. then I see that they didn't even include any napkins or utensils. I complained via chat to eat24 but was offered no sympathy. will never order from here again. soup was too spicy to enjoy anyway.
author: Paige K.

description: It's nice to see places like that - bustling, modern with young enthusiastic crew as opposed to some tired looking Thai restaurants on every other corner of this city with King's portrait in the corner. Unfortunately, the cooking is just not there in my opinion, in fact I can hardly even associate it with Thai cuisine. I wish they would improve but chances are slim. Me and my Thai friend (who was bitterly disappointed in the food) ordered just two things: papaya salad (Somtum) and Hat Yai chicken. The first thing that came was a bowl of soggy sweat potato chips - totally unnecessary if you ask me. Somtum is a quintessential Thai dish, very simple and doesn't require cooking yet not easy to achieve perfect balance of sour, spicy, crunchy, fishy, sweet etc. When it's great, it's mind-blowing but in this country most of the time it's just a sad soggy salad. Farmhouse version of Somtum is nothing to write home about but at the very least there is an clumsy effort to make it right. Wrong chilies used (no excuse in the Bay area where Thai chilies are cheap and easily available), not enough fish sauce, garlic, lime juice. The chicken dish though is plain awful - overly sweet and not balanced. The boneless chicken cooked well but reminded me of some pseudo-italian chicken parmesan. Watery and cloyingly sweet curry is a cruel parody on Massaman curry of Thailand. Blue-died rice is just a gimmick (doesn't add anything to overcooked and flavorless rice). Cucumber instead of providing some relief from fried flavorless food is drenched in even more sweet dressing. My friend said it's an insult to Thai cooking. Next time, we will trot back to Sai Jay Thai in Tenderloin, grim neighborhood, plain setting, simple decor, no alcohol but so much better food!
author: Mikhail K.
